original: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four latent propensities that are included in the realm of desire.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: attachment, hostility, pride, and ignorance.

original: gzugs kyis thob pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyis thob pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three that are obtained in the realm of form.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o//🔽de bzhin du gzugs med la gsum dang / khams gsum la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal bcur 'gyur ro //🔽des na 'dod pas thob pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang bsgom pas spang bya rnams la rnam pa lngas grangs ci bzhin du bcu dang bdun dang brgyad dang bzhi dang ste bag la nyal sum cu so drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o// de bzhin du gzugs med la gsum dang / khams gsum la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal bcur 'gyur ro // des na 'dod pas thob pa'i sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang bsgom pas spang bya rnams la rnam pa lngas grangs ci bzhin du bcu dang bdun dang brgyad dang bzhi dang ste bag la nyal sum cu so drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: attachment, pride, and ignorance.🔽Similarly, there are three in the formless realm. Thus, there are ten latent propensities that are eliminated by the path of cultivation in the three realms.🔽Therefore, in the realm of desire, there are thirty-six latent propensities: ten that are eliminated by the path of seeing and twenty-six that are eliminated by the path of cultivation.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyis thob pa dgu dang drug dang bdun dang gsum dang ste bag la nyal sum cu so gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyis thob pa dgu dang drug dang bdun dang gsum dang ste bag la nyal sum cu so gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, in the realm of form, there are thirty-one latent propensities: nine that are eliminated by the path of seeing and twenty-two that are eliminated by the path of cultivation.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pas bsdus pa dgu dang drug dang drug dang bdun dang @144a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pas bsdus pa dgu dang drug dang drug dang bdun dang @144a * //
translated: Similarly, there are nine, six, six, seven, and three dormant states included in the formless realm.

original: gsum ste bag la nyal sum cu so gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum ste bag la nyal sum cu so gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are thirty-one dormant states.

original: des na 'di rnams khams dang rnam pa'i dbye ba tha dad pas sum cu so drug dang sum cu so gcig dang sum cu so gcig dang ste bag la nyal dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di rnams khams dang rnam pa'i dbye ba tha dad pas sum cu so drug dang sum cu so gcig dang sum cu so gcig dang ste bag la nyal dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, there are thirty-six, thirty-one, and thirty-one dormant states, respectively, because of the different classifications of realms and stages. Thus, there are ninety-eight dormant states.

original: de la 'khor ba'i sa dgu'i nang nas 'dod pa'i khams su bsgom pas spang bya bag la nyal bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'khor ba'i sa dgu'i nang nas 'dod pa'i khams su bsgom pas spang bya bag la nyal bzhi ste /
translated: Among the nine stages of cyclic existence, there are four dormant states in the desire realm that are to be eliminated by the path of cultivation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: attachment, anger, pride, and ignorance.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa la gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa la gsum ste /
translated: There are three dormant states on the stage of the first meditative concentration.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: attachment, pride, and ignorance.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa la gsum /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa la gsum /
translated: Similarly, there are three on the stage of the second meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa la gsum /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa la gsum /
translated: There are three on the stage of the fourth meditative concentration.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched sa la gsum /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched sa la gsum /
translated: There are three on the stage of the base of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched sa la gsum /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched sa la gsum /
translated: The base of infinite consciousness has three levels.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched sa la gsum /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched sa la gsum /
translated: The base of nothingness has three levels.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched sa la gsum /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched sa la gsum /
translated: The base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment has three levels.

original: bzhi dang gsum so brgyad de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bag la nyal nyi shu nyer brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi dang gsum so brgyad de bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bag la nyal nyi shu nyer brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are twenty-eight levels that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: yang 'dod pa'i khams su 'dod pa khong khro nga rgyal ma rig pa rnams pa zlums te /
analyzed: yang 'dod pa'i khams su 'dod pa khong khro nga rgyal ma rig pa rnams pa zlums te /
translated: Again, in the desire realm, desire, anger, pride and ignorance are combined.

original: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma rnam pa gsum du byas nas /
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring dang tha ma rnam pa gsum du byas nas /
translated: They are divided into three types: great, medium and small.

original: yang so sor chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i tha ma dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi tha ma dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chung du ste rnam pa dgur byas so //
analyzed: yang so sor chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i tha ma dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi tha ma dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chung du ste rnam pa dgur byas so //
translated: Again, each is divided into nine types: great of the great, medium of the great, small of the great, medium of the medium, small of the medium, great of the small, medium of the small, small of the small and very small of the small.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i sa la 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa zhes pa bag la nyal gsum po bsdoms te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i sa la 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa zhes pa bag la nyal gsum po bsdoms te /
translated: Likewise, the three dormant states of desire, pride and ignorance on the level of the first meditative concentration are combined.

original: sngon bzhin du rnam pa gsum du byas nas /
analyzed: sngon bzhin du rnam pa gsum du byas nas /
translated: As before, they are divided into three aspects.

original: yang de bzhin du so sor rnam pa gsum du byas pas dbye ba dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de bzhin du so sor rnam pa gsum du byas pas dbye ba dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, they are divided into three aspects each, making nine divisions.

original: de bzhin du sa gzhan bdun la dgu dgu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gzhan bdun la dgu dgu ste /
translated: Likewise, there are nine on each of the other seven levels.

original: 'khor ba'i sa dgu la dgu pa dgu ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sa dgu la dgu pa dgu ste /
translated: There are nine on the nine levels of samsara.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bag la nyal rab tu dbye ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bag la nyal rab tu dbye ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are eighty-one dormant states to be eliminated by the path of cultivation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam yang bzlog nas chung ngu 'bring chen po rnam pa gsum du byas nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yang bzlog nas chung ngu 'bring chen po rnam pa gsum du byas nas /
translated: The path of cultivation is also divided into three aspects: small, medium and great.

original: yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen @144b po'i 'bring po dang /
analyzed: yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen @144b po'i 'bring po dang /
translated: Again, each one is divided into three: small of the small, medium of the small, and great of the small; small of the medium, medium of the medium, and great of the medium; small of the great, medium of the great, and great of the great.

original: chen po'i chen po rnams 'khor ba'i sa dgu la dgu pa dgu ste /
analyzed: chen po'i chen po rnams 'khor ba'i sa dgu la dgu pa dgu ste /
translated: These nine are the nine levels of cyclic existence.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig gi gnyen po'i rab tu dbye ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig gi gnyen po'i rab tu dbye ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The antidotes to the eighty-one divisions of afflictions are also eighty-one in number.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams mang ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams mang ste /
translated: The secondary afflictions are numerous.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / bag med pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo dang / ma dad pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rang bzhin rnam par g-yeng ba dang /
analyzed: sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / bag med pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo dang / ma dad pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rang bzhin rnam par g-yeng ba dang /
translated: deception, arrogance, carelessness, resentment, craftiness, lack of faith, forgetfulness, lack of vigilance, distraction, natural distraction,

original: phyi rol rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa rnam pa du ma chos mngon pa las bshad do //
analyzed: phyi rol rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa rnam pa du ma chos mngon pa las bshad do //
translated: External distraction, internal distraction, distraction concerning the image, distraction concerning mental attention, and so on, are explained in the Abhidharma.

original: kun nas dkris pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are ten entanglements:

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa'o //
translated: sloth, sleep, excited speech, regret, envy, avarice, lack of conscience, shamelessness, anger, and concealment.

original: zag pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zag pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three contaminations:

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: the contamination of desire, the contamination of existence, and the contamination of ignorance.

original: de la 'dod pa'i zag pa rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i zag pa rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ste /
translated: The contamination of desire consists of forty-one substances:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: 'dod pa'i khams su sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa /
translated: the ten envelopers of the realm of desire that are associated with suffering,

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog  tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog  tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Attachment, anger, pride, the afflicted view of the self, wrong view, the view grasping an extreme, the esteeming of views, the esteeming of morality and asceticism,

original: the tshom ste dgu'o //
analyzed: the tshom ste dgu'o //
translated: and doubt.

original: kun 'byung gis bsdus pa /
analyzed: kun 'byung gis bsdus pa /
translated: Six are included in the truth of origin:🔽attachment, anger, pride, wrong view, the esteeming of views, and doubt.

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste drug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste drug go //
translated: Six are included in the truth of cessation.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pas bsdus pa drug go / lam gyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pas bsdus pa drug go / lam gyis bsdus pa /
translated: Seven are included in the truth of the path:

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste bdun no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste bdun no //
translated: attachment, anger, pride, wrong view, the esteeming of views, the esteeming of morality and asceticism, and doubt.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / zhen pa dang / kun nas dkris pa bcu dang ni /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / zhen pa dang / kun nas dkris pa bcu dang ni /
translated: The desire realm has forty-one substances: the five views, the five branch afflictions, the ten branch afflictions that are abandoned by the path of meditation—attachment, anger, pride, envy, stinginess,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: concealment,

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / @145a * //🔽ngo tsha ba med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa zhes pa ste 'dod pa'i zag pa rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / @145a * // ngo tsha ba med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa zhes pa ste 'dod pa'i zag pa rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig go //
translated: deception, dishonesty, violence, lethargy, sleep, excitation, regret, and doubt—🔽and the ten entanglements.

original: srid pa'i zag pa rdzas lnga bcu rtsa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa rdzas lnga bcu rtsa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The existence realm has fifty-two substances:🔽eight afflictions subsumed by the truth of suffering—attachment, pride, the afflicted view of the self, the view grasping an extreme, holding a view as paramount, holding ethics and religious rituals as paramount, and doubt—🔽and the five branch afflictions.

original: gzugs khams su sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: gzugs khams su sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa /
translated: The formless realm has forty-six substances:

original: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste brgyad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste brgyad do //
translated: the five views, the five branch afflictions, the eight branch afflictions that are abandoned by the path of meditation—attachment, pride, the afflicted view of the self, the view grasping an extreme, holding a view as paramount, holding ethics and religious rituals as paramount, and doubt—

original: kun 'byung gis thob pa /
analyzed: kun 'byung gis thob pa /
translated: and the ten entanglements.

original: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ste lnga'o //
translated: attachment, pride, false view, esteeming unworthy views, and doubt.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pas thob pa lnga dang / lam gyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pas thob pa lnga dang / lam gyis bsdus pa /
translated: Similarly, there are five that are obtained through cessation and six that are included in the path.

original: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom zhes pa ste drug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom zhes pa ste drug go //
translated: Attachment, pride, false view, esteeming unworthy views, esteeming morality and asceticism, and doubt.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal zhes pa ste nyi shu nyer drug go //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal zhes pa ste nyi shu nyer drug go //
translated: There are twenty that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation: attachment and pride.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pas bsdus pa nyi shu drug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pas bsdus pa nyi shu drug ste /
translated: Similarly, there are twenty-six that are included in the formless realm.

original: nyi shu nyer drug pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyi shu nyer drug pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two sets of twenty-six.

original: srid pa'i zag pa rdzas lnga bcu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa rdzas lnga bcu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Thus the contaminants of existence are fifty-two substances.

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa rdzas bco lnga ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa rdzas bco lnga ste /
translated: The contaminants of ignorance are fifteen substances.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma rig pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma rig pa lnga'o //
translated: There are five ignorances in the desire realm that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, origin, cessation and path and by meditation.

original: de bzhin du gzugs khams su lnga /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs khams su lnga /
translated: Similarly, there are five in the form realm.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su lnga ste ma rig pa'i zag pa rdzas bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su lnga ste ma rig pa'i zag pa rdzas bco lnga'o //
translated: Similarly, there are five in the formless realm. Thus there are fifteen substances of the contaminant of ignorance.

original: chu bo la bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chu bo la bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four floods:

original: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: the flood of desire, the flood of existence, the flood of view and the flood of ignorance.

original: de la 'dod pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu nyer dgu ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu nyer dgu ste /
translated: The flood of desire is twenty-nine substances.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod pas bsdus pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom ste bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas bsdus pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom ste bzhi'o //
translated: There are four that are subsumed by the desire realm and are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering: attachment, anger, pride and doubt.

original: de nyid kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / de bzhin du 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / de bzhin du la ma mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / bsgom pas spang bya 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: de nyid kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / de bzhin du 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / de bzhin du la ma mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / bsgom pas spang bya 'dod chags dang /
translated: Four are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, four are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, four are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path and four are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽

original: khong khro dang / nga rgyal te gsum mo //
analyzed: khong khro dang / nga rgyal te gsum mo //
translated: There are four to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, four to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, four to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, and three to be abandoned by the path of meditation: attachment, anger and pride.🔽There are seven to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the form realm:

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna @145b dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa ste /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna @145b dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa ste /
translated: sloth, sleep, excitation, regret, envy, avarice, shamelessness and lack of embarrassment.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa'i chu bo nyi shu nyer dgu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa'i chu bo nyi shu nyer dgu'o //
translated: There are twenty-nine in the desire realm.

original: srid pa'i chu bo rdzas nyi shu nyer brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i chu bo rdzas nyi shu nyer brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are twenty-eight substances in the flood of existence:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom ste 'di gsum ni sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom ste 'di gsum ni sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: attachment, pride and doubt that operate in the desire realm are subsumed by the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung gis bsdus pa gsum dang / de bzhin du 'gog pas bsdus pa gsum dang / de bzhin du lam gyis bsdus pa gsum dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal ste 'di rnams rdzas bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung gis bsdus pa gsum dang / de bzhin du 'gog pas bsdus pa gsum dang / de bzhin du lam gyis bsdus pa gsum dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal ste 'di rnams rdzas bcu bzhi'o //
translated: There are fourteen substances that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation: attachment and pride.

original: de rnams nyid ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa rdzas bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: de rnams nyid ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa rdzas bcu bzhi ste /
translated: Those same fourteen are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the formless realm.

original: bcu bzhi pa gnyis ni srid pa'i chu bo nyi shu nyer brgyad do //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa gnyis ni srid pa'i chu bo nyi shu nyer brgyad do //
translated: Thus there are twenty-eight substances that are the flood of existence.

original: lta ba'i chu bo rdzas sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i chu bo rdzas sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: There are thirty-six substances that are the flood of view.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa /
translated: In the desire realm, there are five that are subsumed by suffering:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa lnga'o //
translated: the afflicted view of the self, wrong view, extreme view, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme, and clinging to those as supreme.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyis bsdus pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyis bsdus pa lnga'o //
translated: Similarly, there are five that are subsumed by the form realm.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pas bsdus pa lnga ste 'di ni bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pas bsdus pa lnga ste 'di ni bco lnga'o //
translated: The same five are included in the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa gnyis ni kun 'byung gis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa gnyis ni kun 'byung gis bsdus pa ste /
translated: Two are included in the origin of suffering:

original: log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: wrong view and the esteeming of views.

original: de dag bzhin du gnyis ni gzugs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bzhin du gnyis ni gzugs kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Two are included in the form realm in the same way.

original: de dag bzhin du gnyis ni gzugs med pas bsdus pa ste 'di ni drug go /'gog pas bsdus pa ni drug po de nyid do //
analyzed: de dag bzhin du gnyis ni gzugs med pas bsdus pa ste 'di ni drug go /'gog pas bsdus pa ni drug po de nyid do //
translated: Two are included in the formless realm in the same way. These are the six.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa lam gyis bsdus pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa lam gyis bsdus pa /
translated: Three are included in the path of the desire realm:

original: log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa ste /
translated: wrong view, the esteeming of views, and the esteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: gsum dang / de nyid du gzugs na spyod pa gsum /
analyzed: gsum dang / de nyid du gzugs na spyod pa gsum /
translated: Three are included in the form realm in the same way.

original: de nyid gzugs med pa na spyod pa gsum ste dgu'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzugs med pa na spyod pa gsum ste dgu'o //
translated: Three are included in the formless realm in the same way. These are the nine.

original: 'di ni lta ba'i chu bo rdzas sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: 'di ni lta ba'i chu bo rdzas sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: These are the thirty-six substances of the river of views.

original: ma rig pa'i chu bo rdzas bco lnga ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i chu bo rdzas bco lnga ste 'di lta ste /
translated: The river of ignorance has fifteen substances.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bya ma rig pa lnga po de nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bya ma rig pa lnga po de nyid do //
translated: The five ignorances to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, and by cultivation, in the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyis bsdus pa lnga dang / de kho na bzhin du gzugs med pas bsdus pa lnga ste ma rig pa'i chu bo rdzas bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyis bsdus pa lnga dang / de kho na bzhin du gzugs med pas bsdus pa lnga ste ma rig pa'i chu bo rdzas bco lnga'o //
translated: Similarly, there are five in the form realm, and likewise five in the formless realm. Thus the river of ignorance has fifteen substances.

original: sbyor ba bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four yokes are as follows:🔽The desire yoke,

original: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i @146a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i @146a * //
translated: the existence yoke,

original: sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: the view yoke, and the ignorance yoke.

original: de la 'dod pa'i chu bo nyid 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i chu bo nyid 'dod pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The river of desire itself is the desire yoke.

original: srid pa'i chu bo nyid srid pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i chu bo nyid srid pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The river of existence itself is the existence yoke.

original: lta ba'i chu bo nyid lta ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i chu bo nyid lta ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The river of view itself is the view yoke.

original: ma rig pa'i chu bo nyid ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o zhes so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i chu bo nyid ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o zhes so //
translated: The river of ignorance itself is the ignorance yoke.

original: nye bar len pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four clingings are as follows:

original: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The appropriation of desire, the appropriation of views, the appropriation of morality and asceticism, and the appropriation of the doctrine of self.

original: de la 'dod pa'i chu bo nyid ma rig pa lnga dang bcas pas rdzas sum cu rtsa bzhi ni 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i chu bo nyid ma rig pa lnga dang bcas pas rdzas sum cu rtsa bzhi ni 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The appropriation of desire is the thirty-four substances consisting of the five ignorances and the flood of desire.

original: lta ba'i chu bo nyid tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa drug spangs pa rdzas sum cu ni lta ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i chu bo nyid tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa drug spangs pa rdzas sum cu ni lta ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The appropriation of views is the thirty substances consisting of the six kinds of overesteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa drug ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'o //🔽srid pa'i chu bo nyid gzugs kyis bsdus pa ma rig pa rnam pa lnga /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa drug ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa'o // srid pa'i chu bo nyid gzugs kyis bsdus pa ma rig pa rnam pa lnga /
translated: The appropriation of morality and asceticism is the six kinds of overesteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: gzugs med pas bsdus pa ma rig pa rnam pa lnga bcug ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa ma rig pa rnam pa lnga bcug ste /
translated: The appropriation of the doctrine of self is the fifty kinds of ignorance included in the realms of form and the formless.🔽The appropriation of the doctrine of self is the fifty kinds of ignorance included in the realms of form and the formless.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang bcas pas rdzas bzhi bcu ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang bcas pas rdzas bzhi bcu ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The forty substances along with torpor and sleep are the appropriators of the self of the proponents of substance.

original: mdud pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdud pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four knots are as follows:

original: ma rig pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / gnod sems kyi tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / 'di ni yod de zhes mngon par zhen pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / gnod sems kyi tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / 'di ni yod de zhes mngon par zhen pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa'o //
translated: the knot of the aggregate of ignorance, the knot of the aggregate of malice, the knot of the aggregate of holding morality and asceticism as supreme, and the knot of the aggregate of clinging to this as real.

original: sgrib pa ni lnga ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa ni lnga ste 'di lta ste /
translated: The five obscurations are as follows:

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs gnyid dang / rgod 'gyod dang the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs gnyid dang / rgod 'gyod dang the tshom mo //
translated: desire for sense objects, malice, torpor and sleep, excitation and regret, and doubt.

original: shes pa la bcu gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes pa la bcu gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The twelve knowledges are as follows:

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / gzhan sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / gzhan sems shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang /
translated: the cognition of phenomena, the subsequent cognition, the cognition of others' minds, the conventional cognition, the cognition of suffering, the cognition of origin, the cognition of cessation, the cognition of the path, the cognition of exhaustion,

original: mi skye ba shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa dang / legs par goms par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa dang / legs par goms par shes pa'o //
translated: the cognition of non-arising, the cognition of the way things are, and the cognition of thorough habituation.

original: bzod pa la brgyad ni 'di lta ste /🔽sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog @146b pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: bzod pa la brgyad ni 'di lta ste / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog @146b pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: The eight acceptances are as follows:🔽the acceptance of the cognition of phenomena with regard to suffering, the acceptance of the subsequent cognition with regard to suffering, the acceptance of the cognition of phenomena with regard to origin, the acceptance of the subsequent cognition with regard to origin, the acceptance of the cognition of phenomena with regard to cessation,

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: the acceptance of the subsequent cognition with regard to cessation, the acceptance of the cognition of phenomena with regard to the path, and the acceptance of the subsequent cognition with regard to the path.

original: de la sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The formations concomitant with mind are twofold:

original: spang bya dang / blang bya'o //
analyzed: spang bya dang / blang bya'o //
translated: those to be abandoned and those to be adopted.

original: de la gtso bo'i dngos kyi spang bya ni 'du byed la bcu bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gtso bo'i dngos kyi spang bya ni 'du byed la bcu bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The primary actual objects to be abandoned are the seventeen formations:

original: shin tu ma spangs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / bag med pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba dang / kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal dang /
analyzed: shin tu ma spangs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / bag med pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba dang / kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal dang /
translated: those that are not completely abandoned, harm, carelessness, lack of vigilance, unvirtuous roots, neutral roots, fetters, bonds, latent states,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang / sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang / sgrib pa'o //
translated: secondary afflictions, entanglements, contaminants, floods, bonds, appropriators, knots, and obscurations.

original: gtso bo ma yin pa yang nyon mongs pa la 'byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan dang sems pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang kun rdzob shes pa ni spang bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pa yang nyon mongs pa la 'byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan dang sems pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang kun rdzob shes pa ni spang bya'o //
translated: The non-primary are the arising of the afflictions, the afflictions, non-virtue, neutral states, intention, etc., which are contaminated, and conventional knowledge, which are to be abandoned.

original: blang bya'i 'du byed la nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blang bya'i 'du byed la nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The compositional factors to be adopted are twenty-four, as follows:

original: sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam rtog dang / spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam rtog dang / spyod pa dang /
translated: intention, contact, attention, aspiration, resolution, faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, discursive thought, investigation,

original: bag yod pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / yi rang ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / mi 'tsho ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang / rnam par grol ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: bag yod pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / yi rang ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / mi 'tsho ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang / rnam par grol ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: conscientiousness, renunciation, rejoicing, pliancy, non-harmfulness, shame, embarrassment, equanimity, liberation, roots of virtue,

original: shes pa dang / bzod pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / bzod pa'o //
translated: knowledge, and acceptance.

original: yang sems las byung ba'i 'du byed la rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang sems las byung ba'i 'du byed la rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are five types of formations dissociated from the mind:

original: sa chen po pa dang / dge ba'i sa chen po pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa dang / mi dge ba'i sa chen po pa dang / sa chung ngu pa'o //
analyzed: sa chen po pa dang / dge ba'i sa chen po pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa dang / mi dge ba'i sa chen po pa dang / sa chung ngu pa'o //
translated: those that occur on the great grounds, those that occur on the great virtuous grounds, those that occur on the great afflicted grounds, those that occur on the great unvirtuous grounds, and those that occur on the small grounds.

original: de la sems gang la thams cad 'byung ba de ni sa chen po pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems gang la thams cad 'byung ba de ni sa chen po pa'o //
translated: The great grounds are those that occur in all minds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / 'du shes dang / 'dun pa dang / reg pa dang / shes rab dang / dran pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / sems pa dang / 'du shes dang / 'dun pa dang / reg pa dang / shes rab dang / dran pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: feeling, conception, volition, contact, discernment, memory, mental focus, resolve, concentration, and attention.

original: sems gang la dus thams cad du dge ba 'byung ba de ni dge ba'i sa chen po pa ste bcu'o //
analyzed: sems gang la dus thams cad du dge ba 'byung ba de ni dge ba'i sa chen po pa ste bcu'o //
translated: The great virtuous grounds are those that occur in all virtuous minds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: dad pa dang / bag yod pa dang / shin tu sbyang pa dang / btang snyoms dang / @147a * //
analyzed: dad pa dang / bag yod pa dang / shin tu sbyang pa dang / btang snyoms dang / @147a * //
translated: faith, conscience, shame, absence of hatred, absence of malice, absence of jealousy, absence of miserliness, vigor, serenity, and nonviolence.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / ma chags pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi spang ba dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi 'tshe ba dang / brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / ma chags pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi spang ba dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi 'tshe ba dang / brtson 'grus so //
translated: shame, abashment, the root of virtue non-greed, the root of virtue non-hatred, the root of virtue non-delusion, non-violence, and vigor.

original: sems gang dus rtag tu nyon mongs pa can nyid 'byung ba de ni nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa ste drug go //
analyzed: sems gang dus rtag tu nyon mongs pa can nyid 'byung ba de ni nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa ste drug go //
translated: The mental factors that always occur in a defiled mind are called the great grounds of defilement. There are six of them:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rmongs pa dang / bag med pa dang / le lo dang / ma dad pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa dang / bag med pa dang / le lo dang / ma dad pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa'o //
translated: delusion, carelessness, laziness, lack of faith, torpor, and restlessness.

original: sems gang dag la dus rtag tu mi dge ba'i sems 'byung ba de dag ni mi dge ba'i sa chen po pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems gang dag la dus rtag tu mi dge ba'i sems 'byung ba de dag ni mi dge ba'i sa chen po pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mental factors that always occur in an unwholesome mind are called the great grounds of unwholesomeness. There are two of them:

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
translated: lack of shame and lack of abashment.

original: gang yid kyi sa  pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma rig pa tsam nyid kyis rab tu ldan pa de ni sa chung ngu pa ste bcu'o //
analyzed: gang yid kyi sa  pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma rig pa tsam nyid kyis rab tu ldan pa de ni sa chung ngu pa ste bcu'o //
