translated: When the bhikṣus say that there is another master, other than the Buddha, and another path of liberation, other than the path taught by the Buddha,

analyzed: dge 'dun phye bar 'gyur ba'o //

original: ci srid du dge 'dun phye nas /
analyzed: ci srid du dge 'dun phye nas /
translated: As long as the Saṅgha is divided,

original: gnas pa de srid du mnar med pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i sems skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa de srid du mnar med pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i sems skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as he remains, the virtuous thoughts of beings who are not noble ones, from the Avīci hell up to the peak of existence, will not arise.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo 'byed par 'gyur ba ni 'khor lo 'byed pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo 'byed par 'gyur ba ni 'khor lo 'byed pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the opening of the wheel of the Dharma by the Tathāgata is called the opening of the wheel.

original: 'khor lo 'byed pa 'di ni dge 'dun phye ba zhag tu mi gnas pa nyid de nges par dge 'dun mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'byed pa 'di ni dge 'dun phye ba zhag tu mi gnas pa nyid de nges par dge 'dun mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: This opening of the wheel is a schism in the Saṅgha that does not last, for the Saṅgha will certainly become harmonious again.

original: 'khor lo 'byed pa 'di dus drug tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo 'byed pa 'di dus drug tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro // 'di lta ste /
translated: This opening of the wheel does not occur in the six times.🔽What are the six times?

original: dang po chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor ba la ma yin /
analyzed: dang po chos kyi 'khor lo ma bskor ba la ma yin /
translated: First, it does not occur before the wheel of the Dharma has been turned.

original: tha mar bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su ma yin /
analyzed: tha mar bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su ma yin /
translated: Second, it does not occur at the time of the parinirvāṇa of the Blessed One.

original: bar du ci srid du sangs rgyas bstan pa la tshul khrims chu bur dang lta ba'i chu bur ma byung bar ma yin /
analyzed: bar du ci srid du sangs rgyas bstan pa la tshul khrims chu bur dang lta ba'i chu bur ma byung bar ma yin /
translated: Third, it does not occur in the interim, as long as the bubbles of morality and the bubbles of views have not arisen in the Buddha’s teaching.

original: ci srid du mchog zung nyan thos gnyis ma byung bar ma yin /
analyzed: ci srid du mchog zung nyan thos gnyis ma byung bar ma yin /
translated: It is not when the two chief disciples have not yet appeared.

original: @156a * // de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas ma yin /
analyzed: @156a * // de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas ma yin /
translated: It is not after the Tathagata has entered into parinirvana.

original: ci srid du mtshams ma bcad pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: ci srid du mtshams ma bcad pa las ma yin no //
translated: It is not when the boundary has not been established.

original: las 'byed pa yang dge slong brgyad dam rab tu mang po rnams gang gi tshe mtshams nang gcig tu 'tshogs pa med par las byed na'o //
analyzed: las 'byed pa yang dge slong brgyad dam rab tu mang po rnams gang gi tshe mtshams nang gcig tu 'tshogs pa med par las byed na'o //
translated: The schism is also not when the schismatic monk is alone, or when he is with a group of monks who are not in agreement.

original: sgra mi snyan pa spangs te gling gsum du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra mi snyan pa spangs te gling gsum du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The schism occurs in the three continents, excluding the Uttarakuru.

original: nye ba'i mtshams med pa'i las lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i mtshams med pa'i las lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five immediate actions are:

original: ma yin cing dgra bcom pa yang yin pa sun byung ba dang / nges pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsad pa dang / bslab pa'i gang zag bsad pa dang / mchod rten bshig pa dang / dge 'dun gyi 'tsho ba'i sgo 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin cing dgra bcom pa yang yin pa sun byung ba dang / nges pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsad pa dang / bslab pa'i gang zag bsad pa dang / mchod rten bshig pa dang / dge 'dun gyi 'tsho ba'i sgo 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: to cause a schism in the Sangha, to kill one’s mother, to kill one’s father, to kill an arhat, and to cause a Buddha to bleed.

original: nye ba'i mtshams med las 'di la ma nges pa'i zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: nye ba'i mtshams med las 'di la ma nges pa'i zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the schism is not definite in the case of the immediate action of schism.

original: yang dge ba'i las rnam pa gsum ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dge ba'i las rnam pa gsum ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are also three types of virtuous karma:

original: bsod nams kyi cha dang mthun pa dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi cha dang mthun pa dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: those that are conducive to merit, those that are conducive to liberation, and those that are conducive to penetrative insight.

original: yang las gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang las gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are also three types of karma:

original: las 'ga' zhig byas shing mi 'phel ba dang / las 'ga' zhig ma byas shing 'phel ba dang / las 'ga' zhig byas shing 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: las 'ga' zhig byas shing mi 'phel ba dang / las 'ga' zhig ma byas shing 'phel ba dang / las 'ga' zhig byas shing 'phel ba'o //
translated: some karma is committed but does not increase, some karma is not committed but increases, and some karma is committed and increases.

original: yang las rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang las rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are also three types of karma:

original: mtha' gcig tu gnag pa'i las dang / mtha' gcig tu dkar ba'i las dang / rnam par 'dres pa'i las so //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu gnag pa'i las dang / mtha' gcig tu dkar ba'i las dang / rnam par 'dres pa'i las so //
translated: karma that is entirely negative, karma that is entirely positive, and mixed karma.

original: yang las rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang las rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are also three types of karma:

original: ltung bya dang / spang bya dang / brten bya'o //
analyzed: ltung bya dang / spang bya dang / brten bya'o //
translated: downfalls, things to be abandoned, and things to rely on.

original: yang las rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang las rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are also five types of karma:

original: byas pa'i las dang / byed du bcug pa'i las dang / mngon par rjes su yi rang ba'i las dang / yang dag par rjes su gnang ba'i las dang / rjes su gnang ba'i las so //
analyzed: byas pa'i las dang / byed du bcug pa'i las dang / mngon par rjes su yi rang ba'i las dang / yang dag par rjes su gnang ba'i las dang / rjes su gnang ba'i las so //
translated: 1. action that is done, 2. action that is caused to be done, 3. action that is rejoiced in, 4. action that is approved, 5. action that is permitted.

original: yang las rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang las rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, action is of two kinds:

original: rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin gyi las dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi las so //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin gyi las dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi las so //
translated: 1. action that is by nature informative, 2. action that is by nature non-informative.

original: de la rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin gyi las la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin gyi las la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: As for action that is by nature informative, it is of two kinds:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'o //
translated: 1. virtuous, 2. non-virtuous.

original: de la mi dge ba la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: As for non-virtuous action, it is of two kinds:

original: lus kyi dang / ngag gi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dang / ngag gi'o //
translated: 1. bodily, 2. verbal.

original: de la lus kyi rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: As for bodily action, it is of three kinds:

original: srog bcod  pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: srog bcod  pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa'o //
translated: 1. killing, 2. taking what has not been given, 3. sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngag gi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: As for verbal action, it is of four kinds:

original: brdzun smra ba dang / dbyen gyi ngag dang / rtsub po'i ngag dang / ngag rkyal pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun smra ba dang / dbyen gyi ngag dang / rtsub po'i ngag dang / ngag rkyal pa'o //
translated: Lying, divisive speech, harsh speech, and idle speech.

original: dge ba yang rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba yang rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The wholesome is also twofold:

original: @156b lus kyi dang ngag gi'o //
analyzed: @156b lus kyi dang ngag gi'o //
translated: bodily and verbal.

original: de la lus kyi rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the three types of bodily [action] are:

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: refraining from killing, refraining from stealing, and refraining from sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gi yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ngag gi yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four types of verbal [action] are:

original: brdzun smra ba las ldog pa dang / dbyen gyi ngag las ldog pa dang / rtsub po'i ngag las ldog pa dang / ngag kyal pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun smra ba las ldog pa dang / dbyen gyi ngag las ldog pa dang / rtsub po'i ngag las ldog pa dang / ngag kyal pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: refraining from lying, refraining from divisive speech, refraining from harsh speech, and refraining from idle speech.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of non-indicative [action] is twofold:

original: mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: following the unwholesome and following the wholesome.

original: de la mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the two types of following the unwholesome are:

original: lus kyi mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ngag gi mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ngag gi mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: It is the following of bodily nonvirtue and the following of verbal nonvirtue.

original: de la lus kyi mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The following of bodily nonvirtue is threefold:

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar 'phen par byed cing 'dzin par byed pa'i 'byung ba chen po nye bar blangs te 'jug par byed pa na sems rnam par 'khrug pa yin yang srog gcod pa las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar 'phen par byed cing 'dzin par byed pa'i 'byung ba chen po nye bar blangs te 'jug par byed pa na sems rnam par 'khrug pa yin yang srog gcod pa las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can
translated: When one engages in the great elements that project and hold the past, future, and present, even if one’s mind is disturbed, one is not separated from the nature of following the taking of life.

original: ni mi ldog pa'i sngon du rnam par chad pa med par rgyu bzhin pa'i las so //
analyzed: ni mi ldog pa'i sngon du rnam par chad pa med par rgyu bzhin pa'i las so //
translated: The action that is not interrupted before the separation of the body is the action that is in the process of occurring.

original: de kho na bzhin du ma byin par len pa las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du 'dod pas log par g-yem pa la mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du ma byin par len pa las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du 'dod pas log par g-yem pa la mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: In the same way, one is not separated from the nature of following the taking of what is not given and one is not separated from the nature of following sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gi mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngag gi mi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four types of verbal nonvirtuous action are as follows:

original: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du dbyen tshig las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du tshig rtsub mo las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du dbyen tshig las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du tshig rtsub mo las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can dang /
translated: The nature of one who is not detached from lying, the nature of one who is not detached from divisive speech, the nature of one who is not detached from harsh speech,

original: de bzhin du ngag kyal pa las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag kyal pa las mi ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: and the nature of one who is not detached from idle chatter.

original: dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yang rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba yang rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The two types of virtuous action are as follows:

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa las sdog pa yang dag par blangs pa thob pa dang / rtag tu mchod rten byed pa la sogs pa yang dag par blangs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa las sdog pa yang dag par blangs pa thob pa dang / rtag tu mchod rten byed pa la sogs pa yang dag par blangs pa thob pa'o //
translated: The nature of one who has obtained the vow of restraint from killing and so on, and the nature of one who has obtained the vow of restraint from making images of the Buddha and so on.

original: de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i yang dag par blangs pa thob pa rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog pa'i yang dag par blangs pa thob pa rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The two types of acquisition of the vow to abstain from taking life and so on are:🔽1. that which accompanies physical virtue, and

original: lus kyi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ngag gi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o//
analyzed: lus kyi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ngag gi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o//
translated: 2. that which accompanies verbal virtue.

original: @157a * // de la lus kyi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnams pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @157a * // de la lus kyi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnams pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: That which accompanies physical virtue is threefold:

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa yang dag par blangs pa'i de ma thag nas bzung ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa yang dag par blangs pa'i de ma thag nas bzung ste /
translated: From the moment one acquires the vow to abstain from taking life,

original: ci srid du 'phangs pa de srid du rnam par chad pa med par sems rnam par 'khrugs pa yin yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba 'phen par byed pa dang 'dzin par byed pa'i 'byung ba chen po nye bar blangs te /
analyzed: ci srid du 'phangs pa de srid du rnam par chad pa med par sems rnam par 'khrugs pa yin yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba 'phen par byed pa dang 'dzin par byed pa'i 'byung ba chen po nye bar blangs te /
translated: as long as one does not give it up, one takes up the great elements that project and hold the body in the past, present, and future, even when the mind is disturbed and distracted.

original: ldog pa ma yin pa'i sngon du 'jug par byed pa rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can gyi las dang / de bzhin du ma byin par len pa las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du 'dod pas log par spyod pa las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can no //🔽dag gi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ldog pa ma yin pa'i sngon du 'jug par byed pa rjes su 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can gyi las dang / de bzhin du ma byin par len pa las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du 'dod pas log par spyod pa las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can no // dag gi dge ba'i rjes su 'gro ba rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four kinds of virtue that are related to abstention are abstention from killing, which is related to the activity of not harming any living being; abstention from taking what is not given, which is related to the activity of giving; abstention from sexual misconduct, which is related to the activity of chastity;🔽and abstention from false speech, which is related to the activity of truthfulness.

original: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du dbyen gyi tshig las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du tshig rtsub mo las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du brdzun du smra ba las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du dbyen gyi tshig las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can dang / de bzhin du tshig rtsub mo las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can dang /
translated: The four kinds of virtue that are related to the practice of good are the practice of truthfulness, which is related to the activity of abstention from false speech; the practice of harmony, which is related to the activity of abstention from divisive speech; the practice of gentleness, which is related to the activity of abstention from harsh speech;

original: de bzhin du ngag kyal pa las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag kyal pa las ldog pa'i rjes su 'brel ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: and the practice of helpfulness, which is related to the activity of abstention from idle chitchat.

original: rtag tu mchod rten byed pa la sogs pa yang dag par blangs pa thob pa ni rnam pa mang ste /
analyzed: rtag tu mchod rten byed pa la sogs pa yang dag par blangs pa thob pa ni rnam pa mang ste /
translated: There are many who have taken up the practice of always making offerings to stupas and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽ci srid 'tsho'i bar du nyin re bzhin mchod rten nam dkyil 'khor dang sangs rgyas mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas zas bza' ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams bya'o zhes yid dam blangs nas sems 'khrul pa yin yang sngon bzhin du dge ba'i rjes su 'brel
analyzed: 'di lta ste / ci srid 'tsho'i bar du nyin re bzhin mchod rten nam dkyil 'khor dang sangs rgyas mchod pa la sogs pa byas nas zas bza' ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams bya'o zhes yid dam blangs nas sems 'khrul pa yin yang sngon bzhin du dge ba'i rjes su 'brel
translated: They are as follows:🔽For as long as they live, they eat food and so on after making offerings to stupas, mandalas, buddhas, and so on every day.

original: ba'i bdag nyid can ni /
analyzed: ba'i bdag nyid can ni /
translated: Even though their minds are confused, they are like those previously described who are endowed with virtue.

original: sdom pa nyid ma yin /
analyzed: sdom pa nyid ma yin /
translated: They are not vows.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: They are not the nature of nonvows.

original: ci srid du 'phags pa mi ldog pa'i sngon du 'jug par byed pa'i las so //🔽de la las rnams kyi kun nas bslang ba dang dmigs pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: ci srid du 'phags pa mi ldog pa'i sngon du 'jug par byed pa'i las so // de la las rnams kyi kun nas bslang ba dang dmigs pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: They are the karma that causes one to enter the path of the aryas.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa de bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The root of affliction is incorrect attention, which is conceptualization that is not suchness.

original: de la rgyu gsum gyis las byed de /
analyzed: de la rgyu gsum gyis las byed de /
translated: The action is performed by three causes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: yang dag ma yin pa'i rtog pas phyi nang zhes rnam par rtog pa las dang / brtan pa bde ba bdag gi bdag ces pa la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa las dang / bya ba'i las kyi yon tan mthong ba las so //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin pa'i rtog pas phyi nang zhes rnam par rtog pa las dang / brtan pa bde ba bdag gi bdag ces pa la sogs pa sgro 'dogs pa las dang / bya ba'i las kyi yon tan mthong ba las so //
translated: from the discrimination of external and internal due to incorrect conceptualization, from the superimposition of “stable, happy, mine, self,” and so on, and from seeing the qualities of the action to be done.

original: byas pa'i las kyi mjug rdzogs par byed pa @157b ni rnam pa mang ngo //
analyzed: byas pa'i las kyi mjug rdzogs par byed pa @157b ni rnam pa mang ngo //
translated: The completion of the conclusion of the action that is done is manifold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: las byas pa la yongs su mgu ba dang phan yon sgrogs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las byas pa la yongs su mgu ba dang phan yon sgrogs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: being satisfied with the action done, proclaiming the benefits, and so on.

original: 'dir las byed pa po gang zag gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dir las byed pa po gang zag gsum ste /
translated: Here, there are three types of persons who perform the action.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽sdom ldan ma yin pa dang / sdom ldan dang / sdom ldan nyid ma yin /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / sdom ldan ma yin pa dang / sdom ldan dang / sdom ldan nyid ma yin /

analyzed: sdom ldan min pa ma yin pa'o //

original: de la sdom ldan ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sdom ldan ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sdom ldan ma yin pa dang / don la sdom ldan ma yin pa'o //
translated: those who are naturally not endowed with vows and those who are not endowed with vows in fact.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis sdom ldan ma yin pa rnam pa bcu bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis sdom ldan ma yin pa rnam pa bcu bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The fourteen types of people who are not naturally restrained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:🔽butchers, hunters, pig farmers, bird hunters, fishermen, thieves, executioners, prison guards, elephant handlers,

original: lug 'tshong pa dang / khyi rngon pa dang / phag 'tshong ba dang / bya rngon pa dang / sha 'tshong pa dang / ri dvags rngon pa dang / nya pa dang / rkun po dang / gshed ma dang / btson srung ba dang / glang po che 'dzin pa dang /🔽glang po che 'dul ba dang / rang 'tshed pa dang / dra ba can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lug 'tshong pa dang / khyi rngon pa dang / phag 'tshong ba dang / bya rngon pa dang / sha 'tshong pa dang / ri dvags rngon pa dang / nya pa dang / rkun po dang / gshed ma dang / btson srung ba dang / glang po che 'dzin pa dang / glang po che 'dul ba dang / rang 'tshed pa dang / dra ba can la sogs pa'o //
translated: elephant trainers, actors, magicians, prostitutes, and those who make traps and snares.

original: don la sdom ldan ma yin pa ni rnam pa gsum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don la sdom ldan ma yin pa ni rnam pa gsum la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who are not restrained in terms of the object are of three types and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rgyal po dang / chad pa len pa dang / nyo tshong pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / chad pa len pa dang / nyo tshong pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: kings, judges, and merchants and so on.

original: sdom pa can ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sdom pa can ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: Those who are restrained are of ten types.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / bya rog skrod byed pa dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / bar slob ma dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / bsnyen gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / bya rog skrod byed pa dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / bar slob ma dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / bsnyen gnas pa'o //
translated: the male and female lay practitioners, the male and female novices, the male and female postulants, and the fully ordained monks and nuns.

original: de la dge bsnyen la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dge bsnyen la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The male lay practitioner is of two types:

original: yan lag gsum rdzogs pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag gsum rdzogs pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: one who has taken the three refuges and one who has taken the three refuges and undertakes the precepts.

original: de la bslab pa'i gzhi lnga can la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bslab pa'i gzhi lnga can la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The one who has taken the three refuges and undertakes the precepts is of two types:

original: rang gi bud med kyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bud med kyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: one who is satisfied with his own wife and one who is celibate.

original: dge bsnyen ma yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma yang rnam pa gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The female lay practitioner is of two types:

original: yan lag gsum rdzogs pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi lnga can no //🔽de la bslab pa'i gzhi lnga 'dzin pa mo la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yan lag gsum rdzogs pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi lnga can no // de la bslab pa'i gzhi lnga 'dzin pa mo la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: one who has taken the three refuges and one who has taken the three refuges and undertakes the precepts.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The one who has taken the three refuges and undertakes the precepts is of two types:

original: rang gi bdag pos chog par 'dzin pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag pos chog par 'dzin pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: one who is satisfied with her own husband and one who is celibate.

original: de la yan lag gsum rdzogs pa'i yan lag gsum ni /
analyzed: de la yan lag gsum rdzogs pa'i yan lag gsum ni /
translated: The three limbs that are complete are:

original: sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / chos la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / chos la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: going for refuge to the Buddha, going for refuge to the Dharma, and going for refuge to the Saṅgha.

original: yan lag lnga rdzogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yan lag lnga rdzogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five bases of training that are complete are as follows:

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa las ldog pa @158a * //
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa las ldog pa @158a * //
translated: refraining from killing, refraining from stealing, refraining from sexual misconduct,

original: dang / brdzun du smra ba las ldog pa dang / 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang /
analyzed: dang / brdzun du smra ba las ldog pa dang / 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang /
translated: refraining from lying, and refraining from drinking alcohol,

original: bag med pa'i gnas las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnas las ldog pa'o //
translated: which is the basis for heedlessness.

original: tshangs par spyod pas ni 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'i gnas su mi tshangs par spyod pa las ldog pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pas ni 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'i gnas su mi tshangs par spyod pa las ldog pa zhes brjod do //
translated: By celibacy, one refrains from sexual misconduct, the basis for sexual activity.

original: de bzhin du dge bsnyen ma rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge bsnyen ma rnams kyi'o //
translated: The same applies to the lay vow holders.

original: dge tshul rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bcu ste /
analyzed: dge tshul rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bcu ste /
translated: The ten bases of training for novices are as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa las ldog pa dang / brdzun du smra ba las ldog pa dang / 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang /🔽bag  med pa'i gnas las ldog pa dang / khri stan mthon po dang khri stan chen po las ldog pa dang / gar dang glu dang rtsed 'jo lta ba las ldog pa dang / dri dang phreng ba byug pa mdog sgyur ba 'dzin pa las ldog pa dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa las ldog pa dang / brdzun du smra ba las ldog pa dang / 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang / bag  med pa'i gnas las ldog pa dang / khri stan mthon po dang khri stan chen po las ldog pa dang / gar dang glu dang rtsed 'jo lta ba las ldog pa dang / dri dang phreng ba byug pa mdog sgyur ba 'dzin pa las ldog pa dang /
translated: Refraining from killing, refraining from stealing, refraining from impure conduct, refraining from lying, refraining from alcohol,

original: dus ma yin pa'i kha zas las ldog pa dang / gser dang dngul so sor 'dzin pa las ldog pa'o //🔽dge tshul ma rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bcu ni /
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i kha zas las ldog pa dang / gser dang dngul so sor 'dzin pa las ldog pa'o // dge tshul ma rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bcu ni /
translated: refraining from dancing, singing, music, and so on, refraining from wearing garlands, perfumes, and makeup, refraining from sleeping on high and luxurious beds, refraining from eating at improper times, and refraining from accepting gold and silver.

original: de rnams nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams nyid bzhin no //
translated: The ten precepts of the novice nun are the same as those.

original: bar slob ma rnams kyi ni dge tshul ma rnams las lhag pa'i chos gnyis ni 'di lta ste /🔽chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: bar slob ma rnams kyi ni dge tshul ma rnams las lhag pa'i chos gnyis ni 'di lta ste /🔽chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: The two additional precepts for the female postulant are:🔽To not use oil for anointing the body and to not eat meat.

original: de la chos la rnam pa drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la chos la rnam pa drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The six types of Dharma are as follows:

original: gcig pur grong du mi 'gro ba dang / gcig pur chu'i pha rol du mi bsgral ba dang / skyes pa la mi reg pa dang / skyes pa dang mtshams gcig tu mi gnas pa dang / smyan byed pa mi bya ba dang / kha na ma thob mi sbed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pur grong du mi 'gro ba dang / gcig pur chu'i pha rol du mi bsgral ba dang / skyes pa la mi reg pa dang / skyes pa dang mtshams gcig tu mi gnas pa dang / smyan byed pa mi bya ba dang / kha na ma thob mi sbed pa'o //
translated: not going to the village alone, not crossing a body of water alone, not touching a man, not staying in the same place as a man, not acting as a matchmaker, and not concealing downfalls.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos la yang rnam pa drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos la yang rnam pa drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The six types of concordant Dharma are as follows:

original: gser dngul la mi reg pa dang / mgo'i 'og lus kyi spu 'byid par mi bya ba dang / sa rko bar mi bya ba dang / sngon po nyams par mi bya ba dang / byin len ma byas pa'i zas mi bza' ba dang / mtshan ma gzhag pa'i zas mi bza' ba'o //
analyzed: gser dngul la mi reg pa dang / mgo'i 'og lus kyi spu 'byid par mi bya ba dang / sa rko bar mi bya ba dang / sngon po nyams par mi bya ba dang / byin len ma byas pa'i zas mi bza' ba dang / mtshan ma gzhag pa'i zas mi bza' ba'o //
translated: not touching gold and silver, not shaving the hair on the body below the navel, not digging the earth, not damaging green plants, not eating food that has not been offered, and not eating food that has been set aside.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten types of full ordination.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rang byung nyid kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: rang byung nyid kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: Full ordination by oneself is that of a perfect Buddha and a solitary Buddha.

original: nges par bgrod pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa kun shes koo ndi n+ya dang rta thul dang mdzes bzang dang rlangs pa dang ming chen rnams lnga ste /
analyzed: nges par bgrod pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa kun shes koo ndi n+ya dang rta thul dang mdzes bzang dang rlangs pa dang ming chen rnams lnga ste /
translated: The five who were fully ordained by the definite procedure were Kaundinya, Ashvajit, Bhadrika, Vashpa, and Maha-nama.

original: ston pa'i bya ba mang du byed pa'i dge slong rnams so //
analyzed: ston pa'i bya ba mang du byed pa'i dge slong rnams so //
translated: They were fully ordained by the Buddha's command.

original: dge slong dag tshur shog ces pas bsnyen par @158b rdzogs pa grags pa la sogs pa rigs kyi bu drug cu rnams so //
analyzed: dge slong dag tshur shog ces pas bsnyen par @158b rdzogs pa grags pa la sogs pa rigs kyi bu drug cu rnams so //
translated: The sixty sons of good family, such as Yashah, were fully ordained by the Buddha's command, Come, monks!🔽The fully ordained by accepting the teacher were Maha-Kashyapa and Udayi, who were fully ordained by answering questions.

original: ston pa khas blangs pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa 'od srungs chen po dang / dris lan gyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa 'char ka dang / bla ma'i chos khas blangs pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo'o //
analyzed: ston pa khas blangs pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa 'od srungs chen po dang / dris lan gyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa 'char ka dang / bla ma'i chos khas blangs pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo'o //
translated: The fully ordained by accepting the Dharma of the guru was Maha-prajapati.

original: pho nyas bsnyan par rdzogs pa chos kyis byin pa'i dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: pho nyas bsnyan par rdzogs pa chos kyis byin pa'i dge slong ma'o //
translated: The fully ordained by messenger was the nun Dharma-datta.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa lngas bsnyen par rdzogs pa mtha' kho na skye bo'i yul du'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa lngas bsnyen par rdzogs pa mtha' kho na skye bo'i yul du'o //
translated: The fully ordained by the five holders of the Vinaya was in the border regions.

original: bcu 'tshogs pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa yul dbus su'o //
analyzed: bcu 'tshogs pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa yul dbus su'o //
translated: Ordination by a group of ten in a central region.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba lan gsum brjod pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa bzang po la sogs pa'i drug cu'o //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba lan gsum brjod pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa bzang po la sogs pa'i drug cu'o //
translated: Ordination by reciting the formula for taking refuge three times, as in the case of the sixty monks beginning with Bhadra.

original: yang na bsnyen par rdzogs pa rnam pa brgyad de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang na bsnyen par rdzogs pa rnam pa brgyad de / 'di lta ste /
translated: Or, ordination is of eight types:🔽Ordination by oneself, as in the case of the Buddha.🔽Ordination by going for refuge, as in the case of the first five disciples.🔽Ordination by messenger, as in the case of the nun Mettiyā.

original: rang byung gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gsum la skyabs su song bas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / pho nyas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / nges pa rnam par bgrod pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / dge slong tshur shog gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: rang byung gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gsum la skyabs su song bas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / pho nyas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / nges pa rnam par bgrod pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / dge slong tshur shog gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang /
translated: Ordination by traveling to a place where the ordination can be performed, as in the case of the monks of Kosambī.🔽Ordination by the command “Come forth,” as in the case of the monk Upāli.🔽Ordination by accepting the discipline, as in the case of the monk Chunda.🔽Ordination by gratitude, as in the case of the monk Nanda.

original: ston pa khas blangs pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / drin lan gyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gsol ba dang bzhi pa'i las dang gegs med pa lnga pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa khas blangs pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / drin lan gyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gsol ba dang bzhi pa'i las dang gegs med pa lnga pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Ordination by the rite of requesting and the fourfold proclamation, as in the case of the monk Rāhula.

original: rab tu byung ba rnam pa gsum ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnam pa gsum ste /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: There are three types of going forth:

original: yang dag par blangs pa thob pa dang / lhag par rtogs pa thob pa dang / nges par mthong ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa thob pa dang / lhag par rtogs pa thob pa dang / nges par mthong ba thob pa'o //
translated: the acquisition of the vow, the acquisition of the special qualities, and the acquisition of the definite vision.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i rgyu bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i rgyu bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four causes of full ordination are:

original: dge 'dun gyi tshogs rnams kun du rdzogs pa dang / mtshams bcings pa dang / gsol ba byed pa po tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / bar chad kyi chos rnams med pa dang / las dam pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi tshogs rnams kun du rdzogs pa dang / mtshams bcings pa dang / gsol ba byed pa po tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / bar chad kyi chos rnams med pa dang / las dam pa'o //
translated: the complete assembly of the Sangha, the establishment of the boundary, the presence of a monk who can perform the ordination, and the absence of obstacles.

original: dge slong gi phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The perfection of a monk is fourfold:

original: cha lug phun sum tshogs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: cha lug phun sum tshogs pa dang / las phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gnas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of his robes, the perfection of his actions, the perfection of his thoughts, and the perfection of his dwelling.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyi bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyi bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The full ordination of a nun is twofold:

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las lan gsum brjod pa dang / bla ma'i tshos khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las lan gsum brjod pa dang / bla ma'i tshos khas blangs pas so //
translated: the recitation of the three sets of seven precepts, and the acceptance of the eight gurudharmas.

original: de la bla ma'i chos brgyad ni /
analyzed: de la bla ma'i chos brgyad ni /
translated: The eight concerns of the guru are as follows.🔽🔽

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight rules for nuns are as follows:🔽A nun should not request full ordination.

original: bud med rnams ni dge slong gi gzhi las rab tu byung bar bya ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong ma'i dngos po yang re bar @159a * //🔽bya ba ni bla ma'i chos dang po'o //🔽dge slong mas zla ba phyed phyed cing gzhi dge slong las yang dag par gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa btsal bar bya'o zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bud med rnams ni dge slong gi gzhi las rab tu byung bar bya ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong ma'i dngos po yang re bar @159a * // bya ba ni bla ma'i chos dang po'o // dge slong mas zla ba phyed phyed cing gzhi dge slong las yang dag par gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa btsal bar bya'o zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: A nun should not request full ordination from a monk.

original: dge slong mas dge slong med pa'i gnas su dbyar gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong med pa'i gnas su dbyar gnas par khas blang bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: A nun should not spend the rainy season in a place where there are no monks.

original: dbyar gnas byas pa'i dge slong mas dge 'dun gnyis pa gnas gsum gyi bar du 'chags pa byas te /
analyzed: dbyar gnas byas pa'i dge slong mas dge 'dun gnyis pa gnas gsum gyi bar du 'chags pa byas te /
translated: A nun who has completed the rainy season should invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three matters:

original: mthong bas dang thos pas dang dogs pas so zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas dang thos pas dang dogs pas so zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: what she has seen, what she has heard, and what she suspects.

original: yang dge slong mas dge slong gi rgyud smra ba dang dran par mi bya ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong mas dge slong gi rgyud smra ba dang dran par mi bya ste /
translated: A nun should not accuse a monk of an offense.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The fifth is:

original: tshul khrims rgud pa dang / lta ba'i rgud pa dang / kun du spyod pa rgud pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par rgud pa'o zhes pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rgud pa dang / lta ba'i rgud pa dang / kun du spyod pa rgud pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par rgud pa'o zhes pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: the degeneration of morality, the degeneration of view, the degeneration of conduct, and the degeneration of livelihood.🔽The sixth is:

original: dge slong mas dge slong khro bar mi bya sdang bar mi bya zhes pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong khro bar mi bya sdang bar mi bya zhes pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: a nun should not be angry or hostile toward a monk.🔽The seventh is:

original: bla ma'i chos kyi ltung ba byung ba'i dge slong mas dge 'dun gnyi ga la zla ba phyed du dgu pa spyad par bya'o zhes pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i chos kyi ltung ba byung ba'i dge slong mas dge 'dun gnyi ga la zla ba phyed du dgu pa spyad par bya'o zhes pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: a nun who has committed a downfall related to the fundamental precepts should practice probation for half a month in both communities.🔽The eighth is:

original: bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya ba'i dge slong mas bsnyen par rdzogs nas nyin gcig pa'i dge slong la gus par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur dang thal mo sbyar ba'i las dang mnyam du ldang ba'i las rnams bya'o zhes pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya ba'i dge slong mas bsnyen par rdzogs nas nyin gcig pa'i dge slong la gus par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur dang thal mo sbyar ba'i las dang mnyam du ldang ba'i las rnams bya'o zhes pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: a nun who has been fully ordained for a hundred years should bow down to a monk who has been fully ordained for a day, and should do acts of respect and reverence for him, and acts of deference such as standing up for him.

original: dge slong rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three kinds of monks:

analyzed: slong ba'i dang tshul gyi dge slong dang / nyon mongs bcom pa'i dge slong dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong ngo //

original: phas pham pa'i ltung ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phas pham pa'i ltung ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the downfall that is a root downfall.🔽The downfall that is a misdeed is

original: bshags par bya ba ni nyes byas kyi ltung bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba ni nyes byas kyi ltung bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: the downfall that is included in the class of minor infractions.

original: ltung ba gzhan rnams ni yang dag par bsdam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba gzhan rnams ni yang dag par bsdam par bya ba'o //
translated: The other downfalls are downfalls that are violations of an edict.

original: gang zag 'bring ba'i dbang du byas nas phas pham pa'i ltung ba la lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang zag 'bring ba'i dbang du byas nas phas pham pa'i ltung ba la lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: From the perspective of the person of medium faculties, the five root downfalls are as follows:🔽The root downfall of stealing the property of the Three Jewels;

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi nor 'phrog pa'i phas pham pa'i ltung ba dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba phas pham pa'i ltung ba @161a * //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi nor 'phrog pa'i phas pham pa'i ltung ba dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba phas pham pa'i ltung ba @161a * //
translated: the root downfall of abandoning the sublime teaching;

original: dang / dge slong tshul khrims 'chal pa yin kyang ser po phrog pa'am brdung ba'am btson khang du 'dzud pa'am gsod pa'am rab tu byung ba ldog pa ste phas pham pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: dang / dge slong tshul khrims 'chal pa yin kyang ser po phrog pa'am brdung ba'am btson khang du 'dzud pa'am gsod pa'am rab tu byung ba ldog pa ste phas pham pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: the root downfall of beating, imprisoning, fining, or otherwise harming a monk who has violated his vows, even if he is a fully ordained monk, or causing him to give up his ordination;

original: mtshams med lnga la gang rung byed pa phas pham pa'i ltung ba dang / lta ba log par 'dzin pa'ang phas pham pa'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams med lnga la gang rung byed pa phas pham pa'i ltung ba dang / lta ba log par 'dzin pa'ang phas pham pa'i ltung ba'o //
translated: The downfalls of a bodhisattva who is an ordinary being are five deeds of immediate retribution and holding a wrong view.🔽The downfalls of a bodhisattva who is a person of least capacity are eight.

original: gang zag tha ma'i dbang du byas te phas pham pa'i ltung ba brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang zag tha ma'i dbang du byas te phas pham pa'i ltung ba brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: yongs su ma smin pa'i sems can la stong pa nyid sgrogs pa phas pham pa'i ltung ba'am /
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa'i sems can la stong pa nyid sgrogs pa phas pham pa'i ltung ba'am /
translated: To proclaim emptiness to sentient beings who are not ready for it is a downfall that is like a root downfall.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub la rab tu gnas pa ldog pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub la rab tu gnas pa ldog pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: To turn away someone who is well established in the enlightenment of a buddha is the second.

original: so sor thar pa yongs su spangs te theg pa chen po la sbyor ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa yongs su spangs te theg pa chen po la sbyor ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: To abandon the pratimoksha and to apply yourself to the Mahayana is the third.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs pa ma yin no zhes rang nyid 'dzin pa la gzhan rnams 'dzin du 'jug pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs pa ma yin no zhes rang nyid 'dzin pa la gzhan rnams 'dzin du 'jug pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: To hold the view that the Hinayana does not eliminate desire and so on, and to cause others to adopt this view, is the fourth.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyu'i rang gi yon tan sgrogs pa'am smon pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i rgyu'i rang gi yon tan sgrogs pa'am smon pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: To proclaim or to wish for the qualities of your own spiritual practice for the sake of gain and honor is the fifth.

original: nga ni zab mo chos la bzod pa can no zhes pa la sogs pa nyid smra ba ni drug pa'o //🔽dge sbyong rnams la chad pa gcod du 'jug pa'am /🔽dge sbyong rnams skyabs gsum gtong bar byed pa'am dge sbyong rnams la sbyin pa len pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: nga ni zab mo chos la bzod pa can no zhes pa la sogs pa nyid smra ba ni drug pa'o // dge sbyong rnams la chad pa gcod du 'jug pa'am / dge sbyong rnams skyabs gsum gtong bar byed pa'am dge sbyong rnams la sbyin pa len pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The sixth is to say, “I am patient with the profound Dharma” and so on.🔽The seventh is to have monks punished,🔽to have monks give up the Three Jewels, or to take away the offerings to monks.

original: zhi gnas spong ba'am 'don pa la kun du gzhol ba longs spyod 'bul ba'am /
analyzed: zhi gnas spong ba'am 'don pa la kun du gzhol ba longs spyod 'bul ba'am /
translated: The eighth is to abandon śamatha, to be devoted to recitation, to offer one’s possessions,

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su spong ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su spong ba'am /
translated: to give up the thought of awakening,

original: ser sna dang 'dod pa drag po dag gis slong ba la mi ster ba'am /
analyzed: ser sna dang 'dod pa drag po dag gis slong ba la mi ster ba'am /
translated: to not give to beggars out of miserliness and strong desire,

original: khros nas sems can la brdig pa'am /
analyzed: khros nas sems can la brdig pa'am /
translated: to beat sentient beings out of anger,

original: sems can brtson pas rab tu dang bar byed pa'i bzod pa mi sun par byed pa'am /
analyzed: sems can brtson pas rab tu dang bar byed pa'i bzod pa mi sun par byed pa'am /
translated: to not be patient with sentient beings who are devoted and clear-minded,

original: nyon mongs pa'am gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pas chos ltar snang ba ston pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'am gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pas chos ltar snang ba ston pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: or to teach a counterfeit Dharma out of affliction or in order to follow others.

original: yang phas pham pa'i ltung ba bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang phas pham pa'i ltung ba bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “The four downfalls that are like the root downfalls are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa blangs pas rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mchog tu zhen pas bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par byed pa ni phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ba dang po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa blangs pas rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mchog tu zhen pas bdag la stod par byed cing gzhan la smod par byed pa ni phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ba dang po'o //
translated: A bodhisattva who, through attachment to gain and honor, praises himself and disparages others because of taking up the discipline is the first downfall that is a root downfall.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yod pa'am chos nges pa yod kyang ser sna drag pos zil gyis gnon pas don du gnyer ba yang dag par nye bar gnas pa la nor dang chos mi ster na phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yod pa'am chos nges pa yod kyang ser sna drag pos zil gyis gnon pas don du gnyer ba yang dag par nye bar gnas pa la nor dang chos mi ster na phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: If, although there is something to be given, or although there is a Dharma to be taught, one does not give one's wealth or Dharma to a petitioner who is present, because one is overcome by intense stinginess and the like, this is the second downfall that is a root downfall.

original: khro ba drag pos zil gyis non @161b pas gzhan pas brdeg pa na yang dag par gsol ba byed pa /
analyzed: khro ba drag pos zil gyis non @161b pas gzhan pas brdeg pa na yang dag par gsol ba byed pa /
translated: If, when one is struck by another, one is overcome by intense anger and does not accept the apology of the other,

original: shad kyis sbyang ba mi len cing bzod pa mi byed na phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ba gsum pa'o //
analyzed: shad kyis sbyang ba mi len cing bzod pa mi byed na phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ba gsum pa'o //
translated: and does not practice patience, this is the third downfall that is a root downfall.

original: lta bas kun nas dkris pa ni mchog gi theg pa chen po skur ba dang spong ba dang / theg pa chen po'i gzugs brnyan chos gsal bar mi byed pa ni phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: lta bas kun nas dkris pa ni mchog gi theg pa chen po skur ba dang spong ba dang / theg pa chen po'i gzugs brnyan chos gsal bar mi byed pa ni phas pham pa'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth root downfall of the engaged spirit of enlightenment is to reject the Great Vehicle, which is to repudiate and abandon the supreme Great Vehicle.

original: sdom pa ni 'phangs pa'i dus las tshu rol du gtong ba'i rgyu bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ni 'phangs pa'i dus las tshu rol du gtong ba'i rgyu bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four causes for relinquishing the vow before the time of its natural expiration are as follows:

original: bslab pa phul ba dang / ltung bar 'gyur ba'i chos la lhag par spyad pa dang / mtshan ma gnyis byung ba dang / rten rnam par 'khrugs nas dbang po med pa nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa phul ba dang / ltung bar 'gyur ba'i chos la lhag par spyad pa dang / mtshan ma gnyis byung ba dang / rten rnam par 'khrugs nas dbang po med pa nyid thob pa'o //
translated: to return the vow, to engage in conduct that constitutes a downfall, to experience the two types of signs, or to experience the disruption of the support.

original: bsnyen gnas sdom pa yang rkyen chad pa dang / shi ba las gtang ngo //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas sdom pa yang rkyen chad pa dang / shi ba las gtang ngo //
translated: The vow of one-day fasting is relinquished by the end of the day, or through death or the disappearance of the motivating factor.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The absence of vows is relinquished in the same way.

original: sdom pa can dang sdom pa can ma yin pa las gzhan sdom pa can ma yin pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa de dag gi dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las ni sdom pa ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa can dang sdom pa can ma yin pa las gzhan sdom pa can ma yin pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa de dag gi dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las ni sdom pa ma yin sdom pa ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Neither-virtuous-nor-nonvirtuous karma is neither-restraint-nor-nonrestraint.

original: yang dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las de rnams ni rgyu la yis 'phel ba'am 'grib par 'gyur ro 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las de rnams ni rgyu la yis 'phel ba'am 'grib par 'gyur ro 'di lta ste /
translated: The increase or decrease of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma is due to five causes:

original: zhing las dang / bsam gtan las dang / bya ba nges pa las dang / dngos po yongs su 'chang ba dang / gus pas 'jug pa las so //
analyzed: zhing las dang / bsam gtan las dang / bya ba nges pa las dang / dngos po yongs su 'chang ba dang / gus pas 'jug pa las so //
translated: the field, the basis, the intention, the action, and the dedication.

original: de la zhing las rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la zhing las rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The field is threefold:

original: sangs rgyas gnas pa'i gtsug lag khang bzhengs pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du chos gnas pa'i dang / de bzhin du dge 'dun gnas pa'i 'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gnas pa'i gtsug lag khang bzhengs pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du chos gnas pa'i dang / de bzhin du dge 'dun gnas pa'i 'o //
translated: the field of the Buddha, the field of the Dharma, and the field of the Saṅgha.

original: nye bar ma chad kyi bar du nye bar skye ba mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar ma chad kyi bar du nye bar skye ba mi zad pa'o //
translated: The basis is the basis of the virtuous or nonvirtuous karma.🔽The intention is the intention to give or the intention to take life, and so on.

original: de bzhin du rku ba'i don du gsod pa la sogs pa byed pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po'o /🔽de bzhin du nye bar ma tshad kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rku ba'i don du gsod pa la sogs pa byed pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po'o / de bzhin du nye bar ma tshad kyi bar du'o //
translated: Likewise, the mass of demerit is the killing, etc. for the sake of stealing.🔽Likewise up to the mass of demerit of the one who does not give to the supplicant.

original: de bzhin du rdzong gi lha mo'i khang pa byed pa la sogs pa bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzong gi lha mo'i khang pa byed pa la sogs pa bsod nams ma yin pa'i phung po'o //
translated: Likewise, the mass of demerit is the one who makes a temple for the goddess of the fortress, etc.

original: bsam gtan gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three concentrations are as follows:

original: sangs rgyas la dga' bas skyabs su 'gro ba las bsod nams dang / ma chad kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la dga' bas skyabs su 'gro ba las bsod nams dang / ma chad kyi bar du'o //
translated: The mass of merit is from going for refuge to the Buddha with joy, and likewise up to the one who does not give to the supplicant.

original: de bzhin du chos la skyabs su song ba las bsod nams dang / de bzhin du dge 'dun la skyabs su song ba las bsod nams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos la skyabs su song ba las bsod nams dang / de bzhin du dge 'dun la skyabs su song ba las bsod nams so //
translated: Likewise, the mass of merit is from going for refuge to the Dharma, and likewise the mass of merit is from going for refuge to the Saṅgha.

original: ldog pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
translated: The mass of demerit is from turning away from those.

original: bya ba nges pa las ni rnam pa mang ngo //
analyzed: bya ba nges pa las ni rnam pa mang ngo //
translated: From the certainty of action, there are many types.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dam pa'i chos ma ston par /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ma ston par /
translated: The mass of demerit is from not teaching the excellent Dharma,

original: dman pa la ma byin par /
analyzed: dman pa la ma byin par /
translated: from not giving to the inferior,

original: mchod rten ma rdzogs par /
analyzed: mchod rten ma rdzogs par /
translated: from not completing a stūpa,

original: @162a * // bskor ba ma byas par /
analyzed: @162a * // bskor ba ma byas par /
translated: from not circumambulating,

original: bla ma mkhan po /
analyzed: bla ma mkhan po /
translated: from not respecting the guru and preceptor,

original: slob dpon / ma pha la sogs pa la phyag ma 'tshal bar kha zas mi bza'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnam pa rnams bsod nams so //
analyzed: slob dpon / ma pha la sogs pa la phyag ma 'tshal bar kha zas mi bza'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnam pa rnams bsod nams so //
translated: The master says: One should not eat food without first paying homage to one's mother, father, and so on. In this way, there is merit from the aspect of action.

original: bya ba rnam par chad pa las ldog go //
analyzed: bya ba rnam par chad pa las ldog go //
translated: One turns away from the interruption of action.

original: srog chags gsod pa la sogs pa ma byas par zas mi bza'o zhes pa la sogs pa bya ba nges pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags gsod pa la sogs pa ma byas par zas mi bza'o zhes pa la sogs pa bya ba nges pa las bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
translated: One should not eat food without first refraining from killing living beings and so on. In this way, there is demerit from the aspect of the determination of action.

original: bya ba rnam par chad pa las ldog go //
analyzed: bya ba rnam par chad pa las ldog go //
translated: One turns away from the interruption of action.

original: dngos po yongs su chad pa las ni yang rnam pa mang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su chad pa las ni yang rnam pa mang ngo //
translated: From the aspect of the determination of the thing, there are many more.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: mchod pa'i don du mchod rten la sogs pa 'chang ba yang bsod nams so //
analyzed: mchod pa'i don du mchod rten la sogs pa 'chang ba yang bsod nams so //
translated: For the sake of worship, holding a stupa and so on is merit.

original: de dag yongs su spangs pa na ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag yongs su spangs pa na ldog pa nyid do //
translated: When one abandons them, one turns away.

original: gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir rgya dang 'dzol la sogs pa 'chang ba las bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir rgya dang 'dzol la sogs pa 'chang ba las bsod nams ma yin pa'o //
translated: For the sake of harming others, holding a noose, a snare, and so on is demerit.

original: de dag spangs pa na ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag spangs pa na ldog pa nyid do //
translated: When one abandons them, one turns away.

original: gus pas 'jug pa la yang rnam pa mang ngo //
analyzed: gus pas 'jug pa la yang rnam pa mang ngo //
translated: Devotional engagement is also of many aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: rab tu dad pa'i shugs las dge ba'i las dang / nyon mongs pa'i dge ba'i las gus par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dad pa'i shugs las dge ba'i las dang / nyon mongs pa'i dge ba'i las gus par byed pa'o //
translated: 1. action which is virtuous by virtue of the force of faith; 2. action which is virtuous by virtue of the force of the defilements.

original: ci srid du rab tu dad pa'i shugs rjes su 'jug pa de srid du bsod nams rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: ci srid du rab tu dad pa'i shugs rjes su 'jug pa de srid du bsod nams rjes su 'jug go //
translated: As long as the force of faith continues, merit continues.

original: ci srid du nyon mongs pa'i shugs rjes su 'jug pa de srid du bsod nams ma yin pa rjes su 'jug pa nyid do //🔽gang cung zad legs par spyad pa rnams ni rgyu bcu gsum gyis dge bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci srid du nyon mongs pa'i shugs rjes su 'jug pa de srid du bsod nams ma yin pa rjes su 'jug pa nyid do // gang cung zad legs par spyad pa rnams ni rgyu bcu gsum gyis dge bar 'gyur te /
translated: As long as the force of the defilements continues, demerit continues.🔽Any good conduct whatsoever is virtuous by reason of thirteen causes.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽rang bzhin las dang / 'brel pa las dang / rjes su 'brel pa las dang / kun slong ba las dang / skye ba thob pa las dang / don dam pa'i bden pa las dang / sbyor ba las dang / yongs su lan 'dzin pa las dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / rang bzhin las dang / 'brel pa las dang / rjes su 'brel pa las dang / kun slong ba las dang / skye ba thob pa las dang / don dam pa'i bden pa las dang / sbyor ba las dang / yongs su lan 'dzin pa las dang /
translated: What are the thirteen?

original: mdun du bdar ba las dang / gnyen po las dang / nye bar zhi ba las dang / mthun pa las so //
analyzed: mdun du bdar ba las dang / gnyen po las dang / nye bar zhi ba las dang / mthun pa las so //
translated: 1. by its very nature; 2. by its connection; 3. by its consequences; 4. by its origin; 5. by its acquisition; 6. by its object; 7. by its application; 8. by its complete acceptance; 9. by its preeminence; 10. by its counter-agent; 11. by its appeasement; 12. by its conformity.

original: de la rang bzhin las dge ba la rnam pa bcu bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin las dge ba la rnam pa bcu bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fourteen virtues that are by nature are as follows.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / ma chags pa dang / mi ldang ba dang / ma rmongs pa dang / bag yod pa dang /
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / ma chags pa dang / mi ldang ba dang / ma rmongs pa dang / bag yod pa dang /
translated: Faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, conscience, shame, nonattachment, nonhatred, nondelusion, carefulness,

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'o //
translated: pliancy, equanimity, and nonviolence.

original: 'brel pa las dge ba ni mang ngo //
analyzed: 'brel pa las dge ba ni mang ngo //
translated: The virtues that are related are numerous.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos so //
translated: The phenomena that are concomitant with faith and so on.

original: rjes su 'brel pa las @162b dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa las @162b dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The virtues that are related to the virtues that are related are as follows.

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams kyi bag chags so //
translated: The predispositions of faith and so on.

original: kun slong las dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun slong las dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The virtues that are motivated are as follows.

original: dad pa la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pas kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: The actions of body and speech that are motivated by faith and so on.

original: skye bas thob pa las dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye bas thob pa las dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The virtues that are obtained at birth are as follows.

original: dad pa la sogs pa rnams goms pa las dad pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rnams goms pa las dad pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can mngon par grub pa'o //
translated: The virtues of faith, etc., are established as having the nature of faith, etc., through cultivation.

original: don dam pa las dge ba ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa las dge ba ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: The virtue of reality is the truth of ultimate reality.

original: sbyor ba las dge ba rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba las dge ba rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three virtues of application are

original: skyes bu dam pa bsnyen pa las dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa bsnyen pa las dam pa'i chos thos pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'o //
translated: hearing the holy Dharma from holy people, proper mental attention, and the practice of Dharma in accordance with Dharma.

original: rjes su 'dzin pa las dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin pa las dge ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The virtue of assistance is

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rjes su 'dzin pa'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //

translated: That which is unwholesome by way of taking up is
