translated: If it is neutral by association, it is the instinct for verbal expression that is associated with that same collection of names, etc.

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'i sems pa'i sems kyi bag chags kyi phyis su mngon par brjod par rab tu 'jug par byed do zhes so //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa'i sems pa'i sems kyi bag chags kyi phyis su mngon par brjod par rab tu 'jug par byed do zhes so //
translated: The collection of names and so on are the subsequent verbal expressions of the mental latent impressions of intention.

original: kun nas slong ba las lung ma bstan ni /🔽sems dang sems las byung bas bag chags de yongs su zung nas kun nas slong ba lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: kun nas slong ba las lung ma bstan ni / sems dang sems las byung bas bag chags de yongs su zung nas kun nas slong ba lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: Motivated neutral means🔽the physical and verbal karma that is motivated by the latent impressions of mind and mental factors that are not fully grasped.

original: sdang ba ma yin pa rab tu dang ba ma yin pa'i sems kyi ming gi tshogs la sogs pa mngon par brjod pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: sdang ba ma yin pa rab tu dang ba ma yin pa'i sems kyi ming gi tshogs la sogs pa mngon par brjod pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: It is not motivated by a mind that is either hostile or clear.

original: don dam pa las lung ma bstan ni /
analyzed: don dam pa las lung ma bstan ni /
translated: Ultimate neutral means

original: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: space and analytical cessation.

original: skyes pas thob pa'i lung ma bstan ni /
analyzed: skyes pas thob pa'i lung ma bstan ni /
translated: Neutral obtained from birth means

original: mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i @164b chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i @164b chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: the karmic maturation of nonvirtuous and virtuous contaminated phenomena.

original: sbyor ba las lung ma bstan ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba las lung ma bstan ni /
translated: Neutral of application means

original: sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / dge ba ma yin pa'i spyod lam mam /
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / dge ba ma yin pa'i spyod lam mam /
translated: the physical and verbal karma of one who is not mentally disturbed and who is not virtuous.

original: bzo'i gnas so //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas so //
translated: and the arts and crafts.

original: sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / dge ba ma yin pa zhes pa ni gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin dge ba yang ma yin par gyur pa de'i tshe spyod lam la sogs pa rnams lung du ma bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / dge ba ma yin pa zhes pa ni gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin dge ba yang ma yin par gyur pa de'i tshe spyod lam la sogs pa rnams lung du ma bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The phrase “that which is neither afflicted nor virtuous” refers to the postures and so on when they are neither afflicted nor virtuous.

original: gzhan du na dge ba'am mi dge ba ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dge ba'am mi dge ba ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would be either virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: mdun du byas pa las lung du ma bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mdun du byas pa las lung du ma bstan pa ni /
translated: The second type of neutral action is that which is performed in the presence of others.

original: de dag lha'i rigs gang yang rung ba la brten cing mdun du byas te /
analyzed: de dag lha'i rigs gang yang rung ba la brten cing mdun du byas te /
translated: This refers to the performance of worship in the presence of a deity of any of the classes of gods.

original: 'tshe ba dang lta ba ngan pa spangs pa mchod pa'i gnas rab tu bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'tshe ba dang lta ba ngan pa spangs pa mchod pa'i gnas rab tu bzhag ste /
translated: This worship is performed in order to abandon harm and wrong views and to establish the object of worship as a holy being.

original: de dag la mchod pa'i las la sbyor ba'am /🔽gang du skye bo'i tshogs chen po rnams bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mchod pa'i las la sbyor ba'am / gang du skye bo'i tshogs chen po rnams bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: This worship is performed by those who are engaged in the activity of worship.🔽It is also performed by those who are not engaged in the activity of worship but who are present at the time of the performance of worship.

original: rjes su 'dzin pa las lung ma bstan ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin pa las lung ma bstan ni /
translated: The third type of neutral action is that which is performed in order to care for others.

original: de dag bran dang g-yog dang las byed pa'am /
analyzed: de dag bran dang g-yog dang las byed pa'am /
translated: This refers to the performance of worship by those who are servants, employees, or workers.

original: bu dang chung ma la sogs sdang ba ma yin pa dang rab tu dang ba ma yin pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa ster ba'o //
analyzed: bu dang chung ma la sogs sdang ba ma yin pa dang rab tu dang ba ma yin pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa ster ba'o //
translated: Giving with a mind that is neither hostile nor full of faith to children, spouse, etc.

original: nye bar longs spyod pa las lung ma bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nye bar longs spyod pa las lung ma bstan pa ni /
translated: Indeterminate with regard to enjoyment is

original: de dag so sor ma brtags pa nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems kyis longs spyod la longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag so sor ma brtags pa nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems kyis longs spyod la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: enjoying the objects of the senses with a mind that is neither afflicted nor free of affliction, without discrimination.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa las lung ma bstan ni /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa las lung ma bstan ni /
translated: Indeterminate with regard to grasping is

original: de dag bzo'i gnas rnams la goms par byas pas phyis de dang mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyis ngo bo yongs su len par byed do //
analyzed: de dag bzo'i gnas rnams la goms par byas pas phyis de dang mthun pa'i bdag nyid kyis ngo bo yongs su len par byed do //
translated: grasping the nature of those objects through habituation to the arts, etc.

original: gang gis myur zhing mgyogs par bzo'i gnas de rnams la slob pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis myur zhing mgyogs par bzo'i gnas de rnams la slob pa mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By which one quickly and rapidly completes the training in those arts.

original: gnyen po las lung ma bstan ni /
analyzed: gnyen po las lung ma bstan ni /
translated: Indeterminate with regard to antidotes is

original: de dag nad med pa'i don du nad kyi gnyen po so sor ma brtags pa'i sman bsten par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nad med pa'i don du nad kyi gnyen po so sor ma brtags pa'i sman bsten par byed pa'o //
translated: relying on medicine without discrimination as an antidote to illness for the sake of health.

original: nye bar zhi ba las lung ma bstan ni /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba las lung ma bstan ni /
translated: Indeterminate with regard to pacification is

original: de dag gzugs dang gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa de zhi bar gnas pa'i nye bar sbas pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gzugs dang gzugs med pa ni spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa de zhi bar gnas pa'i nye bar sbas pa thob pa'o //
translated: The form and formless realms are the attainment of the near-attainment of the peace of those afflictions of the realms of desire.

original: rgyu mthun pa las kyang ma bstan ni /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las kyang ma bstan ni /
translated: The neutral is not taught as being from natural outflow.

original: de dag lung du ma bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig tu skyes ba'o //
analyzed: de dag lung du ma bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig tu skyes ba'o //
translated: The neutral is that which arises together with the mind of emanation.

original: rtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa las lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa las lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The neutral from natural outflow is the realization.

original: sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig tu skyes pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems dang lhan cig tu skyes pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Arisen together with the mind of emanation means

original: sems dang sems las byung ba gang gis phyi rol gyi don du sprul pa'o //🔽sems can la phan pa'i don du @165a * //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba gang gis phyi rol gyi don du sprul pa'o // sems can la phan pa'i don du @165a * //
translated: the mind and mental factors that emanate external objects.

original: 'gyur na dge ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'gyur na dge ba nyid do //
translated: If it is for the purpose of benefiting sentient beings, it is virtuous.🔽If it is for the purpose of harming sentient beings, it is nonvirtuous.

original: dge ba'i las byas pa rnams kyis dag par byed pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i las byas pa rnams kyis dag par byed pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: The purification of virtuous actions is threefold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su 'dzin pas dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas dang / yang dag pa'i don so sor rig pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su 'dzin pas dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bas dang / yang dag pa'i don so sor rig pa'o //
translated: It is the retention of the mind of enlightenment, the complete dedication to perfect enlightenment, and the individual knowledge of the meaning of reality.

original: de la mi dge ba dag par byed pa ni zad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba dag par byed pa ni zad par byed pa'o //
translated: The purification of nonvirtue is the exhaustion of nonvirtue.

original: dge ba dag par byed pa ni de dag zad pa med pa'i dge ba nyid bskyed de /
analyzed: dge ba dag par byed pa ni de dag zad pa med pa'i dge ba nyid bskyed de /
translated: The purification of virtue is the generation of the virtue that does not exhaust those.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the actualization of the accumulation of merit.

original: sdig pa zad pa'i rtags dgu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdig pa zad pa'i rtags dgu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nine signs of the exhaustion of evil are as follows:

original: rmi lam du mi gtsang ba la sogs pa zag pa dang / rmi lam du 'o ma la sogs pa'i zas za ba dang / rmi lam du zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa skyug pa dang / nyi ma dang zla ba mthong ba dang /
analyzed: rmi lam du mi gtsang ba la sogs pa zag pa dang / rmi lam du 'o ma la sogs pa'i zas za ba dang / rmi lam du zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa skyug pa dang / nyi ma dang zla ba mthong ba dang /
translated: In dreams, the elimination of impurities such as excrement, eating food such as milk in dreams, vomiting curd, milk, and so on in dreams, seeing the sun and moon,

original: 'ongs pa dang / me 'bar ba dang / dug dang bcas pa'i skyes bu nag po pham par byas pa dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma mthong ba dang / 'o ma'i shing dang glang po che dang ri dang seng ge dang / khang bzangs la 'dzeg pa dang /
analyzed: 'ongs pa dang / me 'bar ba dang / dug dang bcas pa'i skyes bu nag po pham par byas pa dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma mthong ba dang / 'o ma'i shing dang glang po che dang ri dang seng ge dang / khang bzangs la 'dzeg pa dang /
translated: coming, blazing fire, defeating a black man with poison, seeing monks and nuns, a milk tree, an elephant, a mountain, a lion, climbing a mansion,

original: chos nyan pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa'o //
translated: and listening to the Dharma.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i las gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i las gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are two kinds of neutral karma:

original: sgrib pa lung ma bstan gyi las dang / sgrib min lung ma bstan gyi las so //
analyzed: sgrib pa lung ma bstan gyi las dang / sgrib min lung ma bstan gyi las so //
translated: 2. Action that is neither obscured nor neutral.

original: mi g-yo ba'i las la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: 2. Action that is unshakable is twofold:🔽1. Action that arises from the fourth meditation, and

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa las byung ba'i las dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa las byung ba'i las dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las so //
translated: 2. Action that is active in the formless realm.

original: las de rnams la gang la 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi dge ba'i las thams cad dang gang yang khams gsum gyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i las thams cad dag bsdoms pa de ni yang srid 'byung ba'i las yin te /
analyzed: las de rnams la gang la 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi dge ba'i las thams cad dang gang yang khams gsum gyi zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i las thams cad dag bsdoms pa de ni yang srid 'byung ba'i las yin te /
translated: Among these actions, all unwholesome actions of the realm of desire and all wholesome actions of the three realms that are associated with impurity are action that produces existence.

original: de ni 'du byed kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed kyi yan lag go //
translated: This is the link of volition.

original: mi'i lto ru skye ba nyid dang mtshams sbyor ba'i skabs kyi phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: mi'i lto ru skye ba nyid dang mtshams sbyor ba'i skabs kyi phung po lnga ni rnam par shes pa'i yan lag go //
translated: The five aggregates at the time of rebirth in the womb of a human being and the five aggregates at the time of linking are the link of consciousness.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming yin la /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ni ming yin la /
translated: The four aggregates that are not form are name.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni gzugs /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni gzugs /
translated: The form aggregate is form.

original: gnyi ga ni ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: gnyi ga ni ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag go //
translated: Both together are the link of name-and-form.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces pa skye mched drug po 'di rnams 'tshogs pa ni skye mched drug gi yan lag go //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces pa skye mched drug po 'di rnams 'tshogs pa ni skye mched drug gi yan lag go //
translated: The six sense-spheres are the six sense-spheres of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and thought.

original: reg pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Contact is of six kinds:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi @165b 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi @165b 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: eye-contact, ear-contact, nose-contact, tongue-contact, body-contact, and thought-contact.

original: yang reg pa la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang reg pa la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, contact is of two kinds:

original: thogs pa'i reg pa dang / tshig bla dags kyi reg pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa'i reg pa dang / tshig bla dags kyi reg pa'o //
translated: Namely, contact with obstruction and contact with designation.

original: de la thogs pa'i reg pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la thogs pa'i reg pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the five contacts with obstruction are

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du'o //
translated: eye-contact up to body-contact.

original: tshig bla dags kyi reg pa gcig nyid de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshig bla dags kyi reg pa gcig nyid de 'di lta ste /
translated: The one contact with designation is

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: thought-contact.

original: yang reg pa la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang reg pa la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, contact is of three kinds:

original: rig pa'i reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i reg pa dang / rig pa ma yin ma rig pa ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i reg pa dang / rig pa ma yin ma rig pa ma yin pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: contact of knowledge, contact of ignorance, and contact that is neither knowledge nor ignorance.

original: yang reg pa la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang reg pa la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, there are two kinds of contact:

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i reg pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i reg pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi reg pa'o //
translated: contact that is not defiled and contact that is defiled.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni /
translated: Among them, contact that is not defiled

original: rig pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: is contact of knowledge.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni ma rig pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni ma rig pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: Contact that is defiled is contact of ignorance.

original: de la ma rig pa'i reg pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i reg pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, contact of ignorance is twofold:

original: gnod sems kyi reg pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi reg pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: contact of malice and contact of attachment.

original: rig pa ma yin ma rig pa ma yin pa'i reg pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rig pa ma yin ma rig pa ma yin pa'i reg pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Contact that is neither knowledge nor ignorance is twofold:

original: dge ba zag bcas kyi reg pa dang / sgrib min lung ma bstan gyi reg pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba zag bcas kyi reg pa dang / sgrib min lung ma bstan gyi reg pa'o //
translated: contact that is contaminated and wholesome and contact that is neutral and not an obscuration.

original: yang reg pa la rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang reg pa la rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, there are three kinds of contact:

original: sdug bsngal myong bar bya ba'i reg pa dang / bde ba myong bar bya ba'i reg pa dang / sdug bsngal ma yin bde ba ma yin pa myong bar bya ba'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar bya ba'i reg pa dang / bde ba myong bar bya ba'i reg pa dang / sdug bsngal ma yin bde ba ma yin pa myong bar bya ba'i reg pa'o //
translated: contact that is to be experienced as pleasant, contact that is to be experienced as unpleasant, and contact that is to be experienced as neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: reg pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: reg pa'i yan lag go //
translated: This is the member of contact.

original: tshor ba la drug ni 'di lta ste /🔽mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / rna ba dang phrad pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / sna dang phrad pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang /
analyzed: tshor ba la drug ni 'di lta ste / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / rna ba dang phrad pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / sna dang phrad pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba dang /
translated: There are six kinds of feeling:

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: feeling that arises from the contact of eye, feeling that arises from the contact of ear, feeling that arises from the contact of nose, feeling that arises from the contact of tongue, feeling that arises from the contact of body, and feeling that arises from the contact of thought.

original: yang so sor rnam pa gsum du phye ste tshor ba bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang so sor rnam pa gsum du phye ste tshor ba bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, each of these is divided into three kinds, making eighteen kinds of feeling.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa dang zhes de bzhin du yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba min sdug bsngal🔽min pa'i tshor ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa dang zhes de bzhin du yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba min sdug bsngal min pa'i tshor ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, the feeling that arises from the contact of mind is pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: yang tshor ba la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang tshor ba la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are two kinds of feeling:

original: lus kyi tshor ba dang / sems las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba dang / sems las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: feeling in the body and feeling in the mind.

original: de la lus kyi tshor ba lnga ni 'di lta ste /🔽mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa nas lus kyi 'dus te reg pa @166a * //
analyzed: de la lus kyi tshor ba lnga ni 'di lta ste / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa nas lus kyi 'dus te reg pa @166a * //
translated: Feeling in the body is fivefold:

original: las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i bar du'o //
translated: feeling that arises from the contact of eye, up to feeling that arises from the contact of body.

original: yid kyi tshor ba ni gcig nyid de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid kyi tshor ba ni gcig nyid de / 'di lta ste /
translated: Feeling in the mind is one kind:

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: feeling that arises from the contact of mind.

original: sems las byung ba'i tshor ba de rnams 'di ltar nye bar spyod pa'i yid bco brgyad du phye bas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i tshor ba de rnams 'di ltar nye bar spyod pa'i yid bco brgyad du phye bas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The eighteen mental activities are distinguished in terms of the experience of these feelings that arise from the mind, and thus there are eight types.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug la yid bde ba'i rnam par spyod pa'i tshor ba drug dang / de bzhin du yid mi bde ba'i spyod pa'i tshor ba drug dang / de bzhin du btang snyoms kyi rnam par spyod pa'i tshor ba drug go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug la yid bde ba'i rnam par spyod pa'i tshor ba drug dang / de bzhin du yid mi bde ba'i spyod pa'i tshor ba drug dang / de bzhin du btang snyoms kyi rnam par spyod pa'i tshor ba drug go //
translated: There are six feelings that are experienced as mental satisfaction with regard to the six objects such as form, and similarly, there are six feelings that are experienced as mental dissatisfaction, and similarly, there are six feelings that are experienced as indifference.

original: 'di ni drug tshan gsum ste tshor ba bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni drug tshan gsum ste tshor ba bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: These are the three groups of six, and thus there are eighteen feelings.

original: tshor ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: tshor ba'i yan lag go //
translated: This is the factor of feeling.

original: sred pa ni mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa ni mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Craving is the desire for what one is attached to.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is of three types:

original: tshor ba bde ba dang ldan par mngon par 'dod pa dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal dang bral bar mngon par 'dod pa dang / tshor ba bde ba ma yin sdug bsngal ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba dang ldan par mngon par 'dod pa dang / tshor ba sdug bsngal dang bral bar mngon par 'dod pa dang / tshor ba bde ba ma yin sdug bsngal ma yin pa ste /
translated: the desire to be united with pleasant feeling, the desire to be separated from painful feeling, and the desire to maintain the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the desire to neither exist nor not exist.

original: sred pa de yang /
analyzed: sred pa de yang /
translated: This craving is

original: yang srid la dga' ba can gyis 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: yang srid la dga' ba can gyis 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: accompanied by attachment to a new existence.

original: de dang de ru mngon par dga' ba can la gsum ni 'di lta ste /🔽'dod pa'i sred pa /🔽srid pa'i sred pa /
analyzed: de dang de ru mngon par dga' ba can la gsum ni 'di lta ste / 'dod pa'i sred pa / srid pa'i sred pa /
translated: The three are the craving for existence,

original: srid bral sred pa'o //
analyzed: srid bral sred pa'o //
translated: the craving for non-existence, and the craving for the cessation of existence.

original: sred pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: sred pa'i yan lag go //
translated: These are the limbs of craving.

original: nye bar len pa la bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa la bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four kinds of grasping:

original: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'o //
translated: grasping at desire, grasping at views, grasping at morality and asceticism, and grasping at the doctrine of self.

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i yan lag go //
translated: These are the limbs of grasping.

original: skye ba da ltar ba la bsags pa'i yang srid 'byung ba'i las ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba da ltar ba la bsags pa'i yang srid 'byung ba'i las ni srid pa'o //
translated: Existence is the karma that produces a new existence, accumulated in the present life.

original: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag go //🔽ci ltar skye ba 'di nyid du rnam par shes pa'i yan lag ni /
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa'i yan lag go // ci ltar skye ba 'di nyid du rnam par shes pa'i yan lag ni /
translated: This is the limb of existence.🔽Just as the limb of consciousness in this life

original: de bzhin du de ma thag pa'i skye ba'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ma thag pa'i skye ba'i skye ba'o //
translated: is the consciousness of the intermediate existence.

original: 'di ni skye ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba'i yan lag go //
translated: This is the link of birth.

original: gang skye ba 'di'i ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag bzhi la sogs pa de nyid ni bar med pa'i skye ba'i rga shi'i yan lag go //🔽pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par nges pa ste /
analyzed: gang skye ba 'di'i ming dang gzugs kyi yan lag bzhi la sogs pa de nyid ni bar med pa'i skye ba'i rga shi'i yan lag go // pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par nges pa ste /
translated: The four links of name-and-form, etc., of this birth are the link of aging-and-death of the birth that is without interval.🔽The great paṇḍita Daśabalaśrībhadra has summarized this in the Ascertainment of the Compounded and the Uncompounded:

original: le'u bcu pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bcu pa'o /
translated: “The ascertainment of dependent arising is the tenth chapter.”

original: // /'phags pa'i 'jig rten la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: // /'phags pa'i 'jig rten la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The āryas’ world is twofold:

original: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang / mi slob pa'o //
translated: those in training and those beyond training.

original: de la slob @166b pa la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la slob @166b pa la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those in training are threefold:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ba'o //
translated: those of the Śrāvaka Vehicle, those of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and those of the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi theg pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those of the Śrāvaka Vehicle are twofold:

original: srol du zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: srol du zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa'o //
translated: those who have entered the stream and those who have attained the result.

original: de la srol du zhugs pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la srol du zhugs pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four who have entered the stream are:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: those who have entered for the sake of the fruit of stream-enterer, those who have entered for the sake of the fruit of once-returner, those who have entered for the sake of the fruit of non-returner, and those who have entered for the sake of the fruit of arhatship.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who have entered for the sake of the fruit of stream-enterer are of two types:

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: those who follow faith and those who follow the dharma.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who abide in the fruit are of three types:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: stream-enterers, once-returners, and non-returners.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa la lha'i rigs nas rigs su dang mi'i rigs nas rigs so zhes gnyis su rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa la lha'i rigs nas rigs su dang mi'i rigs nas rigs so zhes gnyis su rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Among them, stream-enterers are posited as two types: those who go from family to family among the gods and those who go from family to family among humans.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni sa bon gcig pa zhes rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni sa bon gcig pa zhes rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Once-returners are posited as having a single seed.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Nonreturners are of two types:

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / khams gnyis kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / khams gnyis kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: those who are free from attachment to the desire realm and those who are free from attachment to the two higher realms.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the desire realm are of five types:

original: bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
translated: those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain nirvana as soon as they are born, those who attain nirvana through application, those who attain nirvana without application and

original: gong du 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba'o //
translated: those who transfer to a higher level.

original: khams gnyis la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba la bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khams gnyis la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba la bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Nonreturners who are free from attachment to the two higher realms are of four types:

original: bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: those who attain parinirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain parinirvana upon birth, those who attain parinirvana with effort, and those who attain parinirvana without effort.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i dbye ba rnam par ma bzhag go //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i dbye ba rnam par ma bzhag go //
translated: The classification of the vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas is not set forth.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la lnga ni 'di lta ste /🔽lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa can dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / rtsol ba med pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / spyod pa nges pa la zhugs pa dang / nges par skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la lnga ni 'di lta ste / lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa can dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / rtsol ba med pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / spyod pa nges pa la zhugs pa dang / nges par skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'o //
translated: There are five in the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas:

original: yang rnam pa nyi @167a * //
analyzed: yang rnam pa nyi @167a * //
translated: those with pure superior intention, those who dwell in the signless with effort, those who dwell in the signless without effort, those who have entered the certainty of practice, and those who are impeded by only one birth.

original: shu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are twenty types:

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / mi'i rigs nas rigs dang / lha'i rigs nas rigs dang / dad pa dang lta bas thob pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa nyid dang /🔽lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / bar chad gcig pa dang / dad pa lta bas thob pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa nyid dang / bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / mi'i rigs nas rigs dang / lha'i rigs nas rigs dang / dad pa dang lta bas thob pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa nyid dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / bar chad gcig pa dang / dad pa lta bas thob pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa nyid dang / bar dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
translated: those who follow faith, those who follow the Dharma, those who enter the stream, those who go from family to family, those who go from realm to realm, those who attain through faith and view who are candidates for the fruit of once-returner,🔽once-returners, those with one obstruction, those who attain through faith and view who are candidates for the fruit of non-returner, those who attain parinirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain parinirvana after birth,

original: 'du byed dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'phar ba dang / phyed du 'bar ba dang / gnas thams cad du 'pho ba dang / mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba dang /
analyzed: 'du byed dang bcas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'phar ba dang / phyed du 'bar ba dang / gnas thams cad du 'pho ba dang / mthong ba'i chos la zhi ba dang /
translated: those who attain parinirvana with effort, those who attain parinirvana without effort, those who leap over, those who leap over half, those who transfer to all abodes, those who attain peace in this very life,

original: lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / bse ru'o //
analyzed: lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / bse ru'o //
translated: and the one who has entered the path to the fruit of an arhat, and the rhinoceros.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Among them, from the time of the forbearance of the dharma of the knowledge of suffering

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched nyon mongs pa'i dbye ba dgu pa'i gnyen po'i dbye ba'i bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i bar du ni slob pa'i nyan thos so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched nyon mongs pa'i dbye ba dgu pa'i gnyen po'i dbye ba'i bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i bar du ni slob pa'i nyan thos so //
translated: up to the time of abiding in the path of cultivation that is the antidote to the ninth class of afflictions of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, one is a śrāvaka learner.

original: stan gcig la gnas te rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: stan gcig la gnas te rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Abiding on the path of cultivation that is the antidote to the ninth class of afflictions of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, having entered the path of a pratyekabuddha on a single seat, from the time of the forbearance of the dharma of the knowledge of suffering

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi nyon mongs pa'i dbye ba dgu pa'i gnyen po'i dbye ba'i bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i bar du ni slob pa'i rang byang chub kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi nyon mongs pa'i dbye ba dgu pa'i gnyen po'i dbye ba'i bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i bar du ni slob pa'i rang byang chub kyi theg pa'o //
translated: up to the time of abiding in the path of cultivation that is the antidote to the ninth class of afflictions of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, one is a pratyekabuddha learner.

original: bye brag pa'i tshul la ni /
analyzed: bye brag pa'i tshul la ni /
translated: In the system of the Vaiśeṣikas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying por gshegs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying por gshegs te /
translated: a bodhisattva goes to the essence of enlightenment.

original: stan gcig la gnas pa de nyid ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nyid yin pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: stan gcig la gnas pa de nyid ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nyid yin pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The great bodhisattva who is a learner is one who is abiding in the very same seat, from the time of the knowledge of the Dharma with regard to suffering

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi nyon mongs pa'i dbye ba dgu pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i bar du ni slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi nyon mongs pa'i dbye ba dgu pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i bar du ni slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: up to the time of the cultivation of the antidote to the ninth category of the afflictions of the peak of existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul la mthong ba'i lam zhes pa rab tu dga' ba'i sa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul la mthong ba'i lam zhes pa rab tu dga' ba'i sa nas bzung ste /
translated: The path of seeing of the bodhisattva is from the Joyous level

original: skad cig gcig la mngon par byang chub pa'i mngon par rtogs pa sems bskyed nyi shu pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i bar du ni mi slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la mngon par byang chub pa'i mngon par rtogs pa sems bskyed nyi shu pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i bar du ni mi slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: up to the vajra-like samadhi, which is the uninterrupted path that has the nature of the twenty-first generation of the mind of enlightenment, the clear realization of manifest enlightenment in one instant.

original: mi slob pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three types of nonlearners are as follows.

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang rgyal gyi byang chub @167b dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang rgyal gyi byang chub @167b dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'o //
translated: the enlightenment of the sravaka, the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddha, and the perfect enlightenment.

original: de la nyan thos kyi byang chub la drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi byang chub la drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The enlightenment of the sravaka is sixfold:

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / sems pa skal ba can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i skal pa can dang / gnas pa mi bskyod pa dang / mngon du byed pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / sems pa skal ba can dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i skal pa can dang / gnas pa mi bskyod pa dang / mngon du byed pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
translated: the one who is subject to falling away, the one who is capable of penetrating, the one who is capable of guarding, the one who is capable of the highest, the one who is capable of penetrating and the one who is unshakable.

original: de la mi bskyod pa'i chos can la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mi bskyod pa'i chos can la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The one who is unshakable is twofold:

original: brtson ba 'bar bas thob pa dang / dang po nas de'i rigs can no //🔽de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no /
analyzed: brtson ba 'bar bas thob pa dang / dang po nas de'i rigs can no // de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no /
translated: the one who has attained through the burning of exertion and the one who is of that nature from the beginning.

original: gang 'bras bu la yongs su nyams pa'i skal ba can no //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu la yongs su nyams pa'i skal ba can no //
translated: The one who is subject to falling away is the one who is capable of falling away from the fruit.

original: sems pa skal pa can ni gang dag nyid 'dzin par bya ba skal ba can no //
analyzed: sems pa skal pa can ni gang dag nyid 'dzin par bya ba skal ba can no //
translated: The one who is capable of penetrating is the one who is capable of penetrating to the summit.

original: rjes su bsrung ba'i skal ba can ni /
analyzed: rjes su bsrung ba'i skal ba can ni /
translated: The one who is capable of guarding is the one who is capable of guarding against falling away.🔽The one who is capable of the highest is the one who is capable of the highest state.

original: gang 'bras bu rjes su bsrung ba'i skal ba can no //
analyzed: gang 'bras bu rjes su bsrung ba'i skal ba can no //
translated: 1. the one who is capable of guarding the result;

original: gnas pa mi bskyod pa ni /
analyzed: gnas pa mi bskyod pa ni /
translated: 2. the one who is capable of abiding;🔽3. the one who is capable of penetrating;🔽4. the one who is capable of retrogressing;🔽5. the one who is capable of discerning;🔽6. the one who is capable of entering into the certainty of perfection;🔽7. the one who is capable of penetration;🔽8. the one who is capable of liberation;🔽9. the one who is capable of the destruction of the cankers;🔽10. the one who is capable of the summit.🔽The one who is capable of abiding is the unshakable one who does not retrogress.

original: gang gnas pa'i skal ba can nyams par mi 'gyur ba mi g-yo ba sngon du mi byed pa'o //🔽mngon du byed pa'i skal ba can ni /
analyzed: gang gnas pa'i skal ba can nyams par mi 'gyur ba mi g-yo ba sngon du mi byed pa'o // mngon du byed pa'i skal ba can ni /
translated: The one who is capable of penetrating is the unshakable one who is capable of penetrating.🔽The one who is capable of the summit is the unshakable one who is capable of the summit.

original: gang mi g-yo ba mngon du byed pa'i skal ba can no //🔽mi g-yo ba'i sems pa'i chos can no //🔽gang gis mi skye ba'i ye shes skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi g-yo ba mngon du byed pa'i skal ba can no // mi g-yo ba'i sems pa'i chos can no // gang gis mi skye ba'i ye shes skyed pa'o //
translated: The one who is capable of the destruction of the cankers is the unshakable one who is capable of the destruction of the cankers.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de yang gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de yang gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The one who is capable of the summit is of three kinds:

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub 'ga' zhig dang / rang rgyal gyi byang chub dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub 'ga' zhig dang / rang rgyal gyi byang chub dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: the one who is capable of the summit of the śrāvaka vehicle, the one who is capable of the summit of the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and the one who is capable of the summit of the vehicle of the perfectly accomplished Buddha.

original: gal te mi g-yo ba ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi g-yo ba ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the unshakable one?

original: brjod par bya ste nyon mongs pa mi skye ba shes pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste nyon mongs pa mi skye ba shes pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The unshakable one is the śrāvaka who is capable of the summit.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba shes pa ni rang rgyal byang chub kyi mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba shes pa ni rang rgyal byang chub kyi mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of nonarising of the afflictions is the unshakable state of the pratyekabuddha.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa the tshom shes pa mi skye ba shes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi g-yo ba'o /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa the tshom shes pa mi skye ba shes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi g-yo ba'o /
translated: The knowledge of nonarising of the afflictions of doubt is the unshakable state of the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: 'di rnams la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can kho na 'bras bu las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di rnams la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can kho na 'bras bu las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are of the nature of complete degeneration alone degenerate from their result.

original: dgra bcom pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But other arhats do not.

original: dgra bcom pa de ni khyad par rtogs pa las nyams par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa de ni khyad par rtogs pa las nyams par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: That arhat degenerates from the realization of distinction.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par las zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par las zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means from the distinction of samadhi.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gang las kyang yongs su mi nyams te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gang las kyang yongs su mi nyams te /
translated: The perfect buddha does not degenerate from anything at all.

original: kun nas rmongs pa ma yin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas rmongs pa ma yin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is of the nature of nondelusion.

original: rang rgyal gyi byang chub gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang rgyal gyi byang chub gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The two pratyekabuddha enlightenments are as follows.

original: bse ru ltar spyod pa dang / tshogs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bse ru ltar spyod pa dang / tshogs spyod pa'o //
translated: The rhinoceros-like and the congregating.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: There is only one perfect Buddha.

analyzed: gang zag gcig pu gang zag do med pa / brnyan @168a * // ma med pa'i gang zag mnyam pa med pa'i gang zag / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gang zag /'gran zla mnyam pa med pa'i gang zag ces pa la sogs pa'o // so so skye bo yang slob pa yang yin te / slob pa zhes brjod par mi bya zhing mi slob pa zhes kyang mi brjod do // dkon mchog gsum ni 'di lta ste /

original: de la chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of the Dharma Body is twofold:

original: 'dus ma byas dang / 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas dang / 'dus byas so //
translated: unconditioned and conditioned.

original: de la gang 'dus ma byas de ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa las byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang bzhin de nyid don dam pa ru rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang 'dus ma byas de ni de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa las byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang bzhin de nyid don dam pa ru rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The unconditioned should be understood as the ultimate reality of the Buddhas, which is their intrinsic reality arising from the purification of the Suchness of all things.

original: gang yang 'dus byas ni chos kyi bdag nyid kyi sku /
analyzed: gang yang 'dus byas ni chos kyi bdag nyid kyi sku /
translated: The conditioned is the Dharma Body of the nature of the Dharma,

original: stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i chos rang bzhin yongs su dag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i chos rang bzhin yongs su dag par shes par bya'o //
translated: which should be understood as the natural purity of the qualities of the Buddha, such as the powers and fearlessnesses.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid ni mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas yang dag par brgyan pa /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid ni mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas yang dag par brgyan pa /
translated: The nature of the Enjoyment Body is adorned with the major and minor marks,

original: sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi spyod yul te gzugs sku'o //
analyzed: sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi spyod yul te gzugs sku'o //
translated: and is the form body of the Buddhas, the domain of the great bodhisattvas who are on the ten stages.

original: sprul pa'i bdag nyid ni so so skye bo thams cad kyi spyod yul mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas yang dag par brgyan pa /
analyzed: sprul pa'i bdag nyid ni so so skye bo thams cad kyi spyod yul mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pas yang dag par brgyan pa /
translated: The emanation body is the body of form adorned with the major and minor marks, which is the domain of experience of all ordinary beings.🔽The enjoyment body is the body of enjoyment adorned with the major and minor marks, which is the domain of experience of all bodhisattvas.

original: gzugs sku nyid yin te /🔽sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //🔽brdar btags pa'i sangs rgyas kyang rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs sku nyid yin te / sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa lta bu'o // brdar btags pa'i sangs rgyas kyang rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reality body is the body of reality, which is the domain of experience of the tathagatas.🔽The emanation body is the body of emanation, which is the domain of experience of all ordinary beings.🔽The enjoyment body is the body of enjoyment adorned with the major and minor marks, which is the domain of experience of all bodhisattvas.

original: ring bsrel dang / mchod rten dang / sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan dang / ci tya'o //
analyzed: ring bsrel dang / mchod rten dang / sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan dang / ci tya'o //
translated: The reality body is the body of reality, which is the domain of experience of the tathagatas.🔽The emanation body is the body of emanation, which is the domain of experience of all ordinary beings.🔽The enjoyment body is the body of enjoyment adorned with the major and minor marks, which is the domain of experience of all bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sku dang lnga yin no zhes byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa smra'o //🔽chos ni gnyis yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sku dang lnga yin no zhes byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa smra'o // chos ni gnyis yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The reality body is the body of reality, which is the domain of experience of the tathagatas.🔽The emanation body is the body of emanation, which is the domain of experience of all ordinary beings.🔽The enjoyment body is the body of enjoyment adorned with the major and minor marks, which is the domain of experience of all bodhisattvas.

original: don dam pa pa dang / brdar btags pa pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa pa dang / brdar btags pa pa'o //
translated: The reality body is the body of reality, which is the domain of experience of the tathagatas.🔽The emanation body is the body of emanation, which is the domain of experience of all ordinary beings.🔽The enjoyment body is the body of enjoyment adorned with the major and minor marks, which is the domain of experience of all bodhisattvas.

original: de la dang po ni gcig nyid de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni gcig nyid de 'di lta ste /
translated: The reality body is the body of reality, which is the domain of experience of the tathagatas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //🔽brdar btags pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o // brdar btags pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emanation body is the body of emanation, which is the domain of experience of all ordinary beings.🔽The enjoyment body is the body of enjoyment adorned with the major and minor marks, which is the domain of experience of all bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag pa'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab po //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab po //
translated: The reality body is the body of reality, which is the domain of experience of the tathagatas.🔽The emanation body is the body of emanation, which is the domain of experience of all ordinary beings.

original: yang chos la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang chos la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The enjoyment body is the body of enjoyment

original: @168b lung gi chos dang / rtogs pa'i chos so //
analyzed: @168b lung gi chos dang / rtogs pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma of scripture and the Dharma of realization.

original: de la lung gi chos ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab bo //
analyzed: de la lung gi chos ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab bo //
translated: The Dharma of scripture is the Buddha's word.

original: rtogs pa'i chos ni drug ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i chos ni drug ste /
translated: The Dharma of realization is sixfold:🔽heat,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: peak,🔽patience,🔽the supreme mundane state,🔽the path of seeing,

original: drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / chos mchog dang / mthong lam dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i bsgom lam mo //
analyzed: drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / chos mchog dang / mthong lam dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i bsgom lam mo //
translated: and the path of cultivation together with its result.

original: dge 'dun la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Sangha is twofold:

original: don dam pa pa dang / brdar btags pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa pa dang / brdar btags pa'o //
translated: the ultimate Sangha and the nominal Sangha.

original: de la don dam pa pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la don dam pa pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ultimate Sangha is twofold:🔽the Sangha of sravakas, the eight kinds of noble beings,

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun skyes bu chen po gang zag brgyad dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i tshogs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun skyes bu chen po gang zag brgyad dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i tshogs so //
translated: and the assembly of great bodhisattvas who are irreversible from the great enlightenment.

original: de la skyes bu chen po gang zag brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la skyes bu chen po gang zag brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight kinds of noble beings are:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa dang / lan cig 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa dang / lan cig 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: the stream-enterer, the once-returner, the non-returner, the one who is a candidate for the fruit of stream-enterer, the one who is a candidate for the fruit of once-returner, the one who is a candidate for the fruit of non-returner, the one who is a candidate for the fruit of arhatship, the arhat, the pratyekabuddha, and the bodhisattva.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: 1. the candidate for the fruit of Stream-Winner, 2. the Stream-Winner, 3. the candidate for the fruit of Once-Returner, 4. the Once-Returner, 5. the candidate for the fruit of Never-Returner, 6. the Never-Returner, 7. the candidate for the fruit of Arhatship, 8. the Arhat.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five irreversible Bodhisattvas are:

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa can dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / nges pa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / nges par skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa can dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / rtsol ba med pa'i mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang / nges pa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / nges par skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'o //
translated: 1. the one who has the pure superior intention, 2. the one who is in the signless abode with effort, 3. the one who is in the signless abode without effort, 4. the one who has entered the certain conduct, 5. the one who is obstructed by one birth.

original: lhag par mos pa can yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa can yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes smra'o //
translated: The one who has the superior intention is also an irreversible Bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lnga po 'di rnams la so sor phye bas sngon du gsungs pa bzhin du dang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa gang zag nyi shu ni dge 'dun no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga po 'di rnams la so sor phye bas sngon du gsungs pa bzhin du dang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa gang zag nyi shu ni dge 'dun no //
translated: The Sangha is the twenty individuals, such as the one who follows faith, that are distinguished from these five kinds of bodhisattvas, as previously mentioned.

original: brdar btags pa'i dge 'dun gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brdar btags pa'i dge 'dun gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three kinds of nominal Sangha are as follows:

original: lhag par mos pa can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma nges pa so so skye bo'i dge 'dun dang / so so skye bo'i dge slong dang / so so skye bo'i dge slong ma'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma nges pa so so skye bo'i dge 'dun dang / so so skye bo'i dge slong dang / so so skye bo'i dge slong ma'i dge 'dun no //
translated: the Sangha of ordinary beings who have a superior aspiration but are not destined for complete enlightenment, the Sangha of ordinary male monks, and the Sangha of ordinary female nuns.

original: des na de nyid skyabs gsum yin te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des na de nyid skyabs gsum yin te 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, they are the three refuges:

original: skyabs sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / skyabs chos dkon mchog dang / skyabs dge 'dun dkon mchog ste /
analyzed: skyabs sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / skyabs chos dkon mchog dang / skyabs dge 'dun dkon mchog ste /
translated: the Jewel of the Buddha, who is the refuge, the Jewel of the Dharma, which is the refuge, and the Jewel of the Sangha, which is the refuge.

original: de la dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni 'jigs pa brgyad las skyob pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de la dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni 'jigs pa brgyad las skyob pa'i don du'o //
translated: Taking refuge in the Three Jewels is for the sake of protection from the eight dangers.

original: de la 'jigs pa brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'jigs pa brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight dangers are as follows:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyi 'jigs @169a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang / nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyi 'jigs @169a * //
translated: the fear of all misdeeds,🔽the fear of all calamities,🔽the fear of all lower realms,🔽the fear of all lower realms that are in accordance with one's actions,

original: pa dang / ka shi'i 'jigs pa dang / nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gro thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i ngan 'gro thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang / 'jig tshogs kyi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang / ka shi'i 'jigs pa dang / nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang / ngan 'gro thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i ngan 'gro thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang / 'jig tshogs kyi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: the fear of the perishable collection,

original: theg pa dman pa'i 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa'i 'jigs pa'o //
translated: and the fear of the lower vehicle.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'phags pa'i 'jig rten rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'phags pa'i 'jig rten rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eleventh chapter, on the noble world, in this Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, a commentary on the scriptures of the Great Vehicle.

original: // /'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: // /'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four noble truths are as follows:

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: and the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: de rnams 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rim pas bstan par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de rnams 'bras bu dang rgyu'i rim pas bstan par bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are to be taught in the order of result and cause as follows:

original: sdug bsngal 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'bras bu'o //
translated: Suffering is the result.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba rgyu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba rgyu'o //
translated: The origin of suffering is the cause.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'bras bu'o //
translated: The cessation of suffering is the result.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam rgyu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam rgyu'o //
translated: The path leading to the cessation of suffering is the cause.

original: yang bden pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang bden pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, there are two truths:

original: kun rdzob bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa gsum ni kun rdzob bden pa'o /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa gsum ni kun rdzob bden pa'o /
translated: Among them, the three noble truths are the conventional truth.

original: de yang ci ltar sdug bsngal bden pa dang / kun 'byung bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ci ltar sdug bsngal bden pa dang / kun 'byung bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is as follows: the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin, and the truth of the path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa gcig ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa gcig ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: One noble truth is the ultimate truth.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation of suffering.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa gnyis ni 'di ltar spang bya dang / blang bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa gnyis ni 'di ltar spang bya dang / blang bya'o //
translated: The two noble truths are to be abandoned and to be adopted.

original: de la bden pa gnyis ni spang bya'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa gnyis ni spang bya'o //
translated: Among them, the two truths are to be abandoned.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of suffering and the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: bden pa gnyis ni blang bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ni blang bya ste /
translated: The two truths are to be adopted.🔽They are as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation and the truth of the path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa de rnams yongs su bcad pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa de rnams yongs su bcad pa gsum ste /
translated: Those noble truths are threefold:

original: 'di ltar / rang bzhin yongs su bcad pa dang / bya ba yongs su bcad pa dang / bya ba mthar phyin pa yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang bzhin yongs su bcad pa dang / bya ba yongs su bcad pa dang / bya ba mthar phyin pa yongs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The determination of their nature, the determination of their function, and the determination of the completion of their function.

original: de la rang bzhin yongs su bcad pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin yongs su bcad pa ni 'di lta ste / 'di ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Among them, the determination of their nature is as follows:🔽This is suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o /
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i @169b lam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i @169b lam mo //
translated: This is the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: bya ba yongs su bcad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bya ba yongs su bcad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The determination of their function is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know suffering.

original: kun 'byung spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should abandon the origin.

original: 'gog pa mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du bya'o //
translated: One should manifest the cessation.

original: lam bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the path.

original: bya ba mthar phyin pa yongs su bcad pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bya ba mthar phyin pa yongs su bcad pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is the determination of the completion of action, as follows:

original: sdug bsngal shes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes so //
translated: One has known suffering.

original: kun 'byung spangs so //
analyzed: kun 'byung spangs so //
translated: One has abandoned the origin.

original: 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: One has manifested the cessation.

original: lam bsgoms so //
analyzed: lam bsgoms so //
translated: One has cultivated the path.

original: yongs su bcad pa gsum po 'di nyid la yongs su bzlas pa gsum zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yongs su bcad pa gsum po 'di nyid la yongs su bzlas pa gsum zhes brjod do //
translated: These three determinations are also called the three revolutions.

original: yang bden pa so so la rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: yang bden pa so so la rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, each truth has three aspects.

original: de la sdug bsngal bden pa'i rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal bden pa'i rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three aspects of the truth of suffering are as follows:

original: sdug bsngal rang bzhin dang yongs su shes par bya ba nyid dang / yongs su shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rang bzhin dang yongs su shes par bya ba nyid dang / yongs su shes pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of suffering, that which is to be fully known, and full knowledge.

original: kun 'byung gi rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three aspects of the origin are as follows:

original: kun 'byung ba'i rang bzhin dang / spang bya nyid dang / spangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i rang bzhin dang / spang bya nyid dang / spangs pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of origination, that which is to be abandoned, and abandonment.

original: 'gog pa'i rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three aspects of cessation are as follows:

original: 'gog pa'i rang bzhin dang / mngon du bya ba nyid dang / mngon du byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rang bzhin dang / mngon du bya ba nyid dang / mngon du byas pa nyid do //
translated: its realization.

original: lam gyi rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three aspects of the truth of the path are:🔽its nature,🔽what is to be cultivated, and

original: lam gyi rang bzhin dang / bsgom bya nyid dang / bsgoms pa nyid do //
analyzed: lam gyi rang bzhin dang / bsgom bya nyid dang / bsgoms pa nyid do //
translated: what has been cultivated.

original: yang sdug bsngal bden pa'i yongs su bzlas pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal bden pa'i yongs su bzlas pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the three recitations of the truth of suffering are as follows:

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni yongs su bzlas pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni yongs su bzlas pa gcig go //
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering is the first recitation.

original: de dag yongs su shes par bya ba nyid do zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su shes par bya ba nyid do zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: It is to be fully understood is the second.

original: de dag yongs su shes pa nyid do zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su shes pa nyid do zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: It has been fully understood is the third.

original: yongs su bzlas pa so so la mig skye'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzlas pa so so la mig skye'o //
translated: In each recitation, the eye arises.

original: shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: shes pa skye'o //
translated: Knowledge arises.

original: rig pa skye'o //
analyzed: rig pa skye'o //
translated: Awareness arises.

original: blo skye'o // rnam pa bzhi bzhi ste rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: blo skye'o // rnam pa bzhi bzhi ste rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: Intelligence arises. There are four aspects each, making twelve aspects.

original: de la mig ces pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
analyzed: de la mig ces pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
translated: Among them, the eye is the eye of the buddhas.

original: shes pa zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: shes pa zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Knowledge is non-conceptual wisdom.

original: rig pa zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i don yin pas mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i don yin pas mi slob pa'o //
translated: The word “knowledge” means the truth of the path, because it is the correct object.

original: blo zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: blo zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The word “intelligence” means the knowledge of all aspects.

original: kun 'byung gi yongs su bzlas pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi yongs su bzlas pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three repetitions of the origin are as follows.

original: 'di ni kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni yongs su bzlas pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni yongs su bzlas pa gcig go //
translated: “This is the origin of suffering” is the first repetition.

original: de dag spangs par bya'o zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag spangs par bya'o zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: “They should be abandoned” is the second.

original: de dag spangs so zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dag spangs so zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: “They have been abandoned” is the third.

original: yongs su ldabs pa so so la de bzhin du rnam pa bcu gnyis nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su ldabs pa so so la de bzhin du rnam pa bcu gnyis nyid do //
translated: In each repetition, there are twelve aspects, just as before.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i yongs su ldabs pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /🔽'di ni 'gog pa @170a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i yongs su ldabs pa gsum ni 'di lta ste / 'di ni 'gog pa @170a * //
translated: The three repetitions of the truth of cessation are as follows.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni yongs su bzlas pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni yongs su bzlas pa gcig go //
translated: “This is the cessation of suffering” is the first repetition.

original: de dag mngon du bya'o zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mngon du bya'o zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: “They should be manifested” is the second.

original: de dag mngon du byas so zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mngon du byas so zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: “They have been manifested” is the third.

original: yongs su ldabs pa so so la de bzhin du rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: yongs su ldabs pa so so la de bzhin du rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: In each repetition, there are twelve aspects, just as before.

original: lam gyis yongs su bzlas pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam gyis yongs su bzlas pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three revolutions of the path are as follows:

original: 'di ni lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yongs su bzlas pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yongs su bzlas pa gcig go //
translated: This is the noble truth of the path. This is the first revolution.

original: de dag bsgom par bya'o zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bsgom par bya'o zhes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: They should cultivate it. This is the second.

original: de dag bsgoms pa nyid do zhes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bsgoms pa nyid do zhes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: They have cultivated it. This is the third.

original: yongs su ldabs pa so so la de bzhin du rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: yongs su ldabs pa so so la de bzhin du rnam pa bcu gnyis so //
translated: In this way, there are twelve aspects for each revolution.

original: des na bden pa so so la bzlas pa rnam gsum gyis dang / yongs su bzlas pa re re la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: des na bden pa so so la bzlas pa rnam gsum gyis dang / yongs su bzlas pa re re la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, each of the four noble truths has three revolutions, and each revolution has four aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos gsungs pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos gsungs pas na /
translated: Since the Tathagata taught the Dharma with twelve aspects,

original: yongs su bzlas pa gsum rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yongs su bzlas pa gsum rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro zhes brjod do //
translated: it is said that he turned the wheel of the Dharma with three revolutions and twelve aspects.

original: yang 'phags pa'i bden pa so so la rnam pa bzhi ste rnam pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: yang 'phags pa'i bden pa so so la rnam pa bzhi ste rnam pa bcu drug go //
translated: Moreover, each of the four noble truths has four aspects, making sixteen aspects.
