original: de la sdug bsngal bden pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal bden pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four aspects of the truth of suffering that are discordant with it are as follows:

original: rtag par sgro 'dogs pa dang / bde bar sgro 'dogs pa dang / bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa dang / bdag gi bar sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par sgro 'dogs pa dang / bde bar sgro 'dogs pa dang / bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa dang / bdag gi bar sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of reifications are: reification of permanence, reification of pleasure, reification of self, and reification of mine.

original: grangs bzhin du de dag gi gnyen po sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: grangs bzhin du de dag gi gnyen po sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four aspects of suffering, which are the antidotes to those, are as follows:

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong ba'o //
translated: impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and emptiness.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four aspects of the truth of origin that are adverse are as follows:

original: chos thams cad rgyu med par sgro 'dogs pa dang / chos thams cad sems pa med pa'i dus la sogs pa rtag pa'i rgyu can du sgro btags pa dang / chos thams cad sgra'i tshangs pa la sogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rgyu can du sgro btags pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad rgyu med par sgro 'dogs pa dang / chos thams cad sems pa med pa'i dus la sogs pa rtag pa'i rgyu can du sgro btags pa dang / chos thams cad sgra'i tshangs pa la sogs pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rgyu can du sgro btags pa dang /
translated: reification of all phenomena as causeless, reification of all phenomena as having a cause that is permanent, such as time, which is not a conscious being, reification of all phenomena as having a cause that is a transformation of sound, such as the brahman, and

original: chos thams cad blo dang ldan pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu can du sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad blo dang ldan pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu can du sgro btags pa'o //
translated: reification of all phenomena as having a cause that is an intelligent isvara, and so on.

original: rim pa bzhin du de rnams kyi gnyen po kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du de rnams kyi gnyen po kun 'byung gi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four aspects of origination that are their antidotes are, in order:

original: rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen no //
analyzed: rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen no //
translated: cause, origination, strong generation, and condition.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i mi mthun phyogs kyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i mi mthun phyogs kyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four aspects that are the counteragents to the four aspects of the truth of cessation are:

original: thar pa med do //
analyzed: thar pa med do //
translated: There is no liberation.

original: thar pa sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: thar pa sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Liberation is suffering.

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba gya nom pa'o //
translated: The bliss of the meditative concentrations is sublime.

original: grol ba yang yang 'khor bar ltung ba @170b yod do zhes so //
analyzed: grol ba yang yang 'khor bar ltung ba @170b yod do zhes so //
translated: There is a falling away from liberation.

original: grangs bzhin du de rnams kyi gnyen po 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: grangs bzhin du de rnams kyi gnyen po 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four aspects of cessation that are their antidotes are, in order:

original: 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: cessation, peace, sublime, and definite emergence.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i mi mthun phyogs kyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i mi mthun phyogs kyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four aspects that are the counteragents to the four aspects of the truth of the path are:

original: thar par 'gro ba'i lam med do //
analyzed: thar par 'gro ba'i lam med do //
translated: There is no path that leads to liberation.

original: lam 'di ngan pa'o //
analyzed: lam 'di ngan pa'o //
translated: This path is bad.

original: lam gzhan yod do //
analyzed: lam gzhan yod do //
translated: There is another path.

original: phyir ldog pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: phyir ldog pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path leads to falling away.

original: grangs bzhin du de rnams kyi gnyen po lam gyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: grangs bzhin du de rnams kyi gnyen po lam gyi rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four aspects of the path that are their antidotes are as follows:

original: lam nyid dang rig pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin par byed pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' theg pa pa rnams ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brangs nas grangs bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la bzhi dang bcu gcig dang bdun dang bdun te /
analyzed: lam nyid dang rig pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin par byed pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' theg pa pa rnams ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brangs nas grangs bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la bzhi dang bcu gcig dang bdun dang bdun te /
translated: the path itself, correct knowledge, practice, and definite release.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam pa nyi shu dgu yin no zhes bshad do //🔽de la sdug bsngal bden pa'i rnam pa la bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnam pa nyi shu dgu yin no zhes bshad do // de la sdug bsngal bden pa'i rnam pa la bzhi ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas who follow the Twenty-Five Thousand Stanza Perfection of Wisdom Sūtra explain that there are twenty-nine aspects of the four noble truths: four, eleven, seven, and seven, respectively.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The four aspects of the truth of suffering are as follows:🔽impermanence,🔽suffering,🔽selflessness, and

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang bdag med pa dang / stong ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang bdag med pa dang / stong ba'o //
translated: emptiness.

original: kun 'byung bden pa'i rnam pa bcu gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung bden pa'i rnam pa bcu gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The eleven aspects of the truth of the origin of suffering are as follows:

original: nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / rab tu nyams pa'i chos nyid dang / g-yo ba dang / 'jig pa nyid dang / 'jigs pa nyid dang / nye bar 'tshe ba nyid dang / nye bar gnod pa nyid do //
analyzed: nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / rab tu nyams pa'i chos nyid dang / g-yo ba dang / 'jig pa nyid dang / 'jigs pa nyid dang / nye bar 'tshe ba nyid dang / nye bar gnod pa nyid do //
translated: the nature of complete degeneration,🔽movement,🔽destruction,🔽fear,🔽harm,🔽and injury.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven aspects of the truth of cessation are as follows:🔽selflessness,🔽peace,🔽isolation,🔽emptiness,🔽signlessness,🔽wishlessness,

original: bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / dben pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du byed med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / dben pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du byed med pa nyid do //
translated: and non-production.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa la bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa la bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven aspects of the truth of the path are as follows:🔽selflessness,🔽peace,🔽truth,🔽emptiness,

original: bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / bden pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid dang / zhi ba nyid dang / bden pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid do //
translated: signlessness,🔽wishlessness,🔽and non-production.

original: bden pa rnams kyi rnam par spyad pa yang ni /
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyi rnam par spyad pa yang ni /
translated: The practice of the truths is also like this.

original: dper na sman pas nad pa'i nad mthong nas nad kyi gzhi yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: dper na sman pas nad pa'i nad mthong nas nad kyi gzhi yongs su rtog go //
translated: For example, a doctor, having seen a patient's disease, investigates the cause of the disease.

original: de nas nad byang ba mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: de nas nad byang ba mtshon par byed do //
translated: Then he shows the patient the cure.

original: de nas nad spyod pa'i thabs sman rjes su sbyor ba'i gdams pa byed do //
analyzed: de nas nad spyod pa'i thabs sman rjes su sbyor ba'i gdams pa byed do //
translated: Then he gives instructions on the application of medicine, the means of curing the disease.

original: de bzhin du bla na med pa'i sman pa de bzhin gshegs pas rnal 'byor pa'i sdug bsngal mthong nas 'di'i rgyu gang yin zhes kun 'byung la nges par @171a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du bla na med pa'i sman pa de bzhin gshegs pas rnal 'byor pa'i sdug bsngal mthong nas 'di'i rgyu gang yin zhes kun 'byung la nges par @171a * //
translated: In the same way, the Unsurpassed Doctor, the Tathagata, having seen the suffering of the yogi, investigates the cause of this, the origin.

original: spyod do // de nas kun 'byung 'gags pa las sdug bsngal zad pa'i mthar phyin pa skye ba med pa 'gog pa'i bden pa dmigs kyis 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: spyod do // de nas kun 'byung 'gags pa las sdug bsngal zad pa'i mthar phyin pa skye ba med pa 'gog pa'i bden pa dmigs kyis 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Then he shows the yogi the cessation of suffering, the non-arising of suffering, which is the object of the truth of cessation.

original: de nas sdug bsngal zad pa'i thabs lam gyi bden pa goms par byed pa'i gdams pa byed do //
analyzed: de nas sdug bsngal zad pa'i thabs lam gyi bden pa goms par byed pa'i gdams pa byed do //
translated: Then he gives instructions on the means of ending suffering, the truth of the path.

original: de la skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang rga ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams kyis 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis dang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dag gis 'khor ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnam par shes pa ming
analyzed: de la skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang rga ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams kyis 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis dang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dag gis 'khor ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnam par shes pa ming
translated: The suffering of birth, the suffering of aging, and so on are the suffering of contaminated formations and the suffering of suffering and the suffering of change.🔽🔽The five appropriated aggregates of cyclic existence are consciousness, name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, and feeling.

original: dang gzugs skye mched drug reg pa tshor ba skye ba rga shi rnams kyi yan lag gi bdag nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: dang gzugs skye mched drug reg pa tshor ba skye ba rga shi rnams kyi yan lag gi bdag nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is the five appropriated aggregates of cyclic existence, which are the nature of the limbs of birth, aging, and so on, and the nature of the limbs of consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, aging, and death.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The truth of origin is the cause of suffering, which is threefold:

original: rgyun gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po dang / ma rig pa sred pa nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang / 'du byed dang srid pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las ni kun 'byung bden pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po dang / ma rig pa sred pa nye bar len pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang / 'du byed dang srid pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las ni kun 'byung bden pa'o //
translated: The appropriated aggregates that are the basis of the continuum, the afflictions that are characterized by ignorance and craving, and karma that is characterized by formation and becoming.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'gog pa de yang rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa de yang rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cessation is twofold:

original: so sor rtog pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor rtog min gyi 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor rtog min gyi 'gog pa'o //
translated: cessation through deliberation and cessation not through deliberation.

original: yang 'gog pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang 'gog pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, cessation is twofold:

original: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba zhes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of cessation and knowledge of non-arising.

original: yang 'gog pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang 'gog pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, cessation is twofold:

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings dang / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
translated: the realm of nirvana with a remaining basis and the realm of nirvana without remaining basis.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rnam par bzhag pa de dag theg pa gsum la ci rigs par rnam pa bcu gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rnam par bzhag pa de dag theg pa gsum la ci rigs par rnam pa bcu gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: These presentations of the realm of nirvana should be known as thirteen types in the three vehicles, as appropriate.

original: mtshan nyid las dang / zag pa las dang / de'i cha shas mya ngan las 'das pa dang / don dam pa dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rgyan med pa dang / rgyan dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid las dang / zag pa las dang / de'i cha shas mya ngan las 'das pa dang / don dam pa dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rgyan med pa dang / rgyan dang bcas pa dang /
translated: In terms of characteristic, in terms of outflows, in terms of a portion of that, in terms of the ultimate, in terms of incomplete, in terms of complete, in terms of unadorned, in terms of adorned, in terms of the basis, in terms of the path, in terms of the result, in terms of the cause, and in terms of the fruition.

original: khyad par can ma yin pa dang / khyad par can dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / rnam grangs las so //
analyzed: khyad par can ma yin pa dang / khyad par can dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / rnam grangs las so //
translated: the non-special, the special, the remaindered, the remainderless, and the nominal.

original: de la mtshan nyid kyis 'gog pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /🔽lam gang gis 'gog par byed pa de ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyis 'gog pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste / lam gang gis 'gog par byed pa de ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: Among these, cessation by way of characteristic is twofold:🔽That by which one causes cessation is cessation.

original: gang dag 'gags pa de 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag 'gags pa de 'gog pa'o //
translated: That which has ceased is cessation.

original: zad pas 'gog pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zad pas 'gog pa rnam pa bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cessation by way of exhaustion is fourfold:

original: 'gog pa de ni gzhan du brjod du med do//
analyzed: 'gog pa de ni gzhan du brjod du med do//
translated: That cessation is inexpressible as other.

original: @171b gzhan ma yin par brjod du med do //🔽gnyi gar brjod du med do //
analyzed: @171b gzhan ma yin par brjod du med do // gnyi gar brjod du med do //
translated: It is inexpressible as non-other.🔽It is inexpressible as both.

original: gnyi ga ma yin par brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin par brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: It is inexpressible as neither.

original: de'i cha shas mya ngan las 'das pas 'gog pa ni gcig ste /
analyzed: de'i cha shas mya ngan las 'das pas 'gog pa ni gcig ste /
translated: Cessation by way of the part of nirvana is one:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis gang nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis gang nyon mongs pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: that which is the cessation of afflictions by the mundane path.🔽Cessation by way of the ultimate is one:

original: don dam pa'i 'gog pa ni gcig nyid de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i 'gog pa ni gcig nyid de 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi sa bon dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa yang dag par gcod pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi sa bon dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa yang dag par gcod pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is cessation which is the complete cutting off of the defilements together with their seeds by means of the supramundane path.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i 'gog pa la bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i 'gog pa la bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cessation not fully accomplished is fourfold:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i 'gog pa ma yin pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pas bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i 'gog pa ma yin pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pas bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is cessation included in the fruit of stream-enterer, cessation not included in the fruit of once-returner, cessation included in the fruit of non-returner, and cessation included in the fruit of arhat.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cessation fully accomplished is one:

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bus yongs su bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bus yongs su bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is cessation included in the fruit of arhat.

original: rgyan med pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyan med pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cessation without adornment is one:

original: dgra bcom pa sems rnam par grol ba rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa sems rnam par grol ba rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is cessation of those arhats whose minds are liberated.

original: rgyan dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyan dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cessation that is accompanied by adornments is one,

original: dgra bcom pa gnyi ga'i cha las grol ba rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gnyi ga'i cha las grol ba rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: which is the cessation of the arhats who are liberated from both aspects.

original: de la gnyi ga'i cha ni sgrib pa gnyis te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gnyi ga'i cha ni sgrib pa gnyis te 'di lta ste /
translated: The two aspects are the two obstructions,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: which are the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to the object of knowledge.

original: khyad du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyad du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cessation that is not distinguished is one,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag rnam par grol ba nyan thos rnams kyi dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa phyogs gcig rnam par grol ba rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag rnam par grol ba nyan thos rnams kyi dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa phyogs gcig rnam par grol ba rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: which is the cessation of the śrāvakas who are liberated from all of the afflictive obstructions and the cessation of the pratyekabuddhas who are liberated from all of the afflictive obstructions and from a portion of the obstructions to the object of knowledge.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cessation that is distinguished is one,🔽which is the cessation of the bodhisattvas who are liberated from all of the afflictive obstructions and from a portion of the obstructions to the object of knowledge.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa lhag ma dang bcas pa rnam par grol ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa lhag ma dang bcas pa rnam par grol ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of the completely perfect Buddhas who are completely liberated from all the remaining knowable obscurations.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cessation with remainder is one,

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings so //
translated: namely, the realm of nirvana with remainder of aggregates.

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gog pa la gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cessation without remainder is one,

original: @172a * // phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: @172a * // phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings so //
translated: namely, the realm without remainder of aggregates.

original: rnam grangs las 'gog pa la rnam grangs nyi shu dgu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs las 'gog pa la rnam grangs nyi shu dgu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Cessation in terms of synonyms is nineteen,

original: ma lus par spangs pa dang / nges par spangs pa dang / byang bar gyur pa dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / nub pa dang / 'dus ma byas dang /
analyzed: ma lus par spangs pa dang / nges par spangs pa dang / byang bar gyur pa dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / nub pa dang / 'dus ma byas dang /
translated: namely, complete abandonment, definite abandonment, purification, exhaustion, freedom from attachment, cessation, complete peace, disappearance, unconditioned,

original: blta dka' ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / mi gzhol ba dang / mi 'chi ba dang / zag pa med pa dang / gnas dang / gling dang / skyob pa dang / skyabs dang / 'dren pa dang / mi 'pho ba dang / rims med pa dang /
analyzed: blta dka' ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / mi gzhol ba dang / mi 'chi ba dang / zag pa med pa dang / gnas dang / gling dang / skyob pa dang / skyabs dang / 'dren pa dang / mi 'pho ba dang / rims med pa dang /
translated: free from fever,🔽bliss,🔽peace,🔽the supreme state,🔽the attainment of well-being,🔽freedom from disease,🔽non-activity,

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / bde ba dang / zhi ba dang / dngos po mchog las byung ba dang / bde legs grub pa dang / nad med pa dang / mi spyod pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / bde ba dang / zhi ba dang / dngos po mchog las byung ba dang / bde legs grub pa dang / nad med pa dang / mi spyod pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: and nirvana.

original: de la ma lus par spangs pa zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma lus par spangs pa zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the abandonment of all is the brief teaching.

original: kun nas dkris pa spangs pa ni nges par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa spangs pa ni nges par spangs pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of entanglements is the definite abandonment.

original: bag la nyal byang bar byed pas byang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal byang bar byed pas byang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The purification of latent tendencies is the purification.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis de lta bu de rnams kun du sbyor ba spangs pa'i dbang du byas te zad pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis de lta bu de rnams kun du sbyor ba spangs pa'i dbang du byas te zad pa'o //
translated: By the path of seeing, those are abandoned through the power of abandoning the fetters.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis kun du sbyor ba spangs pa'i dbang du byas te chags pa dang 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis kun du sbyor ba spangs pa'i dbang du byas te chags pa dang 'bral ba'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is the detachment from passion, in the sense of the abandonment of the fetters.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i las dag gis kun du sbyor ba spangs pas yang mi skye ba sdug bsngal 'gags pa 'di ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i las dag gis kun du sbyor ba spangs pas yang mi skye ba sdug bsngal 'gags pa 'di ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation of suffering is the non-arising of suffering due to the abandonment of the fetters by the paths of insight and cultivation.

original: mthong ba'i chos la yid mi bde ba nye bar zhi bas rnam par zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la yid mi bde ba nye bar zhi bas rnam par zhi ba'o //
translated: The peace of suffering is the pacification of mental dissatisfaction in this life.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba ma lus par bral bas nub pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba ma lus par bral bas nub pa'o //
translated: The disappearance of suffering is the complete absence of injury.

original: de rnams ni ma lus par spangs pa rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni ma lus par spangs pa rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: These are the detailed explanations of the complete abandonment of suffering.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang bral bas 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum dang bral bas 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The unconditioned is free from the three characteristics of the conditioned.

original: sha dang lha'i spyan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir blta dka' ba'o //
analyzed: sha dang lha'i spyan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir blta dka' ba'o //
translated: The difficult to see is so called because it is not the domain of the eye of flesh or the divine eye.

original: 'gro ba lnga ru rgyu ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga ru rgyu ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The immovable is so called because it does not move into the five destinies.

original: khams gsum gyi sred pa gsum med pas srid pa rnams su mi dmas pa'i phyir mi gzhom pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi sred pa gsum med pas srid pa rnams su mi dmas pa'i phyir mi gzhom pa'o //
translated: The invincible is so called because it cannot be destroyed by the three cravings of the three realms.

original: phung po'i bdud dang mi ldan pas mi 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud dang mi ldan pas mi 'chi ba'o //
translated: It is not subject to death, since it is not subject to the demon of the aggregates.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang mi ldan pas zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang mi ldan pas zag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without outflows, since it is not subject to the demon of the afflictions.

original: rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang rten yin pa'i phyir gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba dang rten yin pa'i phyir gnas so //
translated: It is a resting place, since it is the support for the joy of liberation.

original: khams gsum yongs su bcad pas gling ngo //
analyzed: khams gsum yongs su bcad pas gling ngo //
translated: It is an island, since it is the refuge for those who are exhausted in the three realms.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad bzlog pas skyob pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad bzlog pas skyob pa'o //
translated: It is a protector, since it wards off all violence.

original: rten gyi sbyor ba 'bras @172b bu yod pa'i gzhi'i gnas nyid yin pas skyabs so //
analyzed: rten gyi sbyor ba 'bras @172b bu yod pa'i gzhi'i gnas nyid yin pas skyabs so //
translated: It is a refuge, since it is the basis for the application of support that has a result.

original: 'phags pa dam pa rnams kyis bgrod pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pas 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa rnams kyis bgrod pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pas 'dren pa'o //
translated: It is a guide, since it is the basis for the journey of holy noble ones.

original: mi skye ba nyid yin pas 'khrul pa mi srid pa'i phyir mi 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba nyid yin pas 'khrul pa mi srid pa'i phyir mi 'pho ba'o //
translated: It is not subject to transference, since it is not subject to birth and error is impossible.

original: 'dod pa thams cad nyams pa'i gdung ba med pas rims med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad nyams pa'i gdung ba med pas rims med pa'o //
translated: It is without fever, since it is free from the torment of the loss of all desires.

original: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa la sogs pa'i yongs su gdung ba med pas bsil bar gyur pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa la sogs pa'i yongs su gdung ba med pas bsil bar gyur pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa'o //
translated: It is free from all the torments of sorrow, lamentation, suffering, depression, and disturbance, and so it is refreshing.

original: na ba dang / rga shi'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba 'phags pa'i gnas pa'i rten yin pas bde ba'o //
analyzed: na ba dang / rga shi'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba 'phags pa'i gnas pa'i rten yin pas bde ba'o //
translated: It is the basis of the noble abodes, free from the fear of sickness, old age, and death, and so it is happiness.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rten yin pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rten yin pas zhi ba'o //
translated: It is the basis of all virtuous qualities, and so it is peace.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa bde ba'i dngos po nyid yin pas dngos po mchog las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa bde ba'i dngos po nyid yin pas dngos po mchog las byung ba'o //
translated: It is the supreme substance, since it is the substance of supramundane happiness.

original: sbyor ba bde bas bde ba thob pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pas bde legs grub pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bde bas bde ba thob pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pas bde legs grub pa'o //
translated: It is the accomplishment of well-being, since it is the substance of the attainment of well-being through the happiness of practice.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa sgrib pa'i nad dang bral ba'i phyir nad med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa sgrib pa'i nad dang bral ba'i phyir nad med pa'o //
translated: It is health, since it is free from the sickness of the obscurations of the addictions and so on.

original: sgros  pa'i g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sgros  pa'i g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: It is unshakable, since it is free from all the distractions of conceptual thought.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba zhi ba dang bde bar gnas pa'i dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba zhi ba dang bde bar gnas pa'i dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is nirvana, because it is the object of the peaceful and blissful abiding that is free from all discriminations of form, etc.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la rnam pa mang ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la rnam pa mang ste /
translated: The cessation that is a non-analytical cessation is of many types.

original: de ltar yang //🔽kun du sbyor ba'i rdzas ni ci snyed pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang // kun du sbyor ba'i rdzas ni ci snyed pa //
translated: Thus,🔽The substances of the fetters

original: kun du sbyor ba bral rdzas de snyed do //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba bral rdzas de snyed do //
translated: are the same number as the substances of the freedom from the fetters.

original: zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //🔽kun du sbyor ba'i gnyen po ci snyed pa //
analyzed: zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o // kun du sbyor ba'i gnyen po ci snyed pa //
translated: This is the tenet.🔽The substances of the antidotes to the fetters

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa de snyed do //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa de snyed do //
translated: are the same number as the cessations that are analytical cessations.

original: yang gsungs te /
analyzed: yang gsungs te /
translated: It is also said:

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang // bral ba so sor tha dad do //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang // bral ba so sor tha dad do //
translated: Analytical cessation and freedom are individually different.🔽The two paths are:

original: zhes so // lam la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhes so // lam la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the supramundane and

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: the mundane.

original: de la 'jig rten pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The two mundane paths are:🔽the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation and

original: grol ba'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: grol ba'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de la grol ba'i cha dang mthun pa la rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la grol ba'i cha dang mthun pa la rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The factors conducive to liberation are of three kinds:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bo dang / yang dag par spong ba'i ngo bo dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i ngo bo dang / yang dag par spong ba'i ngo bo dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: those whose nature is the applications of mindfulness, those whose nature is the right efforts, and those whose nature is the bases of supernatural power.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight are of two kinds:

original: dbang po lnga'i rang bzhin dang / stobs lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i rang bzhin dang / stobs lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: those whose nature is the five powers and those whose nature is the five forces.

original: dang po la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The first of these is of two kinds:

original: @173a * // drod thob pa dang / rtse mor phyin pa'o //
analyzed: @173a * // drod thob pa dang / rtse mor phyin pa'o //
translated: those who have attained the stage of heat and those who have attained the peak.

original: gnyis pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is of two kinds:

original: bzod par rtogs pa dang / chos mchog tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzod par rtogs pa dang / chos mchog tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: those who have realized patience and those who have realized the highest quality.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The supramundane path is of two kinds:

original: byang chub yan lag bdun gyi rang bzhin mthong lam dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi rang bzhin bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag bdun gyi rang bzhin mthong lam dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi rang bzhin bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: the path of seeing, whose nature is the seven aids to enlightenment, and the path of meditation, whose nature is the eightfold noble path.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The path of seeing is of two kinds:

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi ngo bo dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi ngo bo dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: the nature of the uninterrupted path and the nature of the liberated path.

original: de la bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin la rnam pa brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin la rnam pa brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of the uninterrupted path is eightfold:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, the perseverance for the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering, the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to origin, the perseverance for the subsequent knowledge with regard to origin, the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to cessation,

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: the perseverance for the subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation, the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the path, and the perseverance for the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin la yang brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin la yang brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of the liberated path is also eightfold:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa dang /
translated: Knowledge of the factors of the truth of suffering, subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, knowledge of the factors of the truth of origin, subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin, knowledge of the factors of the truth of cessation, subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation,

original: lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of the factors of the truth of path and subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The stages of realization are as follows:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la chos shes pa dang /
translated: Acceptance of the knowledge of the factors of the truth of suffering, knowledge of the factors of the truth of suffering, acceptance of the subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, acceptance of the knowledge of the factors of the truth of origin, knowledge of the factors of the truth of origin,

original: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to the origin, the subsequent knowledge with regard to the origin, the perseverance for the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to cessation, the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to cessation, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation,

original: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: the subsequent knowledge with regard to cessation, the perseverance for the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to the path, the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to the path, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to the path, and the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: skad cig ma bcu drug ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The sixteen moments are focused on the four truths.

original: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa'i skad cig ma @173b brgyad ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa'i skad cig ma @173b brgyad ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Among them, the eight moments of perseverance for the knowledge of the doctrine and the knowledge of the doctrine are the antidote to the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: gzhan rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma brgyad ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gzhan rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma brgyad ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The other eight moments of perseverance for subsequent knowledge and subsequent knowledge are the antidote to the afflictions of the form and formless realms.

original: de la bzod pa'i skad cig ma thams cad ni rkun po 'thon pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa spangs pas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i skad cig ma thams cad ni rkun po 'thon pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa spangs pas bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: All moments of acceptance are of the nature of the uninterrupted path, because they abandon the passions, like the expulsion of a thief.

original: nyon mongs pa thob pa gcod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thob pa gcod par byed pa ste /
translated: They cut off the possession of the passions.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba rnams shes rab kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'o //🔽chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyang nyon mongs pa spangs pa la sgo glegs gcod pa'i rigs las rtsom pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba rnams shes rab kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'o // chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyang nyon mongs pa spangs pa la sgo glegs gcod pa'i rigs las rtsom pa dang ldan pa'o // rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni /
translated: The moments of the knowledge of the teaching and subsequent knowledge are of the nature of the path of liberation, because they are the first knowledge of the abandonment of the passions.🔽They are like the closing of a door after the thief has been expelled.🔽The moments of the knowledge of the teaching and subsequent knowledge are of the nature of the path of liberation, because they are the first knowledge of the abandonment of the passions.

original: nyon mongs pa bral ba thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bral ba thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the moments of the knowledge of the teaching and subsequent knowledge are of the nature of the path of liberation, because they are the first knowledge of the abandonment of the passions.

original: gzhan dag bcu gnyis ni mngon du byed pa yin la rjes su shes pa nyid ni nges pa'i bdag nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag bcu gnyis ni mngon du byed pa yin la rjes su shes pa nyid ni nges pa'i bdag nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the first twelve are the path of insight, and subsequent knowledge is of the nature of the path of cultivation.

original: 'di dag ni spyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni spyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: These are the practices.

original: de rnams la skad cig bco lnga ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de rnams la skad cig bco lnga ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: These fifteen moments are the path of seeing.

original: de la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The yogi who is in them is said to be entered into the result of stream-enterer.

original: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The sixteenth moment, subsequent knowledge of the path, is the path of cultivation.

original: de la gnas pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa nyid do //
translated: The yogi who is in it is a stream-enterer.

original: rgyun ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: rgyun ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i lam ste /
translated: The stream is the path that goes to the ocean of nirvana.

original: de la zhugs pa ni thob pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhugs pa ni thob pa byas pa'o //
translated: One who has entered it has attained it.

original: 'dir mthong ba'i lam la shes rab dgur 'gyur te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir mthong ba'i lam la shes rab dgur 'gyur te 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, on the path of seeing, there are nine wisdoms:

original: 'dod du spang bya sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung spangs pa dang / 'dod du 'gog pa mthong bas spang bya spangs pa dang / 'dod du lam mthong bas spangs bya spangs pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs khams su gsum dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod du spang bya sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung spangs pa dang / 'dod du 'gog pa mthong bas spang bya spangs pa dang / 'dod du lam mthong bas spangs bya spangs pa dang / de bzhin du gzugs khams su gsum dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su gsum mo //
translated: The abandonment of the suffering and origin of the desire realm, the abandonment of the objects to be abandoned by seeing the cessation of the desire realm, the abandonment of the objects to be abandoned by seeing the path of the desire realm, and likewise three in the form realm and three in the formless realm.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong ba'i don yang dang yang du rtsol bas bsgom pa de nyid rtsol bya dang rten bya yin pas lam mo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong ba'i don yang dang yang du rtsol bas bsgom pa de nyid rtsol bya dang rten bya yin pas lam mo //
translated: The path is the repeated cultivation of the meaning that is seen by the path of seeing, since it is that which is to be striven for and the basis of striving.🔽

original: 'dis na bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis na bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is so called because one cultivates again and again the object seen by the path of insight, and because it is the basis of the path.

original: de la yang gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yang gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is twofold:

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: the path of cultivation without intervals and the path of cultivation with intervals.

original: de la bar chad med pa'i lam ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dbye ba dgu'i gnyen po dbye ba dgu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la bar chad med pa'i lam ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dbye ba dgu'i gnyen po dbye ba dgu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The path of cultivation without intervals is the antidote to the nine categories of defilements of the realm of desire.

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / mchog go /
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / mchog go /
translated: These nine categories are weak, medium, strong, weak-medium, medium-strong, weak-strong, medium-weak, strong-weak, medium-medium.

original: yang re re la gsum du phye ste /
analyzed: yang re re la gsum du phye ste /
translated: Each of these categories is divided into three:

original: chung ngu'i @174a * //
analyzed: chung ngu'i @174a * //
translated: weak-weak, weak-medium, weak-strong.

original: chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi rab dang / rab kyi chung ngu dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi rab ste dbye ba dgu'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi rab dang / rab kyi chung ngu dang / rab kyi 'bring dang / rab kyi rab ste dbye ba dgu'o //
translated: The nine are: small, middling of small, great of small, small of middling, middling of middling, great of middling, small of great, middling of great, and great of great.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i sa la nyon mongs pa dbye ba dgu'i gnyen po dbye ba dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i sa la nyon mongs pa dbye ba dgu'i gnyen po dbye ba dgu'o //
translated: Similarly, on the level of the first concentration, there are nine divisions of afflictions and nine divisions of antidotes.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa la nyon mongs pa dbye ba dgu'i gnyen po rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa la nyon mongs pa dbye ba dgu'i gnyen po rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Similarly, on the level of the second concentration, there are nine divisions of afflictions and nine divisions of antidotes.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa la nyon mongs pa dgu'i gnyen po dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa la nyon mongs pa dgu'i gnyen po dgu'o //
translated: Similarly, on the level of the third concentration, there are nine divisions of afflictions and nine divisions of antidotes.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa la dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa la dgu'o //
translated: Similarly, on the level of the fourth concentration, there are nine.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la dgu'o //
translated: Similarly, on the level of the base of infinite space, there are nine.

original: de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la dgu'o //
translated: Similarly, on the level of the base of infinite consciousness, there are nine.

original: de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched la dgu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched la dgu'o //
translated: Similarly, on the level of the base of nothingness, there are nine.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la dgu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la dgu ste /
translated: So too, there are nine for the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: 'khor ba'i sa dgu pa so sor dgu dgu ste dgu pa dgu ni lam gyi dbye ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig go //🔽kun sbyor rdzas ni ci snyed pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sa dgu pa so sor dgu dgu ste dgu pa dgu ni lam gyi dbye ba brgyad cu rtsa gcig go // kun sbyor rdzas ni ci snyed pa //
translated: Thus there are nine for each of the nine levels of samsara, making a total of eighty-one divisions of the path.🔽As many as the substances of fetters

original: kun sbyor bral rdzas de snyed do //🔽zhes byas so //🔽bar chad med pa'i lam de rnams kyi bar dang bar du rnam par grol ba'i lam yang brgyad cu rtsa gcig ni 'di lta bu nyid do //🔽kha cig na re lam dbye ba dgu yin te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun sbyor bral rdzas de snyed do // zhes byas so // bar chad med pa'i lam de rnams kyi bar dang bar du rnam par grol ba'i lam yang brgyad cu rtsa gcig ni 'di lta bu nyid do // kha cig na re lam dbye ba dgu yin te 'di lta ste /
translated: are the substances of freedom from fetters.🔽The liberated paths are the same as the uninterrupted paths.🔽Some say: There are nine divisions of the path because the small of the small antidote is the path abandoning the great of the great affliction of the nine levels. The medium of the small antidote is the path abandoning the medium of the great affliction of the nine levels. The great of the small antidote is the path abandoning the small of the great affliction of the nine levels.

original: sa dgu'i chen po'i chen po nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pa chung ngu'i chung ngu lam dang / sa dgu'i chen po'i 'bring nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po chung ngu'i 'bring gi lam dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa chen po'i chung ngu'i gnyen po lam chung ngu'i chen po dang /
analyzed: sa dgu'i chen po'i chen po nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pa chung ngu'i chung ngu lam dang / sa dgu'i chen po'i 'bring nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po chung ngu'i 'bring gi lam dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa chen po'i chung ngu'i gnyen po lam chung ngu'i chen po dang /
translated: The small of the medium antidote is the path abandoning the great of the medium affliction of the nine levels. The medium of the medium antidote is the path abandoning the medium of the medium affliction of the nine levels. The great of the medium antidote is the path abandoning the small of the medium affliction of the nine levels.

original: sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa 'bring gi chen po'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi chung ngu dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa 'bring gi gnyen po lam 'bring gi 'bring dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa 'bring gi chung ngu gnyen po lam 'bring gi chen po dang /
analyzed: sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa 'bring gi chen po'i gnyen po lam 'bring gi chung ngu dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa 'bring gi gnyen po lam 'bring gi 'bring dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa 'bring gi chung ngu gnyen po lam 'bring gi chen po dang /
translated: The antidote to the great of the middling afflictions of the nine levels is the small of the middling path, the antidote to the middling of the middling afflictions of the nine levels is the middling of the middling path, the antidote to the small of the middling afflictions of the nine levels is the great of the middling path,

original: sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chen po'i gnyen po lam chen po'i chung ngu dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i 'bring gi gnyen po lam chen po'i 'bring dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i gnyen po lam chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chen po'i gnyen po lam chen po'i chung ngu dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i 'bring gi gnyen po lam chen po'i 'bring dang / sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i gnyen po lam chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: the antidote to the great of the small afflictions of the nine levels is the small of the great path, the antidote to the middling of the small afflictions of the nine levels is the middling of the great path, and the antidote to the small of the small afflictions of the nine levels is the great of the great path.

original: dper na skyes bu dpa' bo gcig gis dgra mang po yang rab te 'joms pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu dpa' bo gcig gis dgra mang po yang rab te 'joms pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as a single hero can kill many enemies,

original: lam gcig gis nyon mongs pa rab tu mang ba rnams rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed @174b do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lam gcig gis nyon mongs pa rab tu mang ba rnams rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed @174b do zhes zer ro //
translated: so too a single path can uproot the many afflictions.

original: phyogs 'di la gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say that this position

original: lam gyi rnam pa dgu pas sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa dgu pa chung ngu'i chung ngu spangs pa na /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa dgu pas sa dgu'i nyon mongs pa dgu pa chung ngu'i chung ngu spangs pa na /
translated: If the ninth stage of the path abandons the ninth affliction of the nine stages,

original: spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pas de nyid kyi tshe rnal 'byor pa khams gsum la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dgra bcom par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pas de nyid kyi tshe rnal 'byor pa khams gsum la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dgra bcom par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the yogi would become an arhat free from attachment to the three realms, since there would be no affliction to abandon.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: If that were so,🔽then all presentations would be undermined, such as:🔽From the complete exhaustion of the sixth

original: 'dod par rnam pa drug pa dang / dgu pa yang dag zad pa las //🔽lam gcig 'ong dang mi 'ong ba'i //
analyzed: 'dod par rnam pa drug pa dang / dgu pa yang dag zad pa las // lam gcig 'ong dang mi 'ong ba'i //
translated: and ninth aspects in the desire realm,🔽there is one path,

original: gang zag dag tu 'gyur ba'o //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam bar gzhag pa thams cad nyams par 'gyur bas gus par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang zag dag tu 'gyur ba'o // zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam bar gzhag pa thams cad nyams par 'gyur bas gus par mi byed do //
translated: and there are two types of persons who come and do not come.

original: spong ba na yang /
analyzed: spong ba na yang /
translated: Also, when abandoning,

original: dang por mthu rnams kyis gzhis ltar yon tan thams cad kyi rten tshul khrims zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dang por mthu rnams kyis gzhis ltar yon tan thams cad kyi rten tshul khrims zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that at the beginning, like the foundation of a house, ethics is the basis of all good qualities.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas brtul zhugs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom par rtsom pa na /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas brtul zhugs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom par rtsom pa na /
translated: When the yogi who has taken up the vows of individual liberation and abides in discipline begins to practice meditation,

original: sbyor ba'i dus su dam pa ma yin pa'i tshogs pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dus su dam pa ma yin pa'i tshogs pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: At the time of application, one should avoid the company of the unrighteous and unrighteous thoughts.

original: de la gang zag rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gang zag rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are two kinds of persons:

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: those who are given to passion and those who are given to discursive thought.

original: de la 'dod chags la spyod pas mi sdug pa bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas zhi gnas bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la spyod pas mi sdug pa bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas zhi gnas bskyed par bya'o //
translated: For those who are given to passion, the development of serenity should be preceded by the meditation on foulness.

original: de la 'dod chags la dgu ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la dgu ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are nine kinds of passion:🔽passion for shape,

original: dbyibs la chags pa dang / sdug pa la chags pa dang / lus kyi dri tsan dan la sogs pas skyed pa la chags pa dang / lus mdzes pa rgyan la sogs pas bskyed pa la chags pa dang / lus kyi mdog la chags pa dang /
analyzed: dbyibs la chags pa dang / sdug pa la chags pa dang / lus kyi dri tsan dan la sogs pas skyed pa la chags pa dang / lus mdzes pa rgyan la sogs pas bskyed pa la chags pa dang / lus kyi mdog la chags pa dang /
translated: passion for beauty, passion for the fragrance of the body produced by sandalwood, etc., passion for the beauty of the body produced by ornaments, etc., passion for the complexion of the body, passion for the touch of the body, passion for the voice, passion for the gait, and passion for the glance of the body.

original: sha rgyas pa la chags pa dang / lus dang yan lag sgeg pa la chags pa dang / so mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pa la chags pa dang / mdog dang dbyibs la chags pa'o //
analyzed: sha rgyas pa la chags pa dang / lus dang yan lag sgeg pa la chags pa dang / so mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pa la chags pa dang / mdog dang dbyibs la chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment to the body's flesh, attachment to the body's limbs and body parts, attachment to the body's beauty, and attachment to the body's color and shape.

original: grangs bzhin du de rnams kyi gnyen po mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i dbye ba rnam pa dgu ni 'di lta ste /🔽rnam par spangs pa bzhin du rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes dang / yan lag cha shas tha dad du gyur pas rnam par zhig pa'i 'du shes dang / dri ngan pa rnag gi rang bzhin yin pas rnam par rnags pa'i 'du shes dang / pags pa bshus pa bzhin rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes dang /
analyzed: grangs bzhin du de rnams kyi gnyen po mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i dbye ba rnam pa dgu ni 'di lta ste / rnam par spangs pa bzhin du rnam par bam pa'i 'du shes dang / yan lag cha shas tha dad du gyur pas rnam par zhig pa'i 'du shes dang / dri ngan pa rnag gi rang bzhin yin pas rnam par rnags pa'i 'du shes dang / pags pa bshus pa bzhin rnam par dmar ba'i 'du shes dang /
translated: The nine types of meditation on foulness are the antidotes to these, respectively.

original: rul ba'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam par bsngos pa'i 'du shes dang / mi gtsang ba spungs pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par ring du gyur pas @175a * //
analyzed: rul ba'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam par bsngos pa'i 'du shes dang / mi gtsang ba spungs pa'i 'du shes dang / rnam par ring du gyur pas @175a * //
translated: The nine types of meditation on foulness are the perception of bloated corpses, the perception of festering corpses, the perception of corpses with traumatic injuries, the perception of dismembered corpses, the perception of corpses gnawed by animals, the perception of corpses burned by fire, the perception of corpses eaten by worms, the perception of corpses as skeletons, and the perception of corpses as decomposed.

original: rnam par 'byer ba'i 'du shes dang / rus pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas keng rus kyi 'du shes dang / rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: rnam par 'byer ba'i 'du shes dang / rus pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pas keng rus kyi 'du shes dang / rnam par tshig pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: the perception of the skeleton, because of the nature of bones; and the perception of burning, because of the nature of fire.

original: 'di bsgom pa las nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par rengs par byed cing zhi gnas rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di bsgom pa las nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par rengs par byed cing zhi gnas rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The cultivation of these perceptions causes the defilements to be paralyzed and brings about the completion of serenity.

original: rnam par rtog pa la dpyod pas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba zhi gnas skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la dpyod pas dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba zhi gnas skyed par byed do //
translated: The mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, preceded by the investigation of conceptual thoughts, generates serenity.

original: de la dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa la drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa la drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation has six aspects:

original: bgrang ba dang / rjes su bgrod pa dang / gnas pa dang / mtshon par byed pa dang / sgyur ba dang / yongs su dag pa'o //🔽de la rngub pa ni dbugs te 'jug pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: bgrang ba dang / rjes su bgrod pa dang / gnas pa dang / mtshon par byed pa dang / sgyur ba dang / yongs su dag pa'o // de la rngub pa ni dbugs te 'jug pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: counting, following, fixing, characterizing, transforming, and purifying.🔽Inhalation is the breath that enters, the wind that enters inside.

original: 'byung ba ni dbugs te phyir 'byung ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni dbugs te phyir 'byung ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: Exhalation is the breath that exits, the wind that exits outside.

original: rlung de dag la dmigs par byed pa'i shes rab ni rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: rlung de dag la dmigs par byed pa'i shes rab ni rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that observes those winds is mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: de la bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems kyi grangs te 'jug pa dang 'byung ba tsam la sems brlan nas bgrang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems kyi grangs te 'jug pa dang 'byung ba tsam la sems brlan nas bgrang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Counting is the number of the body and mind. The mind is focused on mere inhalation and exhalation and is counted.

original: gcig gnyis nas bcu'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gcig gnyis nas bcu'i bar du'o //
translated: From one to ten.

original: de bzhin du yang dang yang du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dang yang du'o //
translated: And so on again and again.

original: 'di la skyon gsum ste 'di lta ste /🔽ma tshang ba bgrang ba ni gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'di la skyon gsum ste 'di lta ste / ma tshang ba bgrang ba ni gang gi tshe /
translated: There are three faults in this:🔽Incomplete counting is when two are held as one.

original: gnyis la gcig tu 'dzin pa dang / lhag pa bgrang ba ni gang gi tshe gcig la gnyis su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis la gcig tu 'dzin pa dang / lhag pa bgrang ba ni gang gi tshe gcig la gnyis su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Excessive counting is when one is held as two.

original: bsres pa ni gang gi tshe 'jug pa la 'byung bar 'dzin pa dang / 'byung ba la 'jug par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bsres pa ni gang gi tshe 'jug pa la 'byung bar 'dzin pa dang / 'byung ba la 'jug par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Mixed counting is when inhalation is held as exhalation and exhalation is held as inhalation.

original: de las gzhan du bgrang ba ni yang dag pa'i bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan du bgrang ba ni yang dag pa'i bgrang ba'o //
translated: Counting other than that is correct counting.

original: bar du g-yeng bar gyur na /
analyzed: bar du g-yeng bar gyur na /
translated: If distracted in the middle,

original: yang dag pa nas bgrang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nas bgrang bar bya'o //
translated: one should count from the beginning.

original: ci srid du ting nge 'dzin rdzogs par ma gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ci srid du ting nge 'dzin rdzogs par ma gyur pa de srid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate for as long as one has not perfected samādhi.🔽Following is

original: rjes su bgrod pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su bgrod pa zhes pa ni /
translated: the exhalation of the vāyu.

original: 'jug pa'i rlung ni mi rtsol la rim gyis mgrin pa snying ga lte ba rked pa brla rje ngar nas zhugs te rkang pa'i bar du nye bar bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rlung ni mi rtsol la rim gyis mgrin pa snying ga lte ba rked pa brla rje ngar nas zhugs te rkang pa'i bar du nye bar bgrod pa'o //
translated: The vāyu that enters is exhaled gradually from the throat, the heart, the navel, the waist, the thighs, the calves, and the toes.

original: 'byung ba'i rlung ni mtho gcig gam gnyis sam ci srid du 'dom gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rlung ni mtho gcig gam gnyis sam ci srid du 'dom gyi bar du'o //
translated: The vāyu that exits is exhaled once or twice or as long as an arm span.

original: gnas pa zhes pa sna'i rtse nas rkang pa'i mtheb chen gyi bar du gnas pa nor bu'i skud pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes pa sna'i rtse nas rkang pa'i mtheb chen gyi bar du gnas pa nor bu'i skud pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: Abiding is seeing the vāyu abiding from the tip of the nose to the toes, like a thread of jewels.

original: ci 'di dag rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'am nye bar gnod pa byed pa'am bsil ba'am dro ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci 'di dag rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'am nye bar gnod pa byed pa'am bsil ba'am dro ba zhes pa'o //
translated: Is it nourishing, harmful, cooling, or warming?

original: mtshon par byed pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mtshon par byed pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Indication is

original: 'di dag ni rlung 'ba' zhig kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rlung 'ba' zhig kho na ma yin te /
translated: that this is not only the vāyu.

original: 'di ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang @175b de la brten pa dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang @175b de la brten pa dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
translated: This is the four great elements, that which is based on them, that which is derived from the elements, and mind and mental factors.

original: phung po lnga ru nye bar mtshon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga ru nye bar mtshon par byed pa'o //
translated: They are illustrated by the five aggregates.

original: sgyur ba zhes pa rlung la dmigs pa'i blo bzlog ste /
analyzed: sgyur ba zhes pa rlung la dmigs pa'i blo bzlog ste /
translated: “Transformation” means turning away the mind that observes the breath.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gong ma la nges par sbyor ba ci srid du chos mchog la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gong ma la nges par sbyor ba ci srid du chos mchog la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the application of the roots of virtue to the higher stages, as long as one is engaged in the application of the supreme dharma and so forth.

original: yongs su dag pa zhes pa ci srid du mthong lam la sogs pa la nges par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa zhes pa ci srid du mthong lam la sogs pa la nges par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Purification” means applying oneself to the path of seeing and so forth.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par nges par byed cing zhi gnas rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba rjes su dran pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par nges par byed cing zhi gnas rdzogs par byed do //
translated: This mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation ascertains the afflictions and completes śamatha.

original: de la mi rtag pa bsgom pa'am 'byung 'jug rjes su dran pa bsgoms pas zhi gnas rdzogs pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa bsgom pa'am 'byung 'jug rjes su dran pa bsgoms pas zhi gnas rdzogs pa la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: There, cultivating impermanence or cultivating mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation completes śamatha, and one should cultivate the foundations of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni zhi gnas nges par rdzogs par bya zhes so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ni zhi gnas nges par rdzogs par bya zhes so //
translated: The cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is the completion of the perfection of meditative absorption.

original: de la dang po mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba'i 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen po lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / de nas sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen po tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: de la dang po mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba'i 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen po lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / de nas sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen po tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
translated: The application of mindfulness of the body is the antidote to the error of perceiving the impure as pure. The application of mindfulness of feeling is the antidote to the error of perceiving that which is painful is pleasurable.

original: de nas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen po sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / de nas bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen po chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen po sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / de nas bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes phyin ci log gi gnyen po chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The application of mindfulness of mind is the antidote to the error of perceiving that which is impermanent as permanent. The application of mindfulness of phenomena is the antidote to the error of perceiving that which is insubstantial as substantial.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they focus on the reality of phenomena such as faith.

original: bzhi po de rnams ni gzugs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gzugs so zhes pa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dang / stong pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis ngal so ba med par sems kyis gzhigs te bsgom mo //
analyzed: bzhi po de rnams ni gzugs par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyis gzugs so zhes pa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dang / stong pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis ngal so ba med par sems kyis gzhigs te bsgom mo //
translated: These four are to be cultivated by the mind, without any sense of weariness, by way of their specific characteristics, such as “form is characterized by being molested,” and by way of their general characteristic, which is the nature of emptiness.

original: de'i rjes su sems 'dis yang dag par 'dzin par byed pas yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su sems 'dis yang dag par 'dzin par byed pas yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should cultivate the four right efforts, because this mind correctly grasps them.

original: bzhi po de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzhi po de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mi dge ba skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang / mi dge ba ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang / dge ba skyes pa rnams 'phel ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang / ma skyes pa'i dge ba rnams skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang / mi dge ba ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang / dge ba skyes pa rnams 'phel ba'i phyir 'dun pa dang / ma skyes pa'i dge ba rnams skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa'o //
translated: the will to abandon those nonvirtues that have arisen, the will not to give rise to those nonvirtues that have not yet arisen, the will to increase those virtues that have arisen, and the will to give rise to those virtues that have not yet arisen.

original: 'dun pa ni 'dir brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni 'dir brtson 'grus so //
translated: Here, will is the same as effort.

original: de'i rjes su 'jig rten las 'das pa rdzu 'phrul gyi go 'phang gi gnas yin pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jig rten las 'das pa rdzu 'phrul gyi go 'phang gi gnas yin pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should cultivate the four bases of supernatural power, because they are the basis for the attainment of the supramundane supernatural power.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dun pa drag po dang ldan pas sems rtsa gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ting nge @176a * //
analyzed: 'dun pa drag po dang ldan pas sems rtsa gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ting nge @176a * //
translated: Concentration, which is characterized by a single area of mind, is endowed with intense aspiration.

original: 'dzin ni 'dun pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin ni 'dun pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: This is the base of supernatural power of aspiration.

original: mi dge ba spong ba dang dge ba bskyed pa la yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus kyis rab tu ldan pa'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin ni brtson 'grus kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba spong ba dang dge ba bskyed pa la yang dag par spong ba'i brtson 'grus kyis rab tu ldan pa'i sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin ni brtson 'grus kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
