translated: Concentration, which is characterized by a single area of mind, is endowed with the effort of the correct abandonment of the non-virtuous and the cultivation of the virtuous.🔽This is the base of supernatural power of effort.🔽Concentration, which is characterized by a single area of mind, is endowed with the mental training in the sign of equanimity that is the instigation of tranquility.

original: zhi gnas rab tu slong ba btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma sems kyis sbyong bar byed pas sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin ni sems kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas rab tu slong ba btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma sems kyis sbyong bar byed pas sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin ni sems kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: This is the base of supernatural power of mind.

original: ci bdag ni mi dge ba phra mo la kun du dpyod pa /
analyzed: ci bdag ni mi dge ba phra mo la kun du dpyod pa /
translated: Is it the case that I am thoroughly investigating even the subtle non-virtuous?

original: bdag ni rtog pa la yongs su dpyod pa'o zhes yang dag par dmigs par byed pa sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin ni dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rtog pa la yongs su dpyod pa'o zhes yang dag par dmigs par byed pa sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid ting nge 'dzin ni dpyod pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: The concentration that is the one-pointedness of mind which correctly observes “I am investigating” is the foot of investigation-inspired-rigor.

original: de rnams rdzogs par skyes pa na kun nas dkris pa rnams spangs shing /
analyzed: de rnams rdzogs par skyes pa na kun nas dkris pa rnams spangs shing /
translated: When these are fully generated, one abandons the entanglements

original: bag la nyal rnams spang ba'i phyir yang /
analyzed: bag la nyal rnams spang ba'i phyir yang /
translated: and, in order to abandon the latencies,

original: yang dag par spong ba'i brtson pa rtsom par byed pa na /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba'i brtson pa rtsom par byed pa na /
translated: one begins the effort of correct abandonment.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the eight applications of abandonment arise.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:🔽aspiration, thinking “When will I generate mundane and supramundane meditative attainment?” effort, in order to destroy nonvirtue,

original: dus nam 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyom par 'jug pa skye bar 'gyur zhes 'dun pa dang / mi dge ba rnams gzhom pa'i phyir brtson 'grus dang / rtogs pa gang ma dad pa dang / dad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa dang /
analyzed: dus nam 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyom par 'jug pa skye bar 'gyur zhes 'dun pa dang / mi dge ba rnams gzhom pa'i phyir brtson 'grus dang / rtogs pa gang ma dad pa dang / dad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa dang /
translated: pliancy preceded by faith and lack of faith,

original: de la'ang dran pa shes bzhin gyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs shes bzhin dang / de'ang sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid sems pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid btang snyoms so //
analyzed: de la'ang dran pa shes bzhin gyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs shes bzhin dang / de'ang sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid sems pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid btang snyoms so //
translated: Moreover, it is the volition that has the characteristic of mental activity, and it is equanimity that has the characteristic of non-defilement.

original: de rnams ni tshogs kyi lam ste thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de rnams ni tshogs kyi lam ste thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes brjod do //
translated: These are the path of accumulation, and are called the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: de'i rjes su de bzhin du yongs su sbyang ba byas pas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su de bzhin du yongs su sbyang ba byas pas /
translated: After that, by thoroughly purifying in the same way,

original: yul bden pa bzhi mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug tu bsgom pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: yul bden pa bzhi mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug tu bsgom pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: the nature of the meditation on the four noble truths and their sixteen aspects such as impermanence,

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'i ngo bo /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'i ngo bo /
translated: the essence of the antidote to the view of self,

original: 'jig rten pa la sbyor ba'i lam /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la sbyor ba'i lam /
translated: the mundane path,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni rnam pa bzhin 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni rnam pa bzhin 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: the roots of virtue that are conducive to penetration become four types.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gtsub shing gi me'i sngon du dro ba'i ngo bo bzhin du /
analyzed: gtsub shing gi me'i sngon du dro ba'i ngo bo bzhin du /
translated: Just as before the fire of the friction stick has the nature of heat,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i me'i sngon du yul bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug gi ngo bo drod dang / de nas de dang 'dra ba nyid du g-yo ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi spyi bo yin pa'i phyir rtse mor phyin pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i me'i sngon du yul bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug gi ngo bo drod dang / de nas de dang 'dra ba nyid du g-yo ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi spyi bo yin pa'i phyir rtse mor phyin pa dang /
translated: Prior to the supramundane path, heat and peak are the roots of virtue that are similar to the aspects and stages of the four noble truths and they are the summit of the roots of virtue.🔽Then, since all are accepted, there is acceptance.

original: de nas thams cad bzod pa'i phyir @176b bzod pa dang / de nas 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi rtse mo'i phyir chos mchog go //
analyzed: de nas thams cad bzod pa'i phyir @176b bzod pa dang / de nas 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi rtse mo'i phyir chos mchog go //
translated: Then, since they are the summit of all mundane states, there is the supreme mundane state.

original: de la drod dang rtse mo'i rang bzhin dad pa brtson 'grus dran pa ting nge 'dzin shes rab lnga ni /
analyzed: de la drod dang rtse mo'i rang bzhin dad pa brtson 'grus dran pa ting nge 'dzin shes rab lnga ni /
translated: The nature of heat and peak is the five faculties of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration and wisdom.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bskyed pa la bdag por gyur pa thob pa'i phyir na dbang por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bskyed pa la bdag por gyur pa thob pa'i phyir na dbang por gyur pa yin no //
translated: Since they obtain the state of being dominant in generating supramundane states, they are called faculties.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa la sbyor ba'i rtags mthong ba las gong ma'i chos skyed pa ma nges pa skyes pa'i phyir dang ston pa'i lhag par rtogs pa la mngon par yid ches pa'i phyir dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa la sbyor ba'i rtags mthong ba las gong ma'i chos skyed pa ma nges pa skyes pa'i phyir dang ston pa'i lhag par rtogs pa la mngon par yid ches pa'i phyir dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of faith is the cause of the generation of the higher qualities, because it is the cause of the generation of the qualities of the higher stages, through seeing the signs of the application of the bases of supernatural power.

original: dad pa lhag pa las brtson 'grus dran pa ting nge 'dzin shes rab lhag pa can no //
analyzed: dad pa lhag pa las brtson 'grus dran pa ting nge 'dzin shes rab lhag pa can no //
translated: Faith is superior to the others, and so too are effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: dbang po lnga nyid sgom par byed pa ni de ltar 'phel ba las ci ltar bdud la sogs rnams kyis mi thub pa'i phyir dang rnam par nyes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir stobs zhes pa'i ming thob bo //
analyzed: dbang po lnga nyid sgom par byed pa ni de ltar 'phel ba las ci ltar bdud la sogs rnams kyis mi thub pa'i phyir dang rnam par nyes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir stobs zhes pa'i ming thob bo //
translated: The five faculties are called powers when they are cultivated in such a way that they cannot be overcome by their opposites, because they are not overcome by their opposites.

original: stobs de rnams ni bzod pa dang chos mchog gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: stobs de rnams ni bzod pa dang chos mchog gi rang bzhin no //
translated: These powers are by nature the receptivities and the supreme mundane state.

original: de'i rjes su mthong ba'i lam skye ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthong ba'i lam skye ste /
translated: The path of seeing arises after that.

original: de'ang zag pa med pa yin pas 'phags pa'i lam 'jig rten las 'das pa /
analyzed: de'ang zag pa med pa yin pas 'phags pa'i lam 'jig rten las 'das pa /
translated: Since it is uncontaminated, it is the supramundane ārya path.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas med par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the complete elimination of the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /🔽'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gegs bcu 'dod chags khong khro nga rgyal ma rig pa the tshom 'jig tshogs la lta ba log par lta ba mthar 'dzin par lta ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gegs bcu 'dod chags khong khro nga rgyal ma rig pa the tshom 'jig tshogs la lta ba log par lta ba mthar 'dzin par lta ba /
translated: When the receptivity to the knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering is arising,

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams kyis thob pa gcod par byed do //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams kyis thob pa gcod par byed do //
translated: the ten obstructions to the knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering are eliminated: desire, hatred, pride, ignorance, doubt, the afflicted view of the self, the extreme view, holding a view as paramount, holding ethics and spiritual disciplines as paramount, and desire for becoming.

original: de nas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nyon mongs pa mi ldan pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
analyzed: de nas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nyon mongs pa mi ldan pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
translated: Then, the knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering, which is free of afflictions, arises simultaneously with the attainment of the elimination of those.

original: de'i rjes su sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na /
translated: After that, when the receptivity to the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering is arising,

original: de rnams la khong khro ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: de rnams la khong khro ma gtogs pa /
translated: those except for hatred are eliminated.

original: gzugs na spyod pa sdug bsngal bden pa'i gegs dgu dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal gegs dgu ste /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa sdug bsngal bden pa'i gegs dgu dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa sdug bsngal gegs dgu ste /
translated: The nine obstructions to the truth of suffering in the form realm and the nine obstructions to the truth of suffering in the formless realm.

original: bag la nyal bco brgyad rnams kyis thob pa rnams gcod pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal bco brgyad rnams kyis thob pa rnams gcod pa'o //
translated: Obtainment of the truths is severed by the eighteen latent states.

original: de nas sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa nyon mongs pa mi ldan pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
analyzed: de nas sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa nyon mongs pa mi ldan pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
translated: Then, the subsequent perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering is generated simultaneously with the obtainment of the uncontaminated subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de'i rjes su kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
translated: After that, when the perseverance for the Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin is generated,

original: de rnams la 'jig tshogs la lta ba mthar 'dzin par lta ba tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: de rnams la 'jig tshogs la lta ba mthar 'dzin par lta ba tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa /
translated: the seven obstructions to the origin of the desire realm, except for the afflicted view of the self, extreme view and clinging to rules and ritual as supreme,

original: 'dod @177a * //🔽pa na spyod pa kun 'byung gi gegs bdun rnams kyis thob pa gcod pa'o //🔽de nas kun 'byung la chos shes pa nyon mongs pa mi ldan pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
analyzed: 'dod @177a * // pa na spyod pa kun 'byung gi gegs bdun rnams kyis thob pa gcod pa'o // de nas kun 'byung la chos shes pa nyon mongs pa mi ldan pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
translated: are severed.🔽Then, the uncontaminated Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin is generated simultaneously with the obtainment of that.

original: de nas kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
analyzed: de nas kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
translated: After that, when the perseverance for the subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin is generated,

original: de rnams la khong khro ba ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: de rnams la khong khro ba ma gtogs pa /
translated: Except for anger,

original: kun 'byung gegs 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa drug ste bag la nyal bcu gnyis rnams kyis thob pa rnams gcod pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gegs 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa drug ste bag la nyal bcu gnyis rnams kyis thob pa rnams gcod pa'o //
translated: the obtainment of the twelve latent states of the two higher realms is severed.

original: de nas kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa nyon mongs pa bral ba thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
analyzed: de nas kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa nyon mongs pa bral ba thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
translated: Then the subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin arises simultaneously with the obtainment of freedom from affliction.

original: de'i rjes su 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
translated: After that, when the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation arises,

original: de kho na bzhin du /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du /
translated: just like that,

original: 'gog pa'i gegs 'dod pa na spyod pa nyon mongs pa bdun rnams kyis thob pa gcod do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i gegs 'dod pa na spyod pa nyon mongs pa bdun rnams kyis thob pa gcod do //
translated: the obtainment of the seven afflictions of the desire realm that obstruct cessation is severed.

original: de nas 'gog pa la chos shes pa nyon mongs pa mi ldan pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
analyzed: de nas 'gog pa la chos shes pa nyon mongs pa mi ldan pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
translated: Then the Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation arises simultaneously with the obtainment of freedom from affliction.

original: de'i rjes su 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
translated: After that, when the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation arises,

original: de rnams la khong khro ma gtogs pa 'gog pa'i gegs gzugs na spyod pa drug dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa drug ste /
analyzed: de rnams la khong khro ma gtogs pa 'gog pa'i gegs gzugs na spyod pa drug dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa drug ste /
translated: Except for anger, the other hindrances to the path are the six actions of the desire realm and the six of the form realm.🔽

original: bag la nyal bcu gnyis kyis thob pa gcod pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal bcu gnyis kyis thob pa gcod pa'o //
translated: Except for anger, the twelve latent states of the six types of conduct subsumed by the form realm and the six types of conduct subsumed by the formless realm obstruct the attainment of cessation.

original: de nas 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa nyon mongs pa 'gags pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
analyzed: de nas 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa nyon mongs pa 'gags pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
translated: The attainment of cessation arises simultaneously with the attainment of the cessation of affliction.

original: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye bzhin pa na /
translated: When the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of the path arises,

original: de rnams la tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang bcas pa 'dod pa na spyod pa lam gyis bsdus pa bag la nyal brgyad kyis thob pa gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang bcas pa 'dod pa na spyod pa lam gyis bsdus pa bag la nyal brgyad kyis thob pa gcod pa'o //
translated: the eight latent states of the path subsumed by the desire realm that are concomitant with the overesteeming of discipline and austerity are eliminated.

original: de nas lam la chos shes pa nyon mongs pa 'gags pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
analyzed: de nas lam la chos shes pa nyon mongs pa 'gags pa thob pa dang lhan cig tu skye'o //
translated: The Dharma knowledge of the truth of the path arises simultaneously with the attainment of the cessation of affliction.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba na /
translated: When the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path arises,

original: de rnams la khong khro ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: de rnams la khong khro ma gtogs pa /
translated: except for anger,

original: lam gyi gegs gzugs na spyod pa bdun dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa lam gyi gegs bdun te /
analyzed: lam gyi gegs gzugs na spyod pa bdun dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa lam gyi gegs bdun te /
translated: The fourteen latent states of the seven obstructions to the path that occur in the form realm and the seven obstructions to the path that occur in the formless realm.

original: bag la nyal bcu bzhi rnams kyis thob pa gcod pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal bcu bzhi rnams kyis thob pa gcod pa'o //
translated: These fourteen latent states cut off the attainment of the path of seeing.

original: mthong lam skad cig bco lnga 'di rnams ni mthong ba'i lam ste brgyad pa'i sa zhes so //
analyzed: mthong lam skad cig bco lnga 'di rnams ni mthong ba'i lam ste brgyad pa'i sa zhes so //
translated: These fifteen moments of the path of seeing are called the level of the eighth.

original: 'di la gnas pa'i gang zag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa zhes rnam par bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa'i gang zag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa zhes rnam par bzhag par bya'o //
translated: The person who abides in this is posited as one who has entered for the result of stream enterer.

original: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The sixteenth moment, the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, is the nature of the path of meditation.

original: 'di la gnas pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: One who abides in this is posited as a stream enterer.

original: @177b 'di las pha rol du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong la /
analyzed: @177b 'di las pha rol du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong la /
translated: Beyond this, one sees the truth of suffering and so on.

original: yang mthong ba'i don rtsol bas sgom pa dang / 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa tshol bar byed pas na bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: yang mthong ba'i don rtsol bas sgom pa dang / 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa tshol bar byed pas na bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of meditation is so called because one meditates on the meaning of what one has seen through exertion and because one seeks nirvana through this.

original: de 'ang 'dod pa'i khams su bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa rnams pa dgu sngon du bshad do //
analyzed: de 'ang 'dod pa'i khams su bar chad med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa rnams pa dgu sngon du bshad do //
translated: The nine aspects of the path of no obstacles that destroy the defilements in the realm of desire have been explained previously.

original: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga'i mthar thug pa spangs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga'i mthar thug pa spangs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa kho na ste /
translated: The stream-enterer has abandoned the five types of defilements of the realm of desire up to the fifth stage.

original: mi'i rigs nas rigs dang lha'i rigs nas rigs kyi rang bzhin gyis lan cig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i rigs nas rigs dang lha'i rigs nas rigs kyi rang bzhin gyis lan cig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: He is one who has entered into the fruit of the once-returner, who is of the nature of the family of men and the family of gods.

original: drug pa spangs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: drug pa spangs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: The once-returner has abandoned the sixth type.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid rnam pa bdun dang brgyad pa zad pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid rnam pa bdun dang brgyad pa zad pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: The one who has entered into the fruit of the non-returner has exhausted the seventh and eighth types of the once-returner.

original: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa zad pa na phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa zad pa na phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: The non-returner has exhausted the ninth type of defilement of the realm of desire.

original: de'i rjes su bsam gtan dang po'i sa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su bsam gtan dang po'i sa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: After that, he has exhausted the first type of defilement of the stage of the first absorption up to the seventh stage.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi sa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa brgyad pa tshun chad nyon mongs bdun cu gcig lam rnams bdun cu gcig gis zad par byas pa ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi sa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa brgyad pa tshun chad nyon mongs bdun cu gcig lam rnams bdun cu gcig gis zad par byas pa ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: The path of cultivation that eliminates the first seven of the eight afflictions of the stage of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is the path of entry to the result of arhatship.

original: nyon mongs pa dgu pa spong bar byed pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gang yin pa de ni bar chad med pa'i lam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dgu pa spong bar byed pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gang yin pa de ni bar chad med pa'i lam rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The path of cultivation that eliminates the eighth affliction is the vajra-like concentration, which is the uninterrupted path.

original: de rnams la bar bar du rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: de rnams la bar bar du rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad cu'o //
translated: In between those, there are eighty paths of liberation.

original: brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam ni btsal bar bya ba yin pas lam ste zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad cu rtsa gcig pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam ni btsal bar bya ba yin pas lam ste zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: The eighty-first path of liberation is the path to be sought, which is the knowledge of elimination.

original: zad pa shes pa yang dag par skyes pa na gang zag chung ngu'i 'bring mchog thams cad khams gsum la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yon gyi gnas su 'os pa'i dgra bcom par gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa yang dag par skyes pa na gang zag chung ngu'i 'bring mchog thams cad khams gsum la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yon gyi gnas su 'os pa'i dgra bcom par gyur pa nyid do //
translated: When the knowledge of elimination arises, all persons of small, medium, and great capacity become free from attachment to the three realms and become arhats worthy of offerings.

original: de la gang zhig mi g-yo ba'i chos can de ni zad pa shes pa'i de ma thag tu mi skye ba shes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de la gang zhig mi g-yo ba'i chos can de ni zad pa shes pa'i de ma thag tu mi skye ba shes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Among them, those who are immutable generate the knowledge of nonarising immediately after the knowledge of elimination.

original: nyan thos rnams kyis yang bcu ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis yang bcu ste /
translated: The sravakas have ten more:

original: 'di ltar / lhag mthong 'ba' zhig gi gnas skabs nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa dang / chos mchog gi gnas skabs rigs kyi sa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa ni brgyad pa'i sa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / lhag mthong 'ba' zhig gi gnas skabs nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa dang / chos mchog gi gnas skabs rigs kyi sa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa ni brgyad pa'i sa dang /
translated: Thus, the stage of bare insight is the stage of seeing white, the stage of the supreme mundane state is the stage of lineage, the path of entry to the result of stream entry is the eighth stage,

original: @178a * // rgyun du zhugs pa nyid ni mthong ba'i sa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa'i sa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni bsrabs pa'i sa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa'i sa dang /
analyzed: @178a * // rgyun du zhugs pa nyid ni mthong ba'i sa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa'i sa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni bsrabs pa'i sa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa'i sa dang /
translated: the stage of once-returner is the stage of thinning; the stage of the candidate for the fruit of non-returner;🔽the stage of non-returner is the stage of separation from passion; the stage of the candidate for the fruit of arhatship;

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa'i sa dang / dgra bcom pa ni byas pa srung ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa'i sa dang / dgra bcom pa ni byas pa srung ba'i sa'o //
translated: the stage of the arhat is the stage of guarding what has been done.

original: yang na nyan thos kyi sa la bdun ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang na nyan thos kyi sa la bdun ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Or else, the śrāvaka stages are seven:

original: rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa srung ba'i sa dang / srol du zhugs pa gsum gyi sa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa srung ba'i sa dang / srol du zhugs pa gsum gyi sa'o //
translated: the stage of lineage, the stage of the eighth, the stage of seeing, the stage of thinning, the stage of separation from passion, the stage of guarding what has been done, and the stage of the three candidates.

original: 'di ni rigs kyi 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs kyi 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the presentation of the śrāvaka stages.

original: gzhan dag ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni /
translated: Others say:

original: dang po 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod pas bsdus pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa drug spangs na /
analyzed: dang po 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod pas bsdus pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa drug spangs na /
translated: First, if one abandons the six aspects of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that are subsumed by the desire realm,

original: de'i rjes su zag pa med pa'i mthong lam skad cig ma bco lngas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su zag pa med pa'i mthong lam skad cig ma bco lngas /
translated: then subsequently, in fifteen moments of the uncontaminated path of seeing,

original: mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa mtha' dag rtsa ba nas bcad de /
analyzed: mthong bas spang par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa mtha' dag rtsa ba nas bcad de /
translated: one completely severs all the afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la lan cig phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la lan cig phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the sixteenth moment, the moment of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, one becomes a once returner.

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'di la /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa 'di la /
translated: In this presentation,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i rigs dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'i tha snyad med do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i rigs dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa'i tha snyad med do //
translated: there is no convention of one who has entered for the result of stream entry, the type of the result of stream entry, or one who has entered for the result of stream entry.

original: yang na dang po 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod pas bsdus pa'i sgom pa'i spang bya rnam pa dgu spangs nas /
analyzed: yang na dang po 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod pas bsdus pa'i sgom pa'i spang bya rnam pa dgu spangs nas /
translated: Or, first, if one abandons the nine aspects of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that are subsumed by the desire realm,

original: de'i rjes su zag pa med pa'i mthong lam skad cig ma bco lngas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su zag pa med pa'i mthong lam skad cig ma bco lngas /
translated: then subsequently, in fifteen moments of the uncontaminated path of seeing,

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa rnam pa mtha' dag rtsa ba nas bcad de /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa rnam pa mtha' dag rtsa ba nas bcad de /
translated: and all the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing are completely eradicated.

original: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba phyir mi 'ong ba'o //🔽rnam par gzhag pa 'di la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa rgyun du zhugs pa rigs nas rigs lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba bar chad gcig pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa
analyzed: bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba phyir mi 'ong ba'o // rnam par gzhag pa 'di la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa rgyun du zhugs pa rigs nas rigs lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba bar chad gcig pa phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i srol du zhugs pa
translated: On the sixteenth moment, the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, one becomes a nonreturner free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: rnams kyi tha snyad med do //
analyzed: rnams kyi tha snyad med do //
translated: In this presentation, there is no convention for stream enterers who are entering for the first time to the result of stream enterer, once returners who are entering for the first time to the result of once returner, or nonreturners who are entering for the first time to the result of nonreturner.

original: yang na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi khams gnyis la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi khams gnyis la 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur nas /
translated: Or, having become free from attachment to the two realms through the mundane path,

original: mthong lam gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs ma thag tu bcu drug @178b pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la khams gnyis la 'dod chags dang bral ba phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong lam gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa spangs ma thag tu bcu drug @178b pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la khams gnyis la 'dod chags dang bral ba phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Immediately after the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing on the path of seeing, one becomes a non-returner free from attachment to the two realms in the moment of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: de'i rjes su 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgus /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jig rten las 'das pa bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgus /
translated: After that, one generates the knowledge of elimination through the nine aspects of the supramundane path of meditation,

original: gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu sngon bzhin du spangs te zad pa shes pa skyed par byed do zhes pa ni sngon bzhin du thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu sngon bzhin du spangs te zad pa shes pa skyed par byed do zhes pa ni sngon bzhin du thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: abandoning the nine aspects of affliction included in the formless realm as before.

original: 'di kho na bzhin du dbang po 'bring po rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa yang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'di kho na bzhin du dbang po 'bring po rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa yang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: In the same way, those of medium faculty who are pratyekabuddha vehicle practitioners generate the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: de la'ang rim gyis ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de la'ang rim gyis ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for them to do this all at once.

original: 'di la 'bras bu la gnas pa dang srol du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni med do //
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu la gnas pa dang srol du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni med do //
translated: In this context, there is no convention of abiding in the result or entering the stream and so on.

original: gang 'dis ni stan gcig nyid la gnas nas thams cad rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'dis ni stan gcig nyid la gnas nas thams cad rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: By this, he accomplishes everything while remaining in one seat.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having completed the accumulations of merit and knowledge,

original: byang chub snying por byon pa nyid na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i khams nas bzung ste ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub snying por byon pa nyid na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i khams nas bzung ste ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na /
translated: having gone to the site of enlightenment, having become free from attachment to the desire realm up to the sphere of nothingness by means of the mundane path,

original: nges par gnon pa 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa mtha' dag spangs te /
analyzed: nges par gnon pa 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa mtha' dag spangs te /
translated: he definitely subdues, by means of the supramundane path of seeing, all the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, by means of the sixteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgus srid pa'i rtso  mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu spangs nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob bo //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa dgus srid pa'i rtso  mo'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu spangs nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob bo //
translated: And by means of the nine aspects of the path of cultivation, he abandons the nine aspects of the afflictions of the peak of existence, and he attains perfect enlightenment.

original: des na mthong lam skad cig ma bcu drug dang / bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dang / 'di rnams kyi bar bar du 'byung ba rnam par grol ba'i lam skad cig ma dgu ste sems kyi skad cig ma sum cu bzhis bla na med pa yang dag par sangs rgya'o //
analyzed: des na mthong lam skad cig ma bcu drug dang / bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dang / 'di rnams kyi bar bar du 'byung ba rnam par grol ba'i lam skad cig ma dgu ste sems kyi skad cig ma sum cu bzhis bla na med pa yang dag par sangs rgya'o //
translated: Therefore, one attains unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment in thirty-four moments of mind: sixteen moments of the path of seeing, nine uninterrupted paths, and nine liberated paths that occur between these uninterrupted paths.

original: chos mngon pa mdzod las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod las kyang gsungs te /
translated: The Abhidharmakośa states:

original: skad cig sum cu bzhis thob nyid //
analyzed: skad cig sum cu bzhis thob nyid //
translated: Attainment is in thirty-four moments.

original: ces so // 'di'i bye brag tu bshad pa las /
analyzed: ces so // 'di'i bye brag tu bshad pa las /
translated: And its commentary states:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skad cig sum cu bzhis rjes su 'thob po lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skad cig sum cu bzhis rjes su 'thob po lo //
translated: Bodhisattvas attain enlightenment in thirty-four moments.

original: bden pa'i mngon par rtogs pa bcu drug dang / srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral ba ste nyon mongs skye ba rnam pa dgu spang ba'i phyir bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu skye bas so //
analyzed: bden pa'i mngon par rtogs pa bcu drug dang / srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral ba ste nyon mongs skye ba rnam pa dgu spang ba'i phyir bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu skye bas so //
translated: This is because the sixteen moments of realizing the four truths and the nine uninterrupted and liberated paths that abandon the nine levels of affliction from the peak of existence to freedom from attachment to the desire realm arise.

original: des na sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there are thirty-four moments.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched la 'dod chag dang bral ba 'dis nges pa rnam par non pa na @179a * //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched la 'dod chag dang bral ba 'dis nges pa rnam par non pa na @179a * //
translated: Those free from attachment to the base of nothingness conquer the summit of existence.🔽

original: sa 'og ma ni spang byar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma ni spang byar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But when one is free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness, one is not able to abandon the lower stages.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: The great paṇḍita Daśabalaśrībhadra composed this chapter on the definitive order of the four noble truths from the Ascertainment of the Compounded and the Uncompounded.

original: // /'phags pa gnas brtan pa'i sde ba'i lung las 'di ltar rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: // /'phags pa gnas brtan pa'i sde ba'i lung las 'di ltar rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: The noble Sthavira tradition presents it in this way.

original: de la las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pas rga shi las grol bar 'dod pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyu yang dag par gcod pa don du gnyer ba dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel ba'i don du gnyer ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab thob pa don du gnyer pa rnams kyis gnas lnga la mkhas par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de la las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pas rga shi las grol bar 'dod pa dang / 'khor ba'i rgyu yang dag par gcod pa don du gnyer ba dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel ba'i don du gnyer ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab thob pa don du gnyer pa rnams kyis gnas lnga la mkhas par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: The yogi who is a beginner, who wishes to be liberated from old age and death, who seeks to completely eliminate the causes of saṃsāra, who seeks to dispel the darkness of ignorance, and who seeks to attain the wisdom of the āryas should generate expertise in five topics.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: phung po la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: expertise in the aggregates, expertise in the sense spheres, expertise in the elements, expertise in dependent origination, and expertise in the āryas’ truths.

original: de la phung po lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five aggregates are as follows:

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: the form aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the discernment aggregate, the formation aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni gnyis te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni gnyis te 'di ltar /
translated: The form aggregate is twofold:

original: 'byung ba chen po dang / 'byung ba chen po las byung ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dang / 'byung ba chen po las byung ba'i gzugs so //
translated: the great elements and the form derived from the great elements.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po la bzhi ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po la bzhi ni 'di ltar /
translated: The great elements are four:

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung ngo //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung ngo //
translated: earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: 'byung ba chen po las byung ba'i gzugs ni nyi shu nyer drug ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po las byung ba'i gzugs ni nyi shu nyer drug ste /
translated: The form derived from the great elements is twenty-two or twenty-six.

original: 'di ltar / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dang / bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang /
translated: the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, smell, taste, tactile objects, female faculty, male faculty, life faculty,

original: lus kyi rig byed dang / ngag gi rig byed dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / gzugs kyi spang ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'jam pa nyid dang / gzugs kyi las su rung ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / gzugs kyi rgyud dang /
analyzed: lus kyi rig byed dang / ngag gi rig byed dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / gzugs kyi spang ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'jam pa nyid dang / gzugs kyi las su rung ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / gzugs kyi rgyud dang /
translated: the bodily expression of intention, the verbal expression of intention, the space element, the smoothness of form, the malleability of form, the workability of form, the growth of form, the continuum of form,

original: gzugs kyi skye ba dang ; gzugs kyi rga ba dang / gzugs kyi mi rtag pa dang / khams kyi zas dang / dngos po'i ngo bo dang / gnyid do //🔽de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang nye bar bslang ba'i gzugs nyi shu nyer drug ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba dang ; gzugs kyi rga ba dang / gzugs kyi mi rtag pa dang / khams kyi zas dang / dngos po'i ngo bo dang / gnyid do // de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang nye bar bslang ba'i gzugs nyi shu nyer drug ste /
translated: the arising of form, the aging of form, the impermanence of form, the food of contact, the nature of things, and sleep.

original: gzugs sum cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs sum cur 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there are thirty types of form: the four great elements and the twenty derivative forms.

original: gzugs sum cu rnams rgyu lnga las bye brag tu gyur pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs sum cu rnams rgyu lnga las bye brag tu gyur pa shes par bya'o //
translated: The thirty forms should be understood as being distinguished by five causes.

original: @179b 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @179b 'di lta ste /
translated: It should be understood that the thirty material elements are distinguished on the basis of five causes.🔽What are the five causes?

original: kun slong dang / tshogs pa dang / skye ba dang / sna tshogs pa nyid dang / gcig nyid do //
analyzed: kun slong dang / tshogs pa dang / skye ba dang / sna tshogs pa nyid dang / gcig nyid do //
translated: They are: (1) motivation, (2) collection, (3) origination, (4) variety, and (5) unity.

original: de la kun slong ni bzhi ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la kun slong ni bzhi ste 'di ltar /
translated: Among them, motivation is fourfold:

original: las kyis kun du bslang ba dang / sems kyis kun du bslang ba dang / dus kyis kun du bslang ba dang / kha zas kyis kun du bslang ba'o //
analyzed: las kyis kun du bslang ba dang / sems kyis kun du bslang ba dang / dus kyis kun du bslang ba dang / kha zas kyis kun du bslang ba'o //
translated: (1) motivation by action, (2) motivation by mind, (3) motivation by time, and (4) motivation by food.

original: de la gzugs dgu ni las kyis kun du bslang ba ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la gzugs dgu ni las kyis kun du bslang ba ste 'di ltar /
translated: Among them, nine material elements are motivated by action, namely:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang / dbang po'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang / dbang po'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, femininity, masculinity, life faculty, and the material faculty.

original: gzugs gnyis ni sems kyis kun du bslang ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs gnyis ni sems kyis kun du bslang ba ste /
translated: Two material elements are motivated by mind, namely:

original: 'di ltar / lus kyi rig byed dang / ngag gi rig byed de //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lus kyi rig byed dang / ngag gi rig byed de //
translated: the informative action of the body and the informative action of speech.

original: gcig ni dus dang sems kyis kun du bslang ba ste sgra'o //
analyzed: gcig ni dus dang sems kyis kun du bslang ba ste sgra'o //
translated: Sound is derived from the primary elements that are appropriated and projected by the mind and time.

original: dus dang sems dang zas kyis kun du bslang ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: dus dang sems dang zas kyis kun du bslang ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: The four derived from the primary elements that are appropriated, projected by the mind and time, and projected by food are:

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi yang ba dang / gzugs kyi 'jam pa dang / gzugs kyi las su rung ba dang / gnyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi yang ba dang / gzugs kyi 'jam pa dang / gzugs kyi las su rung ba dang / gnyid do //
translated: lightness of form, softness of form, plasticity of form, and sleep.

original: dus dang las dang sems dang zas rnams kyis kun du bslang ba la bcu gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus dang las dang sems dang zas rnams kyis kun du bslang ba la bcu gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The twelve derived from the primary elements that are appropriated, projected by the mind, time, and food are:

original: gzugs kyi skye mched dang / dri dang / ro dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / gzugs kyi rgyud dang / gzugs kyi skye ba dang / kham gyi zas dang / sa'i khams dang / chu dang me dang rlung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched dang / dri dang / ro dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / gzugs kyi rgyud dang / gzugs kyi skye ba dang / kham gyi zas dang / sa'i khams dang / chu dang me dang rlung ngo //
translated: the form base, smell, taste, the space element, increase of form, continuity of form, arising of form, gross food, the earth element, and the water, fire, and wind elements.

original: gzugs gnyis ni gang gis kyang bslang ba ma yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs gnyis ni gang gis kyang bslang ba ma yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The two forms that are not derived from any of these are:

original: gzugs kyi rnyings pa dang / gzugs kyi mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnyings pa dang / gzugs kyi mi rtag pa'o //
translated: the aging of form and the impermanence of form.

original: 'on kyang skye ba'i rkyen las rga ba dang / rgas pa'i rkyen las mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba'i rkyen las rga ba dang / rgas pa'i rkyen las mi rtag pa'o //
translated: But aging is conditioned by birth, and impermanence is conditioned by aging.

original: tshogs pa ni las kyis kun nas bslang ba dgu tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni las kyis kun nas bslang ba dgu tshogs pa'o //
translated: The collection is the collection of the nine faculties that are motivated by karma.

original: 'di ltar / mig bcu dang / rna ba bcu dang / sna bcu dang / lce bcu dang / lus bcu dang / bud med dbang po bcu dang / dngos po bcu dang / skyes pa'i dbang po bcu dang / dngos po bcu dang / srog gi dbang po bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mig bcu dang / rna ba bcu dang / sna bcu dang / lce bcu dang / lus bcu dang / bud med dbang po bcu dang / dngos po bcu dang / skyes pa'i dbang po bcu dang / dngos po bcu dang / srog gi dbang po bcu'o //
translated: Thus, there are ten eyes, ten ears, ten noses, ten tongues, ten bodies, ten female sex organs, ten objects, ten male sex organs, ten objects, and ten life forces.

original: de la mig bcu zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la mig bcu zhes pa ni /
translated: Among them, ten eyes means

original: rab tu dang ba'i mig gi dngos por gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / gzi brjid dang / srog gi dbang po dang / mig gi rab tu dang ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba'i mig gi dngos por gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / gzi brjid dang / srog gi dbang po dang / mig gi rab tu dang ba'o //
translated: the four great elements that are the basis of the eye of clarity, color, smell, taste, luster, the life force, and the clarity of the eye.

original: chos bcu po 'di rnams gnas rnam pa tha dad med pa'i gong bu yin pas /🔽mig bcu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di rnams gnas rnam pa tha dad med pa'i gong bu yin pas / mig bcu zhes brjod do //
translated: These ten dharmas are a mass without a different location.🔽Therefore, they are called ten eyes.

original: mig bcu ni 'byung ba la ni skye ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mig bcu ni 'byung ba la ni skye ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The ten eyes are called birth in the elements.

original: rnyings pa la ni rga ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnyings pa la ni rga ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The aging of the old is called “old age.”

original: 'jig pa la ni mi rtag pa zhes brjod do //🔽yongs su chad pa ni nam mkha'i @180a * //
analyzed: 'jig pa la ni mi rtag pa zhes brjod do // yongs su chad pa ni nam mkha'i @180a * //
translated: The destruction of the destroyed is called “impermanence.”

original: khams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: khams zhes brjod do //
translated: The interruption of the interrupted is called “space.”

original: chos bzhi po 'di rnams ni /
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di rnams ni /
translated: These four dharmas

original: tshogs pa de'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa de'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: are the causes of the continuation of that collection.

original: yang mig bcu de nyid kyi rga ba'i dus su /
analyzed: yang mig bcu de nyid kyi rga ba'i dus su /
translated: Moreover, at the time of the aging of the ten eyes,

original: mig bcu de la brten nas mig bcu gnyis pa skye'o //
analyzed: mig bcu de la brten nas mig bcu gnyis pa skye'o //
translated: the twelve eyes arise in dependence on those ten eyes.

original: mig bcu de gnyis kyi 'dus pa de ni 'phel pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mig bcu de gnyis kyi 'dus pa de ni 'phel pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The coming together of those two sets of ten eyes is called “increase.”

original: gang de rnams kyi rjes su 'brel pa de ni rgyud ces brjod do //
analyzed: gang de rnams kyi rjes su 'brel pa de ni rgyud ces brjod do //
translated: That which is connected with them is called “series.”

original: sngar gyi skye ba la sogs pa bzhi dang / gnyis po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: sngar gyi skye ba la sogs pa bzhi dang / gnyis po 'di dag ste /
translated: The previous four, such as birth, and these two,

original: chos drug po 'di dag ni de rnams kyi rjes su 'jug byed yin no //
analyzed: chos drug po 'di dag ni de rnams kyi rjes su 'jug byed yin no //
translated: these six dharmas are the causes of their continuation.

original: yang mig bcu gnyis pa'i rga ba'i dus su /
analyzed: yang mig bcu gnyis pa'i rga ba'i dus su /
translated: Moreover, at the time of the aging of the twelve eyes,

original: mig bcu gnyis pa de la brten nas mig bcu ldan gsum pa skye'o //
analyzed: mig bcu gnyis pa de la brten nas mig bcu ldan gsum pa skye'o //
translated: the thirteen eyes arise in dependence on those twelve eyes.

original: gang gnyis pa'am gsum pa 'dus pa de ni 'phel ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gnyis pa'am gsum pa 'dus pa de ni 'phel ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The second and third moments are called growth.

original: gang de nyid kyi rjes su 'brel pa de ni rgyud ces brjod do //
analyzed: gang de nyid kyi rjes su 'brel pa de ni rgyud ces brjod do //
translated: The fourth moment is called continuity.

original: bcu ldan sngon ma'i 'jig pa dang / gnyis pa'i rga ba dang / gsum pa'i skye ba rnams dus gcig du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bcu ldan sngon ma'i 'jig pa dang / gnyis pa'i rga ba dang / gsum pa'i skye ba rnams dus gcig du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the first moment, the aging of the second, and the birth of the third occur simultaneously.

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i mig bcu ldan rnams la ni bar gcod dam go skabs mi shes te /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i mig bcu ldan rnams la ni bar gcod dam go skabs mi shes te /
translated: The eye with ten moments does not know the interval or the opportunity.

original: skad cig ni myur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ni myur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the moment is very brief.

original: sgron me'i 'od bzhin du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sgron me'i 'od bzhin du mthong ba'o //
translated: It is seen like the light of a lamp.

original: 'di ni mig bcu ldan zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni mig bcu ldan zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the eye with ten moments.

original: de bzhin du rna ba bcu ldan dang / sna bcu ldan dang / lce bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan dang / bud med kyi dbang po bcu ldan dang / skyes pa'i dbang po bcu ldan dang / dngos po bcu ldan dang / srog gi dbang po bcu ldan rnams rgyas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba bcu ldan dang / sna bcu ldan dang / lce bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan dang / bud med kyi dbang po bcu ldan dang / skyes pa'i dbang po bcu ldan dang / dngos po bcu ldan dang / srog gi dbang po bcu ldan rnams rgyas par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the ear with ten moments, the nose with ten moments, the tongue with ten moments, the body with ten moments, the female organ with ten moments, the male organ with ten moments, the life faculty with ten moments should be understood in detail.

original: de bzhin gzugs gzhan rnams kyi yang ci ltar rigs par rgyas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gzugs gzhan rnams kyi yang ci ltar rigs par rgyas par shes par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the other forms, as is appropriate.

original: 'dir mangs par 'gyur bas 'jigs pas bdag gis ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir mangs par 'gyur bas 'jigs pas bdag gis ma brjod do //
translated: Fearing excessive length, I will not write more here.

original: skye ba ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: skye ba ni 'di ltar /
translated: Birth is as follows:

original: mngal gyi skye ba'i skad cig la gzugs sum cu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngal gyi skye ba'i skad cig la gzugs sum cu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the moment of birth from the womb, thirty forms arise.🔽When a woman has ten faculties, she is born with ten forms.🔽When a man is born, he is born with ten faculties.

original: dngos po bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan dang / gang gi tshe bud med ni bud med kyi dbang po bcu ldan dang / yang na skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe skyes pa'i dbang po bcu ldan dang / ma ning rnams kyi ni gzugs nyi shu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan dang / gang gi tshe bud med ni bud med kyi dbang po bcu ldan dang / yang na skye bar 'gyur na de'i tshe skyes pa'i dbang po bcu ldan dang / ma ning rnams kyi ni gzugs nyi shu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When a neuter is born, twenty forms arise.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: dngos po bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan no //
analyzed: dngos po bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan no //
translated: the ten entities and the ten bodily parts.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rdzus skyes skye mched yongs su rdzogs pa'i skyes pa dang bud med rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rdzus skyes skye mched yongs su rdzogs pa'i skyes pa dang bud med rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su /
translated: In the desire realm, when a male or female who is born supernaturally and has complete sense spheres is born,

original: gzugs bdun cu 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs bdun cu 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: seventy forms arise.

original: 'di ltar / dngos po bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan dang / mig bcu @180b ldan dang / rna ba bcu ldan dang / sna bcu ldan dang / lce bcu ldan dang / gang tshe bud med yin pa na bud med kyi dbang po bcu ldan dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos po bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan dang / mig bcu @180b ldan dang / rna ba bcu ldan dang / sna bcu ldan dang / lce bcu ldan dang / gang tshe bud med yin pa na bud med kyi dbang po bcu ldan dang /
translated: Thus, when a being has ten faculties, it is a being with ten faculties.🔽When it is a female, it is a being with eleven faculties,

original: gang tshe skyes pa na skyes pa'i dbang po bcu ldan no //🔽ngan song rnams kyi rdzus skyes dmus long bud med ngam /
analyzed: gang tshe skyes pa na skyes pa'i dbang po bcu ldan no // ngan song rnams kyi rdzus skyes dmus long bud med ngam /
translated: when it is a male, it is a being with twelve faculties.🔽When beings are born supernaturally in the lower miserable destinies, they are born as a blind woman or man.

original: skyes pa rnams skye ba'i dus su gzugs drug cu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams skye ba'i dus su gzugs drug cu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: At the time of birth, sixty forms appear.

original: mig bcu ldan med pas so //
analyzed: mig bcu ldan med pas so //
translated: Because the eye with ten faculties is absent.

original: de bzhin du skye ba'i 'on pa rnams kyi ni gzugs drug cu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba'i 'on pa rnams kyi ni gzugs drug cu ste /
translated: Similarly, for those born deaf, sixty forms appear.

original: rna ba bcu ldan med pas so //
analyzed: rna ba bcu ldan med pas so //
translated: Because the ear with ten faculties is absent.

original: dmus long ma ning rnams kyi ni gzugs lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: dmus long ma ning rnams kyi ni gzugs lnga bcu ste /
translated: For those born blind and deaf, fifty forms appear.

original: mig bcu ldan dang / rna ba bcu ldan med pas so //
analyzed: mig bcu ldan dang / rna ba bcu ldan med pas so //
translated: Because the eye with ten faculties and the ear with ten faculties are absent.

original: ngan 'gro rdzus skyes skye mched rdzogs pa rnams dang bskal pa dang po pa'i mi rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su gzugs drug cu 'byung ste 'dod pa bcu ldan med pas so //
analyzed: ngan 'gro rdzus skyes skye mched rdzogs pa rnams dang bskal pa dang po pa'i mi rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su gzugs drug cu 'byung ste 'dod pa bcu ldan med pas so //
translated: When beings of the unfortunate realms, those born supernaturally, those with complete sense faculties, and humans of the first eon are born, they have sixty forms, because they do not have the ten forms of desire.

original: dmus long ma ning rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su gzugs lnga bcu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmus long ma ning rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su gzugs lnga bcu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the blind and eunuchs are born, they have fifty forms.

original: mig bcu ldan dang 'dod pa bcu ldan med pas so //
analyzed: mig bcu ldan dang 'dod pa bcu ldan med pas so //
translated: They do not have the ten forms of eyes and the ten forms of desire.

original: dmus long ma ning rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su yang lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: dmus long ma ning rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su yang lnga bcu ste /
translated: When the blind and eunuchs are born, they have fifty forms.

original: rna ba bcu ldan dang 'dod pa bcu ldan med pas so //
analyzed: rna ba bcu ldan dang 'dod pa bcu ldan med pas so //
translated: They do not have the ten forms of ears and the ten forms of desire.

original: ma ning dmus long 'on pa'i gzugs bzhi bcu ste /
analyzed: ma ning dmus long 'on pa'i gzugs bzhi bcu ste /
translated: Eunuchs, the blind, and the deaf have forty forms.

original: 'di ltar / dngos po bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan dang / sna bcu ldan dang / lce bcu ldan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos po bcu ldan dang / lus bcu ldan dang / sna bcu ldan dang / lce bcu ldan no //
translated: They have the ten forms of things, the ten forms of body, the ten forms of nose, and the ten forms of tongue.

original: tshangs pa rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su gzugs sum cu dgu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su gzugs sum cu dgu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: When Brahmas are born, they have thirty-nine forms.

original: dngos po bcu ldan dang / mig bcu ldan dang / rna ba bcu ldan dang / srog gi dbang po dgu ldan no //
analyzed: dngos po bcu ldan dang / mig bcu ldan dang / rna ba bcu ldan dang / srog gi dbang po dgu ldan no //
translated: The ten faculties of the eye, etc. are tenfold. The vital faculty is ninefold.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su gzugs dgu 'byung bar 'gyur te 'di ltar srog gi dbang po dgu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi skye ba'i dus su gzugs dgu 'byung bar 'gyur te 'di ltar srog gi dbang po dgu'o //
translated: In the realm of immateriality, at the moment of arising, nine material elements arise, namely, the vital organ and the eight faculties of consciousness.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid ni 'di ltar re zhig de srid du /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid ni 'di ltar re zhig de srid du /
translated: The variety of the material elements is explained.

original: gzugs la gnyis ni 'di ltar thogs pa dang bcas pa'i don gyis rags pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i don gyis phra mo'o //
analyzed: gzugs la gnyis ni 'di ltar thogs pa dang bcas pa'i don gyis rags pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i don gyis phra mo'o //
translated: The gross and subtle are explained in terms of resistance and non-resistance.

original: de la gzugs rags pa la bcu gnyis ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la gzugs rags pa la bcu gnyis ni 'di ltar /
translated: The gross material elements are twelve in number.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / sa'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / sa'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams so //
translated: The twelve gross material elements are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, odor, taste, earth element, fire element, and wind element.

original: gzugs phra mo la bco brgyad ni 'di lta ste /🔽gzhan srog gi dbang po la sogs pa gnyis kyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs phra mo la bco brgyad ni 'di lta ste /🔽gzhan srog gi dbang po la sogs pa gnyis kyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The subtle material elements are eighteen in number.🔽The eighteen subtle material elements are the ten material elements, the vital organ, the two sexual organs, the two universals, and the two particulars.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis ni 'di ltar /
translated: Moreover, there are two other types of form:

original: nang dang phyi rol lo //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol lo //
translated: internal and external.

original: de la yul dang bcas pa'i don gyis nang gi la rnam pa lnga ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la yul dang bcas pa'i don gyis nang gi la rnam pa lnga ni 'di ltar /
translated: Among them, the five types of internal form are those that are associated with the sense bases.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus so //🔽yul @181a * //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus so // yul @181a * //
translated: They are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: dang mi ldan pas na phyi rol ni rnam pa nyi shu lnga ste /
analyzed: dang mi ldan pas na phyi rol ni rnam pa nyi shu lnga ste /
translated: The twenty-five types of external form are those that are not associated with the sense bases.

original: 'di ltar / gzugs lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzugs lhag ma rnams so //
translated: They are the remaining forms.

original: gzhan yang gzugs la rnam pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs la rnam pa gnyis ni /
translated: Moreover, there are two types of form:

original: 'di ltar / dbang po'i gzugs dang / dbang po min pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dbang po'i gzugs dang / dbang po min pa'i gzugs so //
translated: sense-faculty form and non-sense-faculty form.

original: de la bdag po'i don gyis dbang po'i gzugs la brgyad ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la bdag po'i don gyis dbang po'i gzugs la brgyad ni 'di ltar /
translated: Among them, the eight types of sense-faculty form are those that are the sense faculties.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po'o //
translated: They are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, female sex organ, male sex organ, and life faculty.

original: dbang po dang mi ldan pa'i don gyis dbang po min pa'i gzugs la nyi shu nyer gnyis te 'di ltar /
analyzed: dbang po dang mi ldan pa'i don gyis dbang po min pa'i gzugs la nyi shu nyer gnyis te 'di ltar /
translated: The twenty-two types of non-sense-faculty form are those that are not the sense faculties.

original: gzugs lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs lhag ma rnams so //
translated: The remaining forms are the other eleven.

original: yang gzugs thams cad ni rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: yang gzugs thams cad ni rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
translated: Again, all forms are threefold:

original: zin pa'i gzugs dang / ma zin pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par phye ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: zin pa'i gzugs dang / ma zin pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par phye ba'i gzugs so //
translated: grasped form, non-grasped form, and differentiated form.

original: de la las las skyes pas zin pa'i gzugs la dgu ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la las las skyes pas zin pa'i gzugs la dgu ste 'di ltar /
translated: Grasped form is the nine forms that arise from action, namely,

original: dbang po'i gzugs brgyad dang / dngos po'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i gzugs brgyad dang / dngos po'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the eight forms of the sense faculties and the form of the essential constituents.

original: las las ma skyes pa'i don gyis ma zin pa'i gzugs la dgu ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: las las ma skyes pa'i don gyis ma zin pa'i gzugs la dgu ni 'di ltar /
translated: Non-grasped form is the nine forms that do not arise from action, namely,

original: sgra dang / lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / gzugs kyi yang ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'jam pa nyid dang / las su rung ba dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / gnyid do //
analyzed: sgra dang / lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / gzugs kyi yang ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'jam pa nyid dang / las su rung ba dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / gnyid do //
translated: sound, bodily manifest action, vocal manifest action, the lightness of form, the malleability of form, the wieldiness of form, aging, impermanence, and sleep.

original: gnyi ga yin pa'i don gyis rnam par phye ba'i gzugs la bcu gnyis ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: gnyi ga yin pa'i don gyis rnam par phye ba'i gzugs la bcu gnyis ni 'di ltar /
translated: Differentiated form is the twelve forms that are both, namely,

original: lhag ma gzugs bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs bcu gnyis so //
translated: the remaining twelve forms.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Again, there are three types of form:

original: 'di ltar / bstan du yod pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bstan du yod pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: visible form that is resistant, invisible form that is resistant, and invisible form that is non-resistant.

original: de la gegs byed pa'i don gyis bstan du yod cing thogs pa dang bcas pa ste gcig go //
analyzed: de la gegs byed pa'i don gyis bstan du yod cing thogs pa dang bcas pa ste gcig go //
translated: Among them, visible form that is resistant is one, because it is visible in the sense of being able to obstruct and it is resistant in the sense of being able to impede.

original: 'di ltar / gzugs kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzugs kyi skye mched do //
translated: Thus, it is the visible form base.

original: mthong du med pa'i don gyis dang gegs kyi don gyis bstan du med pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa la bcu gcig ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: mthong du med pa'i don gyis dang gegs kyi don gyis bstan du med pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa la bcu gcig ni 'di ltar /
translated: Invisible form that is resistant is eleven, because it is invisible in the sense of not being able to be seen and it is resistant in the sense of being able to obstruct.

original: gang gzugs rags pas gsungs pa la gzugs kyi skye mched ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs rags pas gsungs pa la gzugs kyi skye mched ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the ten form bases that are said to be gross, excluding the visible form base.

original: mthong du med pa dang gegs med pa'i don gyis bstan du med pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa la bco brgyad de 'di ltar /
analyzed: mthong du med pa dang gegs med pa'i don gyis bstan du med pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa la bco brgyad de 'di ltar /
translated: Invisible form that is non-resistant is eighteen, because it is invisible in the sense of not being able to be seen and it is non-resistant in the sense of not being able to obstruct.

original: gang phra mo'i gzugs su gsungs pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: gang phra mo'i gzugs su gsungs pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: Thus, it is the ten form bases that are said to be subtle, excluding the visible form base.

original: yang gzugs thams cad la rnam pa lnga ni 'di ltar rang @181b bzhin gyi gzugs dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzugs dang / yongs su chad pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: yang gzugs thams cad la rnam pa lnga ni 'di ltar rang @181b bzhin gyi gzugs dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzugs dang / yongs su chad pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Again, all forms are fivefold: natural form, transformed form, characteristic form, and interrupted form.

original: de la yongs su rdzogs pa'i don gyis rang bzhin gyi gzugs la dbye ba dgu bcu ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su rdzogs pa'i don gyis rang bzhin gyi gzugs la dbye ba dgu bcu ste /
translated: Among them, natural form is divided into ninety by the meaning of completion.

original: 'di ltar / gang rags pa'i gzugs su gsungs pa'i bcu gnyis po de dang ; bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang / chu'i khams dang / kham gyi zas dang / dngos po'i ngo bo dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang rags pa'i gzugs su gsungs pa'i bcu gnyis po de dang ; bud med kyi dbang po dang / skyes pa'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang / chu'i khams dang / kham gyi zas dang / dngos po'i ngo bo dang /
translated: Thus, the twelve that are said to be gross form, the female faculty, the male faculty, the life faculty, the water element, oral food, the nature of things,🔽and sleep.

original: gnyid do // rang bzhin gyi gzugs rnam par 'gyur ba'i don gyis rnam par 'gyur ba'i gzugs la bdun ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: gnyid do // rang bzhin gyi gzugs rnam par 'gyur ba'i don gyis rnam par 'gyur ba'i gzugs la bdun ni 'di ltar /
translated: Transformed form is seven by the meaning of transformation.

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / gzugs kyi yang ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'jam pa nyid dang / las su rung ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / gzugs kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / gzugs kyi yang ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'jam pa nyid dang / las su rung ba nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'phel ba dang / gzugs kyi rgyud do //
translated: workability of form,🔽increase of form,🔽and continuity of form.

original: 'dus byas kyi don gyis mtshan nyid kyi gzugs la gsum ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi don gyis mtshan nyid kyi gzugs la gsum ni 'di ltar /
translated: The form that is characterized by the meaning of the compounded has three aspects:🔽the arising of form,🔽the aging of form,

original: gzugs kyi skye ba dang / gzugs kyi rga ba dang / gzugs kyi mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba dang / gzugs kyi rga ba dang / gzugs kyi mi rtag pa'o //
translated: and the impermanence of form.

original: tshogs pa yongs su chad pa'i don gyis yongs su chad pa'i gzugs gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa yongs su chad pa'i don gyis yongs su chad pa'i gzugs gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The form that is characterized by the meaning of the limited has one aspect:

original: nam mkha'i khams so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams so //
translated: the space element.

original: 'dir rang bzhin gyi gzugs gang yin pa de'i yongs su chad pa yin gyi lhag ma ni yongs su ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin gyi gzugs gang yin pa de'i yongs su chad pa yin gyi lhag ma ni yongs su ma chad pa'o //
translated: Here, the limited aspect is that of the form that is by nature limited; the remaining forms are not limited.

original: gcig pa nyid kyi gzugs la ming mang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid kyi gzugs la ming mang du 'gyur te /
translated: The form that is characterized by the meaning of the single has many names.

original: 'di ltar / rgyu med pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu can dang / mi ldan pa dang / rkyen can dang / 'dus byas dang / 'jig rten pa dang / ro lta bu dang / kun du sbyor bar bya ba dang / mdud par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu med pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu can dang / mi ldan pa dang / rkyen can dang / 'dus byas dang / 'jig rten pa dang / ro lta bu dang / kun du sbyor bar bya ba dang / mdud par bya ba dang /
translated: Thus, it is not causeless, it has a cause, it is not associated, it is conditioned, it is compounded, it is mundane, it is like a corpse, it is to be bound, it is to be knotted,

original: rmongs par bya ba dang / sbyor bar bya ba dang / sgrib par bya ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / nye bar blang ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rmongs par bya ba dang / sbyor bar bya ba dang / sgrib par bya ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / nye bar blang ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang /
translated: it is to be deluded, it is to be applied, it is to be obscured, it is to be grasped as supreme, it is to be appropriated, it is afflicted, it is neutral, it is without an object,

original: sems pa med pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa dang / chung ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / ma nges pa dang / nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa dang / bde ba dang / ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: sems pa med pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa dang / chung ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / ma nges pa dang / nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa dang / bde ba dang / ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang /
translated: it is without thought, it is not associated with mind, it is small, it is of the desire realm, it is indeterminate, it is not leading to deliverance, it is happiness, it is associated with suffering,

original: 'phel ba  nyid du 'gro ba ma yin pa dang / 'grib pa nyid du 'gro ba ma yin pa dang / slob pa nyid ma yin pa dang / mi slob pa nyid ma yin pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'phel ba  nyid du 'gro ba ma yin pa dang / 'grib pa nyid du 'gro ba ma yin pa dang / slob pa nyid ma yin pa dang / mi slob pa nyid ma yin pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa dang /
